title: Lovely steel bridge
review: We really enjoyed walking through the jula. We are disappointed that numerous scooters and motorcycles have made this their highway. They have not patience and demand right of way. This needs to stop. Noticed a mother and child walking across the jula and scooters demanding they move. There was no place to move as it was very busy

title: Well maintained, joining two ends
review: The Jhula joins two ends of the city, it looks very beautiful in the evening with all the lights lit up.

title: Vacation time
review: Loved the bridge and the walk down to bridge via small alleyways surrounded with small shops. It was heavily windy at the bridge but a beautiful experience to walk across the mighty river Ganges! Full of people, walking, singing, dancing. It has the potential to develop as a beautiful hamlet like that of European county side fares, if the authorities and shopkeepers can invest a bit in cleanliness and order.

title: Fantastic views
review: The gangs and the Himalayas foothills adorn the temples,ashram,budget hotels,cafes,restaurant shops all can be seen from this beautiful pedestrian ..

title: Nice town for Panchakarma
review: I stayed in Tapovan, within walking distance to Laxman Jhula, for panchakarma at Maharishi Ayurveda. I enjoyed the ease of walking. Took a while to get used to the street etiquette. If you walk on the left side, let the cows do whatever they want, and have ear plugs for all the honking, the walks are enjoyable.

title: Fantastic views
review: The Ganges and the Himalayas foothills adorn the temples, ashrams, budget hotels, cafés, restaurants and shops, all can be seen from this beautiful pedestrian suspension bridge. Watch out for the fast motorcycles that are not supposed to be there.

title: Walking & Gawking
review: Look around and if you are careful/persistent you might get a good deal.traffic and honking horns are an irritant but can be ignored.do look out for hidden ashrams/temples.

title: Must Visit
review: Super view of mountains and ganga river .. love the german bakery here. sunset time is the best to have tea or coffee here. very peaceful place.

title: Unforgettable
review: This is like a very important vein in Rishikesh, a place where not only people, scooters, cows cross the bridge but also a place where the monkeys take place to watch the passing traffic. Never boring.

title: Awesome experience
review: Enjoyed lovely people and movements of Jhula

title: Hanging Bridge on Ganges River
review: It is a very beautiful bridge on Ganga River and lots of temple and restaurant nearby to have a good time.

title: Scenic suspension bridge
review: We visited the place early in the morning. The place is very scenic and the feeling was very spiritual with a lot of temples and yoga ashrams on both sides of the holy river

title: Enjoyed
review: Enjoyed. It's nice to be at Laxman during the evening hours. The environment looks very nice and calm.

title: Lovely view but watch out for the bikes
review: The bridge provides access and lovely views on either side if the Ganges River.its pretty at night when it lights up. But beware of the passing bikes as this bridge is not only used by pedestrians.

title: Astonishing beauty!!!
review: Astonishing beauty!!!

title: Meditation
review: This is the place where u can find lot of yoga centres and meditation centres and cafes on both side of the Jhula which serve every kind of vegetarian food and u can sit and relax have a view of river Ganga and can go to the banks to meditate and have peace in life. In the evening we can go to the nearby ashram where Ganga Aarti use to happen every evening from 5 pm and it is famous throughout the world so this place is must visit for people who came for peace and yoga.Best to time visit is in morning and evening.

title: Visited with friends for some leisure out of work and the trip was just wow.Rishikesh is the place to visit for everyone
review: Visited with friends for some leisure out of work and the trip was just wow.Rishikesh is the place to visit for everyone

title: Beautiful bridge.
review: Very well decorated and well maintained bridge...

title: Pool between West and East side of Rishikesh
review: Good view of ganga river

title: Ancient bridge in Rishkesh
review: Together with Ram Jhula, Lakshman Jhula connects the both sides of Ganga in Rishkesh Lakshaman Jhula was completed in 1929. One of the ancient temples of Rishikesh, Lakshman temple, is located right beside the bridge. As per the legends, Lakshman temple was the place where Lakshman meditated to attain enlightenment. Many people even believe that the jute bridge, now known as Lakshman Jhula, was constructed by Lord Ram, brother of Lakshman.

title: You have not experienced Rishikesh unless you have walked this landmark  suspension bridge!
review: We walked this bridge crossing from one side of the Ganges to the other on our first day of arrival - what a culture shock and wonderful experience!! Mopeds, monkeys, cows, donkeys, dogs and of course people all occupied this fairly narrow bridge, with the hooting mopeds clearly having right of way!

title: Visit to Rishikesh Haridwar
review: It's at Rishikesh. A bridge on the river Ganga where only two wheeler and people are allowed to walk. While you are walking on the bridge it has effect of jhula ie swing. You can see mountains and river Ganga from the place. Nice place.

title: Incredible bridge
review: Bridge is almost busy all the time people are passing by walk and by bike and its nice to see cow are relaxing  in the bridge some time.

title: Love the view
review: The view on Lakshman Jhula is good, you can see the holy Ganga river and all the houses& ashrams alongside the river.

title: Iconic Landmark
review: Regardless the travel/sightseeing plans, one will not pass Lakshman Jhula while in Rishikesh and probably won't even coubt multiple crossings of this busy iconic bridge that connects Tapovan area with the other side of Ganges adorned by numerous temples, shops and eateries. Enjoy the stunning views and watch out the cheeky monkies waiting to take a hold of your snacks faster than you think!

title: First view
review: First thing you would want to do afyer reaching this Holy place. The feeling of walking over this bridge is incomparable. And below you can watch holy Ganga flowing with peace.

title: Beautiful site
review: I was staying in Aloha and decided to walk to Laxman jhula by the banks of Ganges... What a beautiful site.. it's a must visit site in Rishikesh.. Across Ganges it has big market having some good cafe's and souvenir shops. It's a nice walk on bridge....Stand there for a while and feel Breeze...

title: Hanging Suspension bridge
review: Very old Suspension hanging bridge is basically connection between Rishikesh, Tapovan and Swargashram across Ganga River. It’s hestorical bridge in the name of Laxman.

title: Beautiful Ganges view
review: Loved walking on this bridge. Be prepared to join the throngs of people, two wheelers and monkeys while you cross this hanging bridge. The monkeys aren’t the friendly sort, best to let them be. There are rows of shops once you cross over the bridge. You can buy food stuff, beautiful bags, clothes, etc.

title: It's s bridge
review: Yes that's right, it's a bridge. A suspension bridge. A suspension bridge that goes from one side of the Ganges river to the other. Yip, it's s bridge.

title: The feel - bliss
review: The feel is absolutely eternal while walking over the bridge. It is crowded by tourists most of the time. But simply divine experience.

title: Laxman jhula
review: Its a bridge with some history.Nothing much to explore apart from few clicks.If staying in Rishikesh..better to visit early hours before the traffic sets in.

title: Worth visit
review: A pool is made many decades back with interesting mythological story of god Ram. Beware of monkeys there if you carry food with you they will literally attack on you to get the food.

title: Its the ancient one with mesmerizing location.
review: We were mesmerized to see the beauty of Ganges while standing on this bridge. You can also cross it using 2 wheeler.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: Loved the bridge and the walk down to bridge via small alleyways surrounded with small shops. It was heavily windy at the bridge but a beautiful experience to walk across the mighty river Ganges! Full of people, walking, singing, dancing.

title: Astonishing
review: I loved this place.

title: Good Place
review: Place is very nice and from the bridge, you can have an awesome view of nature and nearby ancient temples/buildings

title: Does the job to cross the river
review: Since this bridge and Ram Jhula are the only two bridges in the area to cross the river, you don’treally have many options. But it gets the job done.

title: Unique experience
review: We walked down the joola after the Aarthiand a cup of tea en route. It started to drizzle and was quite dark( around) 7 pm. The joola was lit up, the rain, the darkness, the lights, the temple chants, traffic added to the enchanting experience of walking on the bridge.. The slight sway due to the weight of people and the two wheelers adds to the charm of this unique joola, that connects the two ghats. You can either choose to walk both ways or take a ferry ride one way. We experienced both which made the visit memorable.

title: Lakshman jhula
review: Situated nearby Ram jhula, this bridge is small when compared with the ram jhula. Looks amazing when lit up in the night.

title: Best View of Temples
review: Rishikesh visit near to my heart. Loved visiting to Rishikesh as Solo Traveler and enjoying it's beauty.

title: Must visit place
review: This is a must visit place in Rishikesh and so beautiful place. I'm sure that travellers will have great experience here.

title: One of great experience
review: You need to visit it to experience the view. Joins the two banks of river Ganges and is hanging bridge.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: Lakshman Jhula is a incredible place to visit in Rishikesh area. Surrounded by the foothills of the Himalayas. Unique Spiritual atmosphere with the mystical Ganga river. Many options for accommodation around the area, as well as yoga courses, meditation and more.

title: Beautiful place
review: Lakshman Jhula is a very nice place. I just love this place. The best part of this place is when the vehicle crosses the bridge it shakes.Must visit.

title: MOTHER GANGA VIEWS
review: Although the bridge is very busy, the views of mother Ganga are breath taking watching the water flow is mesmerising

title: Spiritual
review: This is the place one should not miss at any cost if he/she is in rishikesh. The Feeling to cross the  river Ganges is amazing. This is a short bridge compared to ram jhula. Worth the visit!

title: awesome

Just watch those hungry monkeys they can be very aggressive and will grab stuff right out of your hands. Sill very enjoyable and part of the raw Indian experience, love it!

title: layman jhula rishikesh
review: amazing bridge. it swings in the air...very good feel. The jhula was built many years ago in memory of Lord laxman. I feel so proud standing on the bridge and enjoying breathtaking views of the holi river ganga.

review: Currently staying in Lakshman Jhula, instead of the main area of Rishikesh. It is quieter, and i find easier to interact with locals.

title: Nice hanging bridge
review: It is a nice hanging bridge... build in 1980s... only prblm is the allowance of 2 wheelers... one can't walk properly, peacefully & calmly through this bridges due to 2 wheelers... best time to visit is early morning or late night... best place to enjoy the beauty of Ganges & sun rise... must visit

title: The stunning bridge of Rishikesh
review: Laxman Jhula is a great bridge to click pictures and make videos. This is one sure shot place to come in your way once you are in rishikesh. The bridge connects two villages and the view is soooo beautuful . The lights which turned on in the evening adds so much to its beauty that you can spend hours and hours looking at it and not get bored. I happend to visit this place for the first time and i was awstruck by its beauty. The river ganga which flows beneath the river is also so adorable . Overall this is a beautifully made structure which shakes and is scary at the same time ..

title: nice location but barely meet hyped expectation
review: this is old bridge on gangaji.  place is nice. when you see photographs on Instagram you have some great expectation about this place. which it failed to meet.

title: Food consultation and dining
review: Guest had food consultation and dined after that. Food was sumptuous as per the guest. Thank you for dining with us.

title: Very old and ancient bridge for pilgrimage
review: This Rope Bridge was installed long back to help pilgrims to cross River Ganga to go to Holy Shrines of Badrinath and Kedarnath . Even now it is great attraction for tourists to visit and move around and enjoy the flowing of the river.

title: Divine Intervention on the Jhula
review: Highly recommend Lakshman Jhula at 1AM where it is moon lit , no people , chill in the air and you are right in the middle on the Ganges . Just a quite walk on the bridge with an environment like this is surely to give you an experience which is out of the world "literally" . The closest you can come to divine intervention . We just happened to reach at that time by pure luck , but that experience stole the show .

title: Nice
review: Clam place  And spiritual ambience from every where hope to visit soon for pure air and feel maa Ganga ...

title: Must visit attraction
review: I visited Laxman jhula yesterday. A cool breeze was blowing with Ganga maa.. really an incredible experience it was.

title: A must visit
review: Laksham Jhula is a must visit when you plan a holy trip to Rishikesh.

title: Beautiful
review: Very old and beautiful jhula which swings as you walk . beautiful walk with cows and monkeys which really look very nice feeling of being in India

title: Way far from "it's just a bridge"!
review: It's India meshed in some meters.  Monkeys, selfies, cows, motorbikes up and downs... Totally worths visiting!

title: If only there were no vehicles
review: View is beautiful, and very nice for yoga and stuff, I’m sure. But it’d be so much better if you could walk 10 steps without getting impatiently harassed by motorcycle and car horns. It kind of contrasts with the peace of the place. I’ve been there several times, I quite enjoy the view though.

title: Nice experience
review: One of the main attraction . Evening time lighted .only thing which disappoint is two wheeler passing by .

title: Crowded, And Fun, Just Like Rishikesh!
review: Glad we took the fun, crowded, somewhat wobbly walk across this bridge, which offers views of nearby temples, markets and, of course, the holy Ganga. You will cross over from one "village" to the next (most people consider these two sides to simply be extensions of Rishikesh) with monks, cows, fellow travelers, folks in a big hurry, folks stopping to take selfies and nearly losing their toes to beeping motorbikes. Sounds a lot like the town of Rishikesh, itself! If you go off to the right after crossing the bridge, and walk along the lane that parallels the river towards the Ram Jhula, you will see the "back road" sights of artists painting, monks AND monkeys chatting, tiny ashrams, and just simple quietude in this otherwise, busy big town.

title: River before sunrise at laxman jhula
review: Would recommend to visit the ghats before sunrise. The rivers and adjoining ghats are a completely different place before sunrise.The noise of the blowing wind and the deep silences between the splashes of river water is simply amazing.

title: Place to stop and spend time
review: Since we were passing Rishikesh hence spending time at Lakshman Jhula is must along with some have a look of clean water of Holy river Ganga.. It was beautiful time spending with family

title: One of the jhulas(hanging bridge) across river Ganges
review: Place is really crowded,but a gud place to walk and shop.very difficult to walk as two wheeler rush out

title: Laxman Jhula Rishikesh
review: We have 2 Healing schools located in Tapovan Laxman Jhula Rishikesh.

title: Scenic view is awesome
review: One of prime destination in Rishikesh , scenic view of ganga maa is breathtaking , must visit destination .

title: The western side
review: There are three areas in Rishikesh – downtown, virtually all local people, Ram Jhula and Lakshman Jhula.  I saw far more Westerners in Lakshman Jhula Than in town or on the Sivananda side of Ram Jhula.  It is very accessible, scenic, comfortable and fun. Have a lunch at the divine Ganga hotel and take the elevator down To the river.

title: W The Lakshman Jhula is a famous hanging bridge across the river Ganges!
review: The Lakshman Jhula is a famous hanging bridge across the river Ganges! The entire bridge is made up of iron, is 450 feet long and is situated at the height of 70 feet from the river. The Lakshman Jhula is extremely well known amongst tourists because of the rich mythological associations that are connected with the bridge. It is widely believed that Lord Lakshman, the younger brother of Lord Rama, had crossed the river Ganga at this same site, where the bridge now majestically stands for all to see.The construction of the bridge was completed in the year 1929, and presently, the Lakshman Jhula acts as an adjoining bridge across the river, along with the old route to the sacred shrines of Badrinath and Kedarnath. In the present day scenario, the Lakshman Jhula is visited by thousands of tourists each year not just because of its ancient origins and religious sanctity, but also due to the recent developments that have taken place around the bridge. Grand temples and famous markets have sprung up in the vicinity, and the entire area is a now a particularly renowned attraction in entire Rishikesh. Must visit! Be aware that Motorcycle on the bridge can be quite irritating! This attraction is free!

title: Walking over the Ganga
review: I shall save the statistics for the Wiki and other friends, who have already provided inputs. I shall share our experience.

title: Different feeling at different hours of a day.

title: The Spiritual Connection between Rishikesh & The World
review: No visit to Rishikesh is complete without a visit to Lakshman Jhula. Its very akin to being the birthmark of Rishikesh or even Devbhoomi Uttarakhand. This beautifully chaotic suspension bridge, is not only a vital passenger bridge between the Tehri and Pauri sides of the Ganga, its also a symbol of hope and prosperity this region has seen over the last few decades. Be ready to have an interesting walk across the bridge, with an unending stream of humans, peacefully relaxing cows, a string of two wheelers crossing over from both sides, street vendors try to sell pellets of flour for feeding the fish in the Ganga below, and the occasional selfie freaks trying to make space for themselves amidst the chaos.

title: Poor infrastructure; horrible experience
review: Crossing this bridge takes very very long. Indian tourists who doesn't care about others will block the way by taking selfies every now and then. And, sometimes a cow would sit and rest in the middle of the bridge. I don't know why despite all this the authorities allow bikes and scooters to pass through. Overall horrible experience. I don't understand what's the point of keeping this old bridge that isn't convenient. Even the lights don't work at night.They should immediately build a new and big bridge and upgrade the infrastructure.

title: Must Visit
review: Lakshman Jhula is definately a place to add to your travel plan... it has a chilled little village vibe with heaps going on.. great atmosphere.. great food.. great views of the Ganga!!! Reminded me of Nepal which was another bonus... I would highly recommend this place to travelers heading north!!

title: reishikesh
review: The city is amazing on both sides of Ganges. the water is cold so if you go in for a sacred dip make sure you have a towel. The far side of the ganges across from reishikish is a national forest and wildlife preserve. I was lucky enough to stay on a small ashram facing the river and in the morning you could see lots of monkeys, elephants and even a tiger. Lukshman Juwala has two foot bridges going to the other side where there are several streets of hostels hotels restaurants ashrams and everything imaginable to buy for tourists. You get a jeep ride to the  top of the mountain where there is a village with an amazing Shiva temple which has all the figures which are hundreds painted on the outside. Great amazing way through the forest with incredible views of the the valley , river, and lots of monkeys...There are many famous ashrams in rishikesh and outside of the city. The evening puja (religious ceremony) on the Ganges is a must. There is also a very nice walkway along the southern bank of the ganges. For good food walk across the bridge to the north side.

title: OK for the first time
review: I was there in the summer holiday season and it was beautiful to have the views. But unfortunately it is also a road used by the locals using two-wheeler bikes to commute. So it gets a bit too crowded with tourist, local people and the monkeys.

title: Breathtaking, quieter, pleasant!
review: In comparison to Ram Jhula, Lakshman Jhula is less crowded. However, you won't be disappointed with the staying and eat-out options here. Some of the things to do - Visit 13 floor temple, eat out at quaint cafes and spend peaceful evenings by attending the evening prayer and sitting by the stairwells of the Ganga river.

title: Astride the Ganges
review: The view of the river from this foot bridge is indeed overwhelming especially in the Monsoon when the Ganga rages downhill. There is a lot of selfies happening but the antics of the monkeys are most amusing. Be careful as they will snatch food and relish it right in front of you...much to the amusement of all.

title: Good Place for a dip in Ganges
review: The bridge offers a good view of the city, however is smaller in comparison to Ram Jhula. There are banks where you can go with your family to take a dip in the river Ganges

title: Great point of reference in Rishikesh
review: Lakshman Jhula is a very important reference point in Rishikesh. Beautiful and full of monkeys that will be ready to steal your bananas :)

title: Nice walkway on Ganga Ji
review: Lakshman Jhoola is a major attraction at Rishikesh, nice walk

title: Be careful!
review: It could be a great spiritual experience; but it is not. There are hundreds of people, 2-3 cows, monkeys over head and in between all this mess - motorbikes honking their hearts out to and fro!  The great Ganges flows unhindered in this chaos,exactly as it has done for centuries in this country.

title: A narrow historic bridge across the Ganges!
review: Lakshman Jhula connects both the banks of the Ganges, similar to the Ram Jhula situated 2 km away. The bridge per se is very narrow and only humans, bikes and cows are allowed. The bridge vibrates most of the time and you can feel the bridge moving. Make sure to accompany elder person in this bridge as they may need help when cows or bikes roam the bridge.

title: Glorious Ganga below this colorful suspension bridge!
review: This is an amazing place.  Magical really.  Take the time to be here and take in all the sights and sounds.  Just watch out for the Monkeys!  They will swoop in and take your food so eat elsewhere!  Cows, Bulls, Mules, Monkeys and dogs frequent this bridge daily. Beautiful views of Ganga Maa.

title: Fascinating place!
review: Lots of great shopping and cafes. Also lots of action activities to enjoy. It was a bit too hot for us in June, but most other seasons would be lovely.

title: Hustle bustle
review: This is the magic bridge of Laxmajhula . you can see cow monkey scooter all are going to here to there same time.

title: Stand on the Ganges
review: Experience the cool breeze standing in the middle while the suspension bridge fidgets. A beautiful area all around to eat and shop. foreign tourists throng the place here.

title: Must visit place
review: The bridge was built by the Britishers in 1928. The bridge is still strong and carries a lot of people and vehicles every day. Its very crowded, but the people here are very decent. The view from the bridge of the magnificent Ganges is great. There is a place beneath where you can take bath too. Please be careful when taking bath as the river can get rough any minute.

title: The Famous Laxman Jhulla
review: Laxman Jhulla is an iron suspension bridge across the river Ganges. Pedestrian bridge but also used by two wheelers. It was crowded when visited. Be careful of monkeys as they might snatch your things!

title: Beautiful suspension bridge
review: visited rishikesh during chardham tour, After visiting laxman temple we crossed the ganga river through Laxman Jhula, It is a suspension bridge, always crowded,Beautiful view.

title: a most popular place in rishikesh...
review: market is good, and most popular place to visit in rishikesh...

title: Great
review: Its beautiful to see river ganga from this laxman jhula..stand in the centre and enjoy the lovely view,.Amazing.

title: A monument buit over the river Ganges
review: A nice bit of technology used without any supports from below mainly used for pedestrian & two wheeler movement crossing to either side of the river banks.

title: Swing swing
review: To cross ganges you use this jhula. Due to holidays it was crowded and as you walk it swings. Nice Jhula

title: Nice jhula
review: Very nice swinging jhula as you walk on it . It is for crossing Ganges going other side . There are lots of shops and temples there

title: Cable Bridge on the River Ganga
review: Usually crowded as locals as well as tourists use it to get across the river , people on bikes as well use the bridge , tourists usually crowd the place for pictures n selfies , has a nice view of the river and was told it's closed between 6 PM to 9 PM for 2 wheelers but that wasn't the case so it could be seasonal thing

title: Awesome
review: Have been in Rishikesh and Love to spend time here. With the wind flowing over the Ganga river you feel the peace and calmness inside you. There are lots of cafe on the other side of jhula where you can spend your time relaxing.

title: Spiritual retreats
review: I came here thanks to lord shiva make this possible is a amazing place great energy who comes to stay in your soul tis bridge is over the Ganga holy river close around the himalaya mountain. If you looking for special and divine experience don't hesitage. Namaste.

title: Too crowdy yet must visit
review: If u are in rishikesh then laxman jhoola can not take second seat. You have to pass on the jhoola and take time to sit near gangaji. You will feel treat for your heart with spiritual feelings and definitely motivation for the life , from which you took the break , to live with more energy, consistency, performance and keeping yourself passioned...

title: Too crowded
review: While this suspension bridge is layered with a tar road, it is used by humans, monkeys and two-wheelers. The locals say that in absence of a dedicated bridge between the two sides, they have no choice but to cross the bridge over their bikes. As a result, it being a suspension bridge, whenever a bike crosses, the bridge shakes (a little bit - quite a thrill actually)

title: What a view from here
review: Just amazing view I’ve seen from this bridge. Only walking and motorbikes fit into the bridge because of its narrow size. So often packed and jam only because of cows on the bridge, but this is Rishikesh, just enjoy it.

title: Bridge without pillers.
review: It is a interesting bridge which had no pullers hanging from two ends on the holy river Ganga.

title: Interesting location
review: An extension bridge connecting the two banks of river. Busy bridge with locals crossing two and fro. You can see rafters below in the water. Cows crossing freely. The sun was setting at the time we went. An experience of a lifetime.

title: A swinging bridge on Ganges
review: A famous old suspension bridge which sways when you walk over it. Is crowded and narrow. Also a new Ram jhoola /bridge , similar to this, has been  built and nearer to main city

title: It's a suspension bridge
review: It's a suspension bridge  which give nice changes view . U can visit ganga atri and lakshman bridge also can take shared taxi for neelkanth temple

title: biggest landmark here
review: the swinging laxman jhula which is said to be constructed by british engineers in 1930s when an indian devotee donated lakhs of silver rupee coins

title: Suspension bridge!!
review: This is a suspension bridge to cross the river Ganga which could otherwise be possible on a ferry when the water level is not high (rainy season).the banks and the ghats are kept clean by maintenance warriors and  a perfect place to take a holy dip! Street food is yumm and so is the food great at Geeta bhawan!!

title: nice location with ganga
review: visited here with ram jhula for aarti . crowded but best for holiday lovers .enjoyed ganga aarti session with maa ganga

title: awesome place
review: too crowded and the pull is full of vehicles passing like the bikes are allowed to cross their ways on the bridge which is a demerit since it creates a jam on the pull itself but yet its an awesome experience

title: Must visit place in Rishikesh
review: Memorizing view from rafting under the bridge. Magnificent temple adds the beauti to Laxman Jhula . Best time to Visit is evening, go for Ganga Aarti.. Then after cross the well lited bridge and around in the market.

title: My favorite side of Rishikesh
review: It's the quietest, most peaceful side of Rishikesh. Love the Main Street and all the little shops. It's much slower paced than Topovan, that's for sure!

title: Good
review: The walk on the suspension bridge was really cool. It would have been awesome had there been no two wheelers on Lakshman Jhula.

title: The Iconic Bridge of RIshikesh
review: It is one of the most popular place in rishkesh. All major areas are accessible from this place. One can enjoy the adventure activities in the Ganga river below this bridge. Many films have been shot here.eg sonu ki titu ki sweetys song

title: Beautiful
review: You just can't miss this in rishikesh! The breeze, the view everything! And the best part is, it's always busy

title: not the original bridge
review: this is a new bridge constructed beside the place where the old one actually stood, it is painted in the colours of the indian flag and is a modern structure instead of the old wooden rickety structure

title: must see
review: The bridge is one of the must-see things in Rishikesh, with stores and people all around. We sat on the rocks by the Ganga under the bridge and watched people rafting in the river. Bridge was a little scary to walk on with cows and motorcycles crossing too, but worth the sights of the mountains and river

title: Sunset point
review: I would say you should visit here in the evening. At this time you will feel cold air and the view of ganga is so fascinating from here. If u visit this place, you should also try some dishes at nearby cafes and restaurants which are budget friendly.like German bakery cafe, ganga view cafe, the little Buddha cafe, chotiwala restaurant to name a few.

title: Iconic but majorly crowded
review: A Rishikesh visit, without crossing the Ganga River over it's most popular suspension bridge, is incomplete. Welcome to the Lakshman Jhula! The gently swaying with the steps of the visitors, the calm and serene Ganga flowing under is a solace to the tired mind and body. Beautiful views, the multiple temples and Ashrams along its banks, the rafts over the Ganga waters and the Boats ferrying the devotees across the river, make it a picturesque sight. The crowds over the bridge, slowing walking across, tourists clicking pictures and the motorbikes that are officially allowed to use the bridge, do strike a discordant note at times. All in all, do visit, be patient and just focus on the nature and spirituality in the air!

title: Ganga
review: nice pure and cold water of Ganga to dip in

title: Windy views
review: A sense of being in an ancient place grips you when you 1st glimpse the delicate structure. As you traverse its length, you are wowed by the beauty of the scenery. The shimmering Ganga beneath, the serene green hills on either side, the bright temples lining the banks, their bells chime across the waters; as you take in these scenes and the gulls swoop down, a deep sense of peace and reverence envelops. You feel calm and relaxed even as the colourfully dressed crowds keep crossing and intermittently posing for selfies on the bridge.

title: Good View
review: Lakshmi hula is a good and worthy place to visit but Two wheeler allowed. However its full of Beggars and Bikers Honking.

title: A delightful wonder
review: Lakshman Jhula is a suspension bridge which connects two opposite sides of Rishikesh. If ur staying in d tapovan area, u'll need to access this bridge to go on d other side. It's amazing how this Jhula has been standing for so many years transporting people. Two wheelers are allowed to move on this bridge. Most of the time U'll find cows lazing around. Crossing this bridge is an experience in itself. Don't miss walking on the bridge when in Rishikesh

title: Added attraction
review: Went to lakshman jhula, spent about 15min, took some pictures and came back, wanted to do guided tour but time did not permit, but iconic lakshman jhula is worth a visit if you hv time

title: amazed
review: we enjoyed every moment being there. we'll go again on our next visit.best part was the view from the view. food was also delicious to have.

title: Suspension Bridge
review: One of the most travel attractions is this Laxman Jhula. It has a mythological story mentioned in Ramayana. It was fun to cross the bridge though have to be beware of monkeys. Better not to carry anything in hand and keep children with you.

title: Amazing swing
review: One of the major attraction of rishikeh , excellent view from the swing, you can see river rafting.

title: A good visit
review: Quite better than ram jhula. Less crowd.sways a bit when crowded. Good views of Ganga river from top.

title: Cool
review: The bridge gives very religious vibes. It is facinating and it was a great experience looking at the view while walking through it. It swings actually when you walk

title: The Epicenter of Rishikesh
review: A brilliant Suspension bridge in Rishikesh(Tapovan) and u can take a breathtaking view of ganga from it. There are many mandirs and ghats near it. Namely Tehra Manzil.

title: Special place
review: It's a commercial spot, but I totally loved it.

title: Must visit
review: If you really want to enjoy this place, then come here early morning. Visitors are very less at that time. You can actually enjoy it with cool breeze in the morning with beautiful view of River ganga, Mountains and Rishikesh city. This place is very famous and a must visit if you plan for Rishikesh.

title: A colorful walk.
review: Lakshman jhulla is a hanging bridge over the river Ganges. It is hardly a km long. I found the walk on the bridge very hurried and tiresome because of the crowd and two wheeler traffic. The few moments I managed to find a spot to stand and look at the river below was beautiful..but then I was pushed forward by the crowd . Maybe the evening time we visited that place was not a right decision. Maybe this should be visited when it is not so crowded. Ok now the part I loved the most was the walk approaching this destination or even the Ram jhulla which is another similar bridge in the area. We walked through narrow lanes that winded up and down, surprised us with steps at random places, unexpected forks on these lanes where we pause , find which way is the bridge and then continue, was exciting. These lanes were filled with small shops selling anything and everything. These were also filled with people from all walks of life, colourfully attired, orange clad mystical looking saadhus strolling along , beautiful sounds of excited tourists chattering, the street food hawkers calling out...now this was fun. But if you are in rishikesh visiting these two jhullas or bridges is a 'must tick box'.

title: Locals have made it average
review: It’s suppose to be an ancient path way but local people and government have just spoiled this historic place and made it an ordinary cross way to pass from East to West.

title: Good. Little better than raam jhula.
review: Tip: don't trust google for the directions. It will show you the longer route to the other side of the bridge. Ask the local or take an experienced driver with you. If you are coming from Ram jhula, no need to go till Neelkanth bridge. Right where the bridge is located, there is a small road going to the right which might not be open to take the immediate turn. Just go little bit ahead and take a u- turn. You can take your car straight down near the bridge.

title: Nice
review: It's a good place and a must visit, a small pool connecting 2 parts of the city

title: Sight to sore eyes
review: We city dwellers see a lot of bridges in our lifetime but this suspension bridge is so unique!! Restaurants at one end and temples at another with ganga flowing beneath is such a sight. Walk across around 6 in the evening and you will feel the pulse of Rishikesh.

title: the ancient crossing
review: this julla is on river ganges and helps to pass through one end to another. there is too rush in day time and even two wheelers can go through this.Many people take photographs and you can feed fishes there which is one of the best thing. after crossing jhulla there are lots of temple and street food available.

title: Our own Golden Gate Bridge
review: If you want to see India, this is the place. On a shaky bridge, there is traffic of human, two wheelers and even livestock all whizzing around. And of course the selfie travelers.

title: Childhood memories
review: I have visit Laksham jhula more than 25 times since childhood. The  exciting feeling when the bridge shakes while you walk is breathtaking.

title: Fun but crowded
review: This is one of the main attractions of Rishikesh

title: Touristy Thing to do in Rishikesh
review: this is rishikesh's touristy thing to do. walk over the bridge. watch out or feed some Monkeys. do your trinket shopping, Browse super costly "silver" jewellery. Interact with foreigners. Eat into some German Bakery products. Total touristy Thing to do.

title: Not worth the hype
review: A big disappointment. Dirty, two wheelers, cows all walking along. Not worth it as far as I am concerned.

title: This place has a great feel to it !
review: This place has a great feel to it ! The guesthouse/restaurant staff, shopkeepers, taxi/jeep drivers, babas and sadhus, and above all the foreign visitors are all just sooooooo laid back.

title: Swing with breeze and view
review: It is a suspended bridge with cool fresh breeze and extraordinary view of river Ganga and mountains. The jhula is too narrow to pass vehicles, pedestrian entry should be only allowed. as name suggests, you will definitely feel the swing(jhula).

title: Awsome view from lakshman jhulla
review: It's quite little crowded because this bridge connect both city sides to each other . But nice place and a marvellous work by engineers who made this bridge . Lovely to watch this place .

title: Decent bridge with nice view
review: It's a nice bridge and the view is beautiful.... Only issue is that there are buffalos on it sometimes which can cause some traffic of sorts.

title: Wonderful bridge on river ganga
review: This is an iconic landmark of Rishikesh city . Legend has it that Lord Ram's brother Laxman crossed the river Ganga on jute rope from this place ,hence the name ! The iron suspension bridge was built on 1929 and is open to pedestrians and bikes . You get a splendid view of the mountains and flowing ganga from this bridge . In the evening ,it is brilliantly lit and looks awesome

title: Beautiful view of the Ganga
review: A walk across for the feel of Rishikesh and definitely to get to the other side. It has beautiful views of the river below. Feed the fish, take some selfies and feel the swing.

title: Interesting!
review: Not for the faint hearted. The bridge is very busy throughout the day and has people, motorbikes and scooters crossing. The monkeys are ever watchful for the food they can take from you and the cows get a bit tired and may need to rest before they finish crossing!

title: Not anywhere near the name suggested
review: The name might be misleading. The jhula doesn't have any spiritual in itself. Also I had visited this 15 years back, that time it used to swing and hence was known jhula, but I guess to maintain it they have done some changes.. It no more swings and hence jhula also doesn't go with it

title: Iconic Landmark
review: Best time to visit is early in the morning, otherwise it gets crowded with two wheelers honking and vendors and a host of other things.

title: Iconic Jhoola
review: Apart from sacred Ganga , the other iconic symbol of Rishikesh is none other than Laxman Jhula which connects the West side of the town to the Eastern side and the river bank there. Walking across the bridge offers superb views. Though crowded most of the times, its never the less a pleasurable experience !

title: Must Visit
review: This is a must visit place in Rishikesh. Go early morning to avoid the crowd. You can feel the clean air and views are amazing. Be careful of the monkeys here.

title: AN INTERESTING WALK...
review: a nice walk over the suspension bridge in evenings is a must. U would encounter a lot of bikes, cows and monkeys thru ur walk, so be careful

title: The Busy Bridge
review: Because of the long walk from the main road to the Jhula I was getting restless and thinking "was it worth booking a hostel on the other side on the Jhula". Once I reached the Jhula I was captivated by its mammoth strength to hold not only humans but cattle and also vehicles ( only 2 wheelers). When I reached I saw the Jhula packed with people and no places to move. I took a deep breath and plunged into the packed madness. Amidst the cacophony, people were still blocking the way and taking selfies. Though it seemed annoying at that time because of their blithe ignorance of being the cause of traffic, if I sit back and think of it, that's the beauty of the Jhula - commotion and cacophony. In the four days of bliss, I have seen the Jhula at all times of the day. And I have loved at every time. But the best is the dawn. The changing colours of the sky as the sun quietly emerges from his sleep before it's awakening is a sight to capture in your mind's eye. No lense can capture that beauty. And the cool breeze of the Ganges blowing through your hair - this can only be enjoyed without the pandemonium around you.

title: Walking on the river bank
review: This is pilgrim place, a lot of Hindus come here to visit to witness several Arati (a ritual to become) perform on the river Ganga. Rishikesh is quite clean compare to many other place of pilgrimage. Only draw back I found was the crossing the bridge, which is know as jula, it's a nightmare. Being no more than 5 ft wide, there two way traffic, walking and motorbike competing for space. With constant hooting, people taking pictures.

title: Do visit this place. 😍
review: Lakshman Jhula is one of the major attractions of tourists in Rishikesh. This is a iron suspension bridge that connects two villages Tapovan to Jonk. Important places around the Lakshman Jhula include the Terah Manzil temple, the Lakshman temple, and the Ram Jhula. The entire area is imbued with a mystic, serene and holy feeling to it.

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful sightseeing, be prepared to walk among cows and monkeys and motorbikes missing Rishikesh!!

title: Most iconic structure of Rishikesh
review: Built in 1930, the Lakshman Jhula is the most iconic tourist attraction in Rishikesh. It is an iron suspension bridge and is few kilometers upstream from it lesser know sibling the Ram Jhula. Spread over 400+ feet, it connects the Tapovan area to Jonk in Pauri Garhwal district. It is less wide than Ram Jhula but more crowded.

title: Must visit
review: It's a historical and slightly swinging jhula connecting one end of holy Ganga river to another. Awesome views can be seen.

title: GREAT VIEW & EXPERIENCE
review: Laxman Jhula is one of the oldest and most popular bridge from city approach to reach main city, aarti ghat areas, aashrams and market. It can only be crossed on foot and on 2-wheelers by the locals, Be cautious of monkies all all along. Its quite narrow and swins a bit as it is a ropeway bridge.

title: Must see of Rishikesh
review: Was visiting this structure after decades and it still retains its beauty thanks to the flowing Ganges. The only problem, other than the overcrowding on both the banks, is the passage of motorbikes on the jhula. The view from the jhula is amazing and just right for all the "selfie" lovers !!

title: Best tourists place to be.
review: The place has a nice ambient atmosphere goes parallel to the Ganges an imbecile market also the crossed jhula road has great Food servings in Cafes and Bakeries. The Jhula road becomes a transformed land in the evening and happenings like Musical jams and foodie get togethers in places or on banks of the river, brings out the best of this place.

title: In Lap of Ganga
review: This bridge has great ambiance of river Ganga. Beside pedestrian one can see bikes, cows etc on the bridge.

title: Religious tour
review: Lovely busy bridge. Accessible to cross the Mighty river Ganga. Lots of activity all along.

title: Miss
review: Lakshman Jhula and Ram Jhula are bridges over Ganga River with beautiful views and lots of shops.  Lots of restaurants to choose from and ashrams to visit. Great tourist destination....

title: The Hanging Bridge | Rishikesh
review: One of the best experience when we were crossing the bridge early morning at 05:45am , when there was no one on the bridge except us , Chilling air was flowing on the other hand Sun was trying to come and the Laxman Jhulla was moving with the air - Awesome experience - Must try this experience..!!!

title: Must watch
review: If you want to have satisfaction then buy some cheap fish food from locals selling it there and feed the fishes.

title: Pathetic roads
review: When we visited lakshman Jhulla,  there was heavy traffic of two wheelers. Such a good place became chaotic to walk. Many elder people saving themselves from these two wheelers instead of watching

title: An experience not to be missed .....
review: If you're afraid of heights, this may not be for you.  The Lakshman Jhula iron suspension bridge is located between two villages, Tapovan & Jonk.  It is also not far from Rishikesh.  It crosses the Ganga River, and offers great panoramic views.  It does get crowded with locals, and tourists alike ... and, an occasional moped.  Watch out for the monkeys, as well.  Don't feed them.  Yes, you will feel the motion of the bridge, but it's not scary.  I really enjoyed this area, especially the walk along the river.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: It lovely being on the top of river ganga on a hanging bridge. In the evening it's the best with cold breeze you can feel around you .

title: A suspension Bridge on Ganga River
review: Lakshman Jhula very beautiful bridge on the Ganga River, From Muni Ki Reti parking you can walk from Lakshman Jhula to next side of River.

title: Unique experience
review: It is truely a unique experience to walk down the Lakshman Jhula bridge over the holy Ganges river. It gives a beautiful view of the river and the temple side of rishikesh. The only spoilsport were the many bikers who crossed recklessly without bothering about who they were hitting on the way.

title: Suspended Huge Bridge
review: Breathtaking view, Experience in itself, but being used for vehicles too, which is bad.

title: Walk across the bridge
review: Walk across the bridge for the best experience. It sometimes becomes overcrowded during the day . So mornings are recommended.

title: Iron Bridge
review: Not to miss in Rishikesh, an attraction know on its own, its not only a bridge, but gives you the beautiful view of the place overall.

title: Average place
review: I had visit this place with my family member in february.the temperature is little cold.in this place nothing to see.only one bridge connect to place across the Ganga river.most of public go there for river rafting.this place is 30 km far from haridwar.beside this bridge one bridge is also constructed name ram julha.this place have no history.only two place connect with the use of this bridge

title: Laxman Jhula, Himilayas is the epitomy of civilasation and culure.
review: We walked from Ram Jhula to Laxman Jhula and got a ride back and emerging on the Laxman Jhula is a higher conscious experience for a westerner traveler to emerging onto Hindu Civilisation a moving experience.

title: Shopping central
review: Beep beep! You share the crossing of the bridge with people, cows and motor bikes. On the Shiva temple side there are numerous shops, selling jewellery , Clothing, statues, carvings amongst many other things. Temples and Yoga practice places everywhere. Hustle and bustle, have your wits about you!

title: Go for Views and hanging in air experience
review: Best time to visit is in early morning (by 7-8 AM). After that its difficult to walk/stand due to constant movement of bikes from both sides.Not sure why Administration has allowed bikes considering its one of the most visited tourist attraction.Laxman Jhula is less wide than Ram Jhula and both are separate by a distance of approx 2 kms. It vibrates/swings due to wind and best way to feel it is to hold the side railing net with both hands and try to stand there for few mins.

title: Ganga madness.
review: Amazing crossing the bridge. Can be really busy. Just enjoy the experience. It is a bit mad but welcome to India.

title: A Bridge which is actually very famous
review: I am sure you will cross this bridge at least once on your trip to Rishikesh. View of Ganga River is amazing from the Bridge

title: A sight to wonder
review: I'm from south India and this structure appeared marvellous to me... Standing on it and gazing at the Ganga below and feeling occasional minor tremors.... A unique experience!

title: Very strong bridge
review: Laxman Jhoola is an ancient bridge. It is very strong. Strong enough for vehicles to be able to pass over the bridge. It is always crowded and there are a lot of monkeys around. The monkeys are naughty and snatch things so be careful.

title: A different world in it
review: All i mean by the title is just cross the lakshman jhula and go to the other side, it is one of the most happening market in all of the north india, herded with foriegners, amazing people and lip smacking street food and hippy restaurants. A must visit place.

title: A must visit spot
review: The experience of walking on this bridge is incredible. It will mesmerize you with the amazing view of The Ganga river at the bottom, amazing mountains/temples nearby, a very nice cold breeze and a sudden skip in your heart that you can feel when it shakes a bit sometimes.

title: Peace
review: After landing in Rishikesh town bus station, my thoughts weren't exactly great, it's a dump. But after eventually getting a tuktuk, we'd not realised Lakshman Julia was about 2 or 3 km out of town, we found what all the fuss was about! The beautiful Ganges River lined with temples and the Himalayas as the backdrop. Spot on.

title: Beautiful
review: Such a beautiful and peaceful place. The water was green and so beautiful. It was so cold but nice as well.

title: Adventure
review: This is a hanging jhula over Ganga River and if u hold it tight and try it swings. You can feel the swing. But it is very much crowded. One time visit.

title: It's a bridge...
review: ...albeit a rather narrow one. Intended to be a footbridge, cows, monkeys and motorbikes are usual hazards!

title: A nice experience to walk on Lakshman Jhula over Ganga river
review: This is at the end of the Lakshman Jhula road, after passing through Tapovan market  and also many ashrams and restaurants on the way. This is a hanging bridge between the two banks of River Ganga. The local people and also some tourists on the hired two wheelers keep passing very close to us, while walking on the bridge, we had to move very cautiously in order to go safely with out being hit. There are many shops on both sides of the river. It was nice experience to walk on the bridge viewing the fast flowing river Ganga below.

title: Lovely Swing
review: Lakshman Jhula is a must visit when in Rishikesh. It's beauty accentuates just around dusk when the Ganga aartis starts. The glow of diyas reflection on water and you watching from above over Lakshman Jhula amidst mild swings of the bridge is mesmerizing.

title: Great place for souvenirs and great food
review: Excellent town to visit and explore, the best place in Rishikesh to buy some souvenirs for yourself and your friends and family. Enjoy the not so much noisy warm and busy streets while rocking from one shop to another.

title: Laxman jhula
review: Really a nice place to enjoy yoga and meditation classes, but also to do some shopping. It's plenty of

title: Solo trip in Rishikesh
review: I found this area very interesting with its cute little shops n cafe’s.

title: Experince the vibrations due to wind
review: Experience the vibrations due to wind. Feed fishes and watch out for them jumping for the feed...

title: Great view of the Ganga
review: Watch out for cow dung when you walk this bridge! Great things to explore on both sides of the bridge.

title: Laxman Jhula
review: We reached here early morning around 5:30 and the view and feel was so refreshing. Early morning is the best time to experience this bridge as its not crowded and easier to walk. During the day you would even find bikes using this bridge and it gets crowded. This place is surrounded with many good cafes, hotels and hostels for stay. They have aarti near the laxman jhula in evening as well.

title: Marvelous engineering & great view from the Jhula
review: Have been to Rishikesh quite few times for white water rafting. The both sides of the river are being connected with Jhulas.

title: Great place for yoga
review: Really quiet and peaceful (by Indian standards) town on the Ganges. Heaps of good food options and day trips. Perfect place to do a multi-day or week yoga course

title: the place has become quite expensive and become soulless
review: Was here a few years ago...wouldn't really recommend it as the place around the bridge   is now a mich mash of junk and overpriced shops...if you go to Ram Julla  a mile down the road, the place has still a soul and things are half price

title: beautiful pass over the ganges
review: Though crowded during the day, its always breezy and has a beautiful view of the ganges flowing through the mpountains. You can also witness many colourful motor boats/ ferries and rafting bosts during the day

title: Mesmerizing View of Ganga
review: Felt very good walking on this bridge. Offers a great view of River Ganga flowing below. Mesmerizing View of Temples. Only thing which disturbs you is the constant honking by bikers on the bridge.

title: Really looking
review: We u visit Rishikesh than ones u visit Ram & laksham jhula.

title: Small town, a bit touristic, but you can experience a bit of the india life
review: A small town, but you can find a lot of restaurants, hotels, shops and Ashram. A good place to spend a couple of days or even months if you decide to go for a yoga and/or meditation retreat.

title: Quintessential Rishikesh
review: Having seen so many pictures of this bridge, it felt surreal to be walking across it. After walking past the stalls selling mala beads and incense, and visiting several temples, the way suddenly opens up to the impressive bridge.  I crossed the bridge, along with motorcycles, cows, and monkeys and walked along the eastern bank through the swargashram area all the way down to Ram Jhula where I crossed Ma Ganga on a ferry. So many sights, sounds, smells - the whole experience will never be forgotten!

title: Swinging bridge
review: Very picturesque setting to see the flourishing Ganges. Beware of motorbikes that scramble between the walking crowd.

title: Hanging over the ganges
review: It's a walkaway to cross the Ganges for the people residing across the Ganges.

title: Lakshman jhuvala
review: A hanging bridge across the river Ganges a great structure built centuries before. Two wheeler three wheeler over the bridge is unwanted.

title: The most iconic attraction in Rishikesh
review: If you visit the city, you can't miss this bridge. This area is always full of people (mostly tourists), and you will see lots of monkeys as well. My favourite attraction in Rishikesh

title: Can’t miss!
review: The Laxman Jhula and Ram Jhula is synonymous with a visit to Risikesh. While both bridges are mostly busy , you can just sit close to it for some good people watching. Both bridges can only be crossed on feet or motorbike.

title: Jao Maa gange
review: Gangs Maa is not just water it is like mother.  It speaks.  It is a living entity.  Jai Jao gangs Maa..

title: I love this bridge
review: You can see all the beautiful Rishkesh and the mountain from there !

title: Star 5
review: It was very special trip a day enjoyed a  lot and visited holy places like laxmanjhoola, swarga ashram,  Geeta banana etc.

title: Quick Visit
review: On my recent trip, I went for a quick visit to Lakshman Jhula. I was staying near Ram Jhula, so this seemed exact same.

title: A nice but overcrowded place
review: This place used to be really beautiful once however today's reality is that the place is overcrowded, not well maintained and littered all around - in fact the river water that flows in the valley below has also been polluted with garbage etc. Not a recommended place in my opinion.

title: Iconic, lovely bridge
review: This is a great crossing of the Ganges.  It is frequented by people, cows, scooters...and monkeys.  The downside are the monkeys which can be quite aggressive...be sure to keep any food in backpack or otherwise hidden.  They will grab a sack right out of your hand.  The bridge can be jammed packed with all these beings crammed into the space together and sometimes the traverse is easy-going.  In the mornings, it is quite beautiful...only a few people...and the monkeys are elsewhere!

title: Amazing Bridge
review: It's an amazing and iconic bridge that is a must visit place when you come to Rishikesh.It shakes a lot when you reach at the center of it, and the view is amazing. Make sure you visit at evening, and enjoy a majestic view of 'Ganga Aarti' from the to.

title: Beautiful views
review: Beautiful view from the bridge over Himalayas and river Ganga️

title: Lakshman jhula
review: Gigantic view.Awesome View.  only they should not allow animals o

title: Great Place Great Views
review: Beware of Monkeys when you visit this place. Gives you amazing view of Ganges valley.Construction of bridge is really admirable.

title: Beautiful !!
review: A beautiful rope bridge on the holy river Ganga. It offers a beautiful view of the Ganga and the valley and a popular tourist location.

title: Beautiful place to visit, great view.
review: Good place to visit and walk on,  great view but vehicles are allowed on the jhula which creates nuisance.

title: Beware of monkeys
review: Lakshman Jhula is a small bridge above the Ganga river. There are some great  cafes on either side of Lakshman Jhula and have good view of the Ganga river. You will pass from this bridge multiple times while you are in Rishikesh. Only pedestrians and bikes can cross this bridge. I would highly recommend not exposing any food items while you are here. Monkeys and cows will not let you eat or give food to the fishes. Monkeys will threaten you and ensure you throw it for them to eat.

title: Nice bridge
review: Lakshman Jhula is much smaller and at the same time older than the Ram Jhula.

title: Great views. Lovely temples and  shopping experience..
review: A wonderful shopping experience. Lots to see and buy.

title: Very best....
review: This bridge is  modern engineering magic, supported on steel ropes.This connects Muni ki Reti side to Swargashram.I used to stay at Onkaranand( closer to the Muni ki Reti parking)To attend Ganga Arti, mostly I go to the "parmarth ashram" by motor boat, you can take one way ticket of boat or a return ticket. You can save 5 bucks by buying return ticket, but boat service is not available till Arti is over, so buy only one way ticket if you intend to attend Arti.If you want to see Laxman Jhoola, then boat is enough but I will recommend you to have a walk on Ram Jhoola bridge.This depends on time you have, if you are staying for couple of days then manage to have early morning walk, at that time you won't face so many baggers nor shopping crowd that you will have to pass through if you are walking between 9 am to 9pm.Yet, you and  lady members of your group will  love these shops, these shops offer wide range of gift items. You will feel blessed while walking on this bridge.You can see  stream of Ganga Maiyya both sides.A little caution, even if you are in group, keep yourself in a line so as to allow others to pass on the bridge.And, do not let your kids unattended. NEVER, Please.Enjoy with friends, families and feel your inner self too at Laxman Jhoola

title: Good view from the jhula
review: The views are great and there are ample cafes around to chill at and just do nothing at all - royal cafe and little Buddha to name some

title: Good view
review: Good view. you can roam around . There’s a market nearby. You can do boating also. Lots of options for dining available nearby.

title: Buzzing bridge!
review: Nothing great - its just a high traffic pedestrian connection between 2 banks of the river. You cannot chill or take photos due to high volume of people and cows on the bridge. Made worse by 2-wheelers trying to cross too

title: Nothing great
review: A very average tourist attraction..  The Ganga is the only beauty which you can look at from the bridge..

title: Fun experience
review: What was amazing was that not only people were crossing this narrow bridge, but cows and scooters were crossing as well.

title: Excellent architecture
review: A major attaraction of Rishikesh, linked to mythological times, awesome view of Ganga river on this bridge, yet one needs to be careful of the monkeys.

title: Nice.
review: Laxman jhula is very nice place. There are. Many temples for the see. All persons are enjoyed there. All temples are near by the ganga ji.

title: Really Nice
review: Nice and curious place. Monkeys, cows, people, motorbikes, all at the same time in this place. Here you taste the real flavour of India

title: Walk
review: A nice place to have a walk. I spent only two days, in a way it was hurried trip. Would love to visit again for 3-4 days.

title: Lakshman Jhula like waves
review: Lakshman jhula is situated over the Ganga River.  When we walk on it, its moving right or left.  As we are taking the swings.

title: A hanging bridge
review: love to cross River Ganga through the hanging bridge, you can have a look of beautiful city on both side of river from it .It is one of the tourist spot in Rishikesh,

title: Wonderful
review: A experience that can never be forgot. Ganga flowing by mountains and rafts create amazing view. Sunset is best to observe!

title: Nice locations
review: Nice crowd.. nice location of jhula river ...temple's ..great crowed...many shopping areas ...great time spent near river

title: Very nice place
review: This place is very nice. The view of Ganga looks beautiful. It was a very good experience of visiting Laxman jhoola.

title: Excellent view!
review: The bridge offers you a perfect view above the Ganges river and Rishikesh. It is a really beautiful and peaceful place. Worth visit!

title: Amazing
review: The view from the bridge is amazing. It's same as Ram Jhula and within a km from it. I can visit it anytime again because I found the place serene. Also you can take a walk from Ram Jhula to Lakshman Jhula. The whole path looks amazing and when walking in groups you enjoy a lot more. Bikes are also available on rent to travel here.

title: Beautiful Hanging bridge on Maa Ganga !
review: The bridge is very beautiful and one of the hanging bridge on Maa Ganga. Thisis major tourist attraction, but the motorists on the bridge is causing damage to this. The view from the bridge is very beautiful and scenic.

title: Proud of Rishikesh
review: Must say it is a proud of Rishikesh.

title: Amazing trip
review: The laxman jhula is amazing, beautiful view, great experience walking on the suspension bridge, bit crowded though but people manage it well, childhood wish to walk on laxman jhula came true, nice and clean

title: Great view
review: One of the oldest bridges of the country. One should must visit this place if you're in Rishikesh or Haridwar.

title: Busy fun tour
review: December very busy but fun place. Lots of little ayurvedic spa massage treatments and offer many activities yoga classes for a longer duration of stay. River rafting and river very stunning viewed from Lakshman Jhula. Walk on the bridge and walk down to Ram jhula about a 2 or 3 km walk...fun experience to see temples priest cows and river.

title: Busy bridge.. but no monkeys..
review: Whilst in Rishikesh we stayed closer to Ram Jhula thank Lakshman, but walked across Lakshman serveral times. There is a busier vibe here, lots of shops and street food going on either side + peaceful views of the Ganga!!

title: Very Scenic and Pleasant
review: A nice place to hand out in the evenings - Nice Cafes around and very pleasant with some shopping stores

title: Nice place!!!
review: Lakshmi hula is a good and worthy place to visit.  We went to this place early morning and there are lots of crowd.

title: nice walk across the bridge
review: two wheelers are allowed and as you already know they are noisy and honk freely spoiling the serenity near such a beautiful place.

title: Nice place to hangout in rishikesh
review: Good place to hangout in rishikesh. Plenty of shops and cafes nearby. Bridge is very small but excellent for some photography

title: History which is being Spoilt
review: It is a Monument, an architect that should have being kept in a good condition

title: Beautiful bridge but
review: The motorbikes in this town ruin the peaceful nature of what this town and bridge could be and must have been for years.

title: Good experience
review: View of the underneath river is really good.

title: A walk on Laxman Jhula
review: I happen to cross Laxman Jhula four times between 31 dec to 02 jan. it’s more crowded than ram Jhula. Though it’s beautiful with 13 floor temple at one end. Worth visiting once on a trip to Rishikesh. If you have seen ram Jhula, Laxman Jhula is same but bit narrow and small, but it is older than ram Jhula. Don’t miss lunch on western side of Jhula in some dhaba . Also visit betel cafe about 400 meters away from Jhula

title: Good place, needs some upgrades
review: Visited this place after 7 years. Looks like it has lost some of it's banks after the floods of Kedarnath. The beauty remains same but the upkeep of the ghats and nearby areas looked stagnant. Still a good place to walk around and experience the serenity of Rishikesh. Go rafting to add some spark to life.

title: Beautiful view and top point of Rishikesh
review: It’s one of attractions that does show Rishikesh’s symbol. Beautiful with river across and view at temple

title: Mythology is real
review: Well it usually seems to be a bridge with metal ropes however experience of crossing this abt 500mts long bridge along with number of people on it.  It gives you goosebumps when it shakes. Also it has a spiritual belief that lakshmana crossed the river creating a bridge jute ropes which provides this bridge a believer attraction spot.

title: Nothing special
review: The Jhula is fine to visit once. Beware of monkeys. Nothing great to visit this place however one visit is fine

title: Good place
review: Rishikesh is outstanding place!!!!!!

title: serenity at its best
review: this place is out of this world. The Ganga is so calm and serene that it looks like a lake not a river. Just about 20 kms downstream the river is noisy and failry active and turbulent. Folklore has is that LAxman was at Rishikesh and was meditating when he found that the noisy Ganga was disturbing him. He fired a bow and then said that when you pass this place you will be quiet. It indeed is quiet and a natural marvel that the river here is serene and calm while in just 20 kms downstream it changes complexion completely.

title: A MUST LOCATION
review: Anyone must wander thru Lakshman Jhula when in Rishikesh. A lovely vibe, plethora of shopping options from cheap street shops to ones with better quality merchandise and a multitude of restaurants and peaceful views of the Ganga!!

title: Nice
review: A very beautiful place to click good pics. Nice view in all directions as it lies hanging over the Ganges. Although it is very crowded so please be careful about pickpockets.

title: The locals need to change
review: Though the place is decently maintained. The Jhula is extensively used by locals on two wheelers who keep running up down the jhula causing inconvenience and is also unsafe. Along with this the cows also have a gala time walking on the jhula. There has to be barricades installed to stop this traffic.

title: Must Visit
review: Lakshman Jhula is synonymous with Rishikesh. The moment one says Rishikesh we all start visualizing the suspension bridge Lakshman Jhula.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: It was nice visiting laxman Jhula... Architecture is great.... Should take a walk at Jhula..... Decent market near by.....ust visit

title: Excellent
review: Lakshman Jhula is an iron suspension bridge over the holy river Ganga at Rishikesh. A famous landmark place in Rishikesh and the view of river Ganga is amazing with the azure water.

title: Huge height
review: This is one of tourist attractions place in Himachal Pradesh. A very long bridge with a huge height with very great views of mountains . A one time visit place

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: If you just see it distance then it is just a bridge but once you are on it, it will feel like you are in top of mountain, best to go early morning or after sunset

title: Its beautiful..
review: The view from Lakshman jhula is mesmerizing, specially at night.. there's so much to explore around. ...so many restaurants and cafes...one can never get bored here.

title: Holiday
review: Lakshman Jhula is a great place to visit we enjoyed a lot walking on it view of Ganga is amazing so pure water flowing that coolness you can feel in your heart

title: Worth visiting
review: Its a different experience walking on Lakshman Jhula. Sad part is the way two wheelers ride on this and this is a dangerous thing. Till an accident takes place Govt will not do anything.

title: The hanging bridge
review: This hanging bridge is established so many years ago, but still, now the bridge is in good condition. At the middle of the bridge, you can feel that the bridge is actually swinging.

title: Congested yet must-visit :)
review: It's a congested bridge on which people, monkeys & 2-wheelers are allowed. View of Ganges is amazing from here. However the crowd & 2-wheeler horns spoil the experience. Below the bridge, you can see Rafting groups as well. There are temples, market area, eating joints & yoga studios on both sides of the bridge. You can easily spend few hours in shopping, having local snacks, tea-juice etc. The market is quite good & reasonably priced. Restaurants serve simple-yet-yummy food !! Below the bridge, there is boating option as well. Since we didn't try it, so don't know the charges. If you stay around Lakshman Jhula area (like we did), then my advice would be to spend at least 2 nights there. You can just relax & enjoy the simple beauty of this place.

title: Amazing jhula
review: It's very fascinating every time I see, it was my 2nd visit though, still the amazing construction of the bridge is really commending.

title: bridge for crossing ganga
review: This old bridge which nearly a century old is long and quite narrow... one feels little worried when walking the bridge even though it is very safe.

title: The Place to Stay
review: This is the area to stay in when visiting Rishikesh. Lots of cafes, shops and ashrams throughout. During the day it gets a bit loud with the hustle and bustle of the city but at nights it quite peaceful.

title: Rishikesh visit would not be complete without a walk on the Lakshman Jhula!
review: Me and my band of Yogi travelers walked this bridge numerous time to shop and enjoy local treats. The easiest way to travel from one side of the Ganga to the other is by the foot bridge traversed by people, motor cycles and cows.  Namaste, G

title: Awesome
review: It is a cable stayed suspension bridge which is made over the ganga river. When you walk on it you can feel the air flowing and whole bridge is shaking litely. It is adventurous.

title: It's average.
review: Well, it's a bridge with a decent view. Sure, it has some historic significance, but there's nothing too excited about it. Visit either Ram or Lakshan jhula and they will give you the same experience.

title: Rishikesh Trip
review: Excellent stay .All hotel staffs are cordial and very helpful

title: The must see Bridge
review: Breathtaking structures of the bridge. At first it is scary when you pass by it especially when it is crowded and cows in the way. Monkeys are all over. Just be careful they like to steal stuff from you the monkeys. We also passed through it on motorbike. Very nice.

title: Beautiful experience
review: It was my first attraction visit after my landing in Rishikesh. It was evening and a Hindu chanting was playing in background, probably from the Tera Manzil temple across the bridge. It was a heart warming spiritual feeling that I will cherish.

title: overhyped
review: The bridge itself was over-hyped. And it's really annoying to have bikes honking at you and brushing past you continuously while you try to walk here.

title: British period marvel
review: Lakshman Jhula is an iron suspension bridge connecting the two sides of River Ganga in Rishikesh.  The bridge is motorable, allowing two wheelers on it. It's very strong. Several people can be seen walking on it during the evening time. Look out for monkeys on the bridge and railings.

title: Beautifully but more crowded
review: Its too crowded in seasons better to move their in off season if you really want to take a natures feel.

title: Visit with friends
review: Lovely view and feel. Very peaceful. The sound of ganges mesmerizes u. The temple bells ringing changes the aura of the place to heavenly.

title: Bridge over the Ganges - a great experience
review: This is a hanging bridge over the river Ganga. On both sides of the Jhula there are some great cafes . The cool bridge coming from either sides , makes the experience more amazing.

title: good one
review: its nice to take a walk on this bridge, safe to walk on, its about 20 meter to cross the river, i like it.

title: great bridge but much crowed
review: if you want to enjoy visit early morning. after 9 am this is very crowed. our hotel divine ganga cottage was walking distance from here. we loved this place

title: Women’s India tour
review: We love Lakshman Jhula!! We stayed at the Holy River Hotel and they were amazing!! So accommodating, helpful and the hotel is new and modern. I will be back for sure!!!

title: Amazing Service with Real People
review: The whole experience was amazing from booking the trip the information that we have received before we have booked but also all the important staff along the way it has made this trip one to remember.

title: 87 years old bridge
review: This bridge was opened in 1930 when the old bridge was washed away in the floods.

title: Nice visit
review: Nice to go there and watch all people coming and going, between motocicles, cows and monkeys! Its interesting. And view to Ganga River is amazing from there!

title: LAKSHMAN JHULA
review: Aaarti at the lakshman jhula spectacular must experience it .

title: Oldest Iron Suspension Bridge and Roots goes back to 1927--
review: Lakshman Jhula was Built in 1927-1929 and was open for Public since 1930 and This Jhula has got a Historic value with One of it's Kind during those days and consider to be an Engineering MarveL..This again is connecting the Main City side of Rishikesh to The Ashram Side of The Rishikesh..

title: My first Experience of India
review: India fills your senses and emotions.  I was told while in Rishikesh that this is a 'soft entry' into India. A comment I really understood when later I visited Delhi and Agra.  I have travelled in Bali and Vietnam so knew some of what to expect, but held no preconceptions when I visited the 'Holy City' to be trained as a Yin Yoga teacher.  I thoroughly enjoyed my 11 day stay. Rishikesh may be a soft entry but can and will challenge those visiting from Australia (where I live) and other 'western' countries. It is vibrant, noisy, demanding, exhilarating, stimulating, emotional and a place that I felt at home with after a few days. Having people to contact who are well acquainted with India certainly helped me and I would highly recommend having that contact with such people if you are a first time visitor to any country. I stayed in Lakshman Jhula and it is on the banks of Ma Ganga.  For those who, that special river hold significants, and would like to be close, this is the pace to stay.  I will go back one day.

title: Rishikesh trip
review: We went to rishikesh and we did go to this bridge...  Awesome experience.. a must see for the people who are interested in bridges.. like me as engineer...

title: Busy but magnificent
review: Allow plenty of time to cross this bridge. It is well worth the experience of being jostled and queuing across. There’s pedestrians, cows, motorbikes and monkeys all trying to cross.

title: A slightly more chaotic one than the Ram Jhula
review: This one of the two suspended pedestrian cable bridges across the river Ganga. It offer great view of the river and the surroundings. It's quite congested given you have cows, two wheelers occasionally some monkeys and oh I forgot "we the tourists". But if you happen to get used to it you find the chaos in order after a while.

title: Nice view of Ganga River
review: It offered a very good view of Ganga river. But, this bridge can be accessed by two wheeler also. This caused a lot of congestion. We visited Lakshman Temple that was near Lakshman Jhula. We visited Ram Jhula and walked for about 30 min to reach Lakshman Jhula. Many people book river rafting near Lakshman Jhula. We did not go for rafting as we didn't have enough time.
