They were charging about Rs 400 per person for river rafting near Lakshman Jhula. Lots of agents were there. Just be careful while choosing.

title: Worth seeing but you can miss it
review: Since I saw the Ram Jhula, this was nothing new. However the shop nearby sells Sandal woods, incense sticks and Rudraksha malas which I didn't see near Ram Jhula.

title: Watch out for the motorbikes!
review: This is one of the bridges In Rishikesh that spans the Ganges and allows people to get from one side to the other. Teeming with people it is a bird’s eye view of India with everyone going about their business, watch out for the motorbikes though!

title: Amazing View across the ganga
review: Standing at the far end of the lakshman jhula the view of Backpackers hostel is revisiting the splendid time spent in rishikesh.

title: The two wheelers and monkey are a botheration
review: You cannot stand on the Jhula and enjoy the serenity and beauty of the nature. Too much crowded. The two wheelers are extremely disturbing. To add to the worry there are too many monkeys. Having come such a long way you don't have an option of not to visit the place.

title: catching up with friends
review: so fabulous the food ...vegetarians vegan the main road is full of roof top restaurants street food amazing friendliness of the locals magical & incredible choices of all types of yoga inspirational

title: A piece of architecture that requires to be preserved
review: Went to this place yesterday during our visit to Rishikesh. It's a good piece of architecture that is being ill treated by the public. It's a very narrow bridge that is being crossed by people from both sides. What I totally disliked is that every few seconds there was bike or scooter also making use of this bridge which I feel should be banned by the authorities. If it continues to be treated this way by the public, I don't see it staying stable for long and might just get destroyed sooner rather than later. I urge the authorities to take action against the use of vehicles on the bridge and preserve this nice piece of architecture.

title: HISTORIC
review: A lot of travelers have already written a lot about this Jhula. Its an engineering marvel. We walked across the bridge with the roaring river flowing beneath us. It is necessary to draw the attention of the authorities of this bride. The two wheeler traffic on this bridge is a menace. It is an absolute nuisance. One cannot stand or walk in peace. This needs to be addressed.

title: Swings from the history part 2
review: The bridge is long and narrow built over a roaring river. It is being used by people on foot and vehicles alike. It is an evidence of architectural marvel from our history but the upkeep by the concerned authority is a disappointment.

title: Enjoyable
review: Terrific ambience and a cultural attraction.  Different cultures congregate on the bridge and with the Ganges flowing beneath, makes it an experience worth treasuries

title: You have to cross this bridge when visiting the Ganges and Rishikesh!
review: It was really nice to walk over this bridge and get a full picture of the Ganges and Rishikesh. The flow of people were easy, everybody enjoyed this spiritual place.

title: top view of Ganga
review: Being in Rishikesh, and not going there is something which one cannot think of , its the best place to get a feel of the flow of the river underneath.

title: Beautiful bridge spoiled by motorbikes
review: I heard of 2 people having their mobile phones stolen on the bridge as it's very crowded. The speeding motorbikes are not only a nuisance, they are dangerous.

title: Nice but over crowded
review: Its nice place. But has become over crowded with time. However, one must experience this if you are in rishiskesh.

title: Utter chaos during daytime
review: If one plan to visit then come very early in the morning. Otherwise u have to negotiate with cow, two Wheeler's , selfie crazy people and so on. The view from the bridge is fantastic.

title: You just cannot miss walking over the Lakshman Jhula while in Rishikesh
review: Believed to have completed in 1929, the Lakshman Jhula is a popular hanging bridge situated 23 metres  feet above the River Ganga and 150 m. long. The bridge connects two villages, Tapovan and Jonk, crossing the river from west to east. Lakshman Jhula acts as an adjoining bridge across River Ganga, along the old route to the sacred shrines of Badrinath and Kedarnath. The construction of various grand temples and Ashrams  around the Jhula has made it one of the most visited places in Rishikesh.

title: Iconic landmark
review: Lakshman jhula is the iconic landmark of Rishikesh. The only drawback is the bikers and scooterists who try to zoom past you.  Many wonderful cafes and shops have grown on both sides of the jhula. Do not carry anything in a hand held plastic bag otherwise the monkeys and langurs may try to steal it from you. Beware!

title: Great Place to be at
review: If you are going to dehraun lakshman jhula is one of the tourist place to be at. Feed fishes from the bridge. Be careful of monkeys though . Nice temples around. Must Go.

title: Great
review: Must visit.... part of atmosphere of rishikesh. Shows the life and goings on on both sides of bridge are unique and different.

title: great views over Ganga
review: This bridge has great views looking up and down the river - its a must when visiting Rishikesh.  It will be crowded most times of the day, so if you are adverse to crowds go very early in the day.  This (and the other walking bridge) are the only way to get back and forth so its more than just for getting a good view - its a necessity if you want to see sights on the other side.   Monkeys usually hang out on the cables holding up the bridge. Plenty of shops/restaraunts/etc.. right around this area as well.

title: Good
review: Lakahman Jhula is usually really crowded now a days. There are people on bikes and scooters crossing from there which makes it a little uncomfortable for the pedestrians. It gives a great view of the Gagan River and Geeta Bhavan.

title: IRON SUSPENSION BRIDGE
review: Lakshman Jhula is an iron suspension bridge across the river Ganges, located 5 kilometres from  Rishikesh in Uttarakhand. The bridge connects the two villages; Tapovan in Tehri Garhwal district to Jonk in Pauri Garhwal district. It is said that Lakshmana crossed Ganges on jute ropes between these  places  where this bridge is now built. This bridge was completed in 1929.You can have a wonderful view of the river Ganges and Rishikesh standing over the bridge.

title: Good
review: One visit is good enough... Cool breeze.. peaceful.. good view.. night view is good.. lot of hotels around

title: Must visit
review: Best view of Ganga, atmosphere here is somehow nicer than Ramjula, even though Ramjula could be much convinent.

title: Very crowded
review: The jhula is extremely crowded...bikes/cycles are all allowed on the jhula. You have to walk a long way from parking to the jhulan back.

title: good
review: nice place with history! better to visit during the early hours and during day time its very crowded

title: Holidays
review: This is a nice place but lot of honking two wheelers.

title: Is this a tourist attraction any more ??
review: The 'jhula' is now used by the locals to commute and you will find motorbikes and scooters travelling in high speed all the time. The drivers seems to be very agitated by the presence of tourist and would deliberately push them !! And, not to forget the the holy cows showing their grand presence on the jhula !!

title: Holy place at its best
review: Best time to visit at night, simply go and stand the the middle of the bridge. Amazing experience. Went with friends on a short 1 day trip. Do travel to Patna waterfall (a small trek is included for free ️) and it’s worthy. And after that you can take rest and go for river rafting.

title: Good one
review: Laxman jhula is important and famous attraction in Rishikesh. Viewing of holy river was spectacular in the evening.

title: Scary but worth walking
review: It is one of the famous tourist spots in rishikesh. It is a hanging bridge meant for walk and two wheelers only. The bridge keeps shaking whenever a scooter or bike passes through. It is thrilling. A must visit for everyone. It is accessible mostly by auto. It has many shops selling rudraksh and precious stones.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: Excellent view and great place to experience or take photographs of both sides of Rishikesh and took take spectacular photos of ma Ganga

title: A walk across the river.
review: This is a narrow bridge for foot traffic, but motorcycles are also allowed to ply on this. The tourists throng this place because the view of the holy river is beautiful from the mid point of the bridge, particularly when the water flow is good.

title: Nostalgic!
review: I Feel nostalgic about this suspension bridge in Rishikesh because I went there with my Mom, Dad & Brother for the first time. The bridge is spacious but one may also find cows and motorbikes passing on it :) Nevertheless the view of Ganges makes it awesome. You will always find rafting groups doing adventurous stuffs there. Tip: Plan when the weather is nice and do lot of shopping in the local markets :)

title: Nice
review: When I went it was raining so there was hardly anyone on the roads or near laxman jhula so we had a nice quiet time here...

title: Feel excellent
review: Enjoyed laxman jhula with parmart niketan aarti....nice atmosphere...enjoyed....................ganga aarti is really  excellent

title: Iconic
review: Unavoidable when in Rishikesh and a must to cross over. You'll cross this footbridge with many people, motor bikes, a few cows and several monkeys all crossing in harmony

title: A wonderful piece of architecture
review: During this weather, this place is quite sleepary and rain drops makes you feel nirvana. This Jhulla connects you to the direct road to neelkanth.

title: Must use to go to neelkanth
review: Lakshman Jhoola was one the best jhoola here to use. We used it and it was an amazing feeling to be there.

title: Yes
review: This is an impressive bridge. The view is amazing and meeting people, cows, monkeys, saddhus, tourists and motorbikes are all part of the experience on this suspension bridge.

title: Beautiful experience
review: This place , view everything are pure bliss.. u will feel Very close to our culture. A must visit place. Lot of temples and soothing music everything is

title: Great Jhula, but crowded!
review: While the Jhula is great and convenient, it is flooded with people, monkeys and to add t the crowd, two wheelers are allowed on this, making it impossible to have a decent moment

title: Chaos that you fall in love with.
review: Our first visit to Rishikesh and we were greeted by an angry bull on the Lakshman jhula hence all the jam but it was eventually harmless as it seemed normal. When not bull it's the tourist's taking selfies that block the bridge.

title: Lakshman Jhoola Visit
review: It is most prominent tourist place of rishikesh.  Lots of tourist specially foreign one comes and visit this place.  Some 2 km from rishikesh situated upper side of shivanand or ram jhoola is the oldest one.  Lots of cafe lots of restaurants etc.  spectacular view of River ganga n sarwashram.

title: Awsome place.
review: Most popular place in Rishikesh. Laxman jhula is deeply embedded in the minds of hindu population.it is the desire of everyone to visit atleast once in their life time. When you go there cool breeze takes you to heaven. Approach road is full of restaurants and market.place worth visiting once.

title: A hanging bridge !
review: You may have put your foot on some amazing bridges but if you have been on Lakshman Jhula nothing like that . It was constructed by Raja of Tehri Garwhal - Sudurshan Shah .

title: A experience with local people
review: You must cross both bridges Lakshman Jhula and Ram Jhula. Feel like a local with the waving bridge full of motorbikes, cows, monkeys... A bit scary the first time you cross. Later you get used to it.

title: Narrow with two wheeler traffic.  Gets windy!
review: The view from this bridge is beautiful.  However, the winds can really make people nervous.  Be careful as the bridge is also shared by cows and motorcycles.

title: Chill Out!
review: Love the vibe of this place. Very lively and people from around the world. Some of my friends were staying here while I was with my girlfriend at Aranyam resort nearby. Good places to eat and buy gifts.

title: Laxman Zulla at Rishikesh
review: Must visit attraction when in Rishikesh, Uttrakhand, India. You can also take a Nature Trail walk from Aloha on the Ganges and walk alongside the River Ganges and reach Laxman Zilla.

title: Exxellent services
review: Good services provided by the hotel staff and there is absolutely no problem in staying a hotel like madhusudan

title: Splendid !!!
review: Laxman Zhula is the major sightseeing attraction in Rishikesh. A suspended bridge over the lovely Ganges with lot of tourists and locals is a must visit. You get awesome views of the mountains and Ganges as well as rafting adventures can also be seen. Nice place to be in the evening with Cool winds and the setting sun.

title: Only sight seen
review: We saw from vehicle coz ... Our driver didn't know the routes hence, we were running late to reach nxt destination

title: The north side of Rishikesh
review: This bridge over the Ganga is on the north end of the developed Rishikesh area and is the quieter side of town joining Tapovan to the east bank. I find this area more inviting than Ram Jhula but of course the walk between the two by the riverside is fantastic.

title: Bridge without Central Support
review: Must See Spot, You use this Jhulla (Swing) to cross the river, even you can use motor bike (Two Wheeler) for Commuting . If you stand between the jhulla the feeling is so adventurous.

title: Must visit attraction near Rishikesh
review: This is basically a bridge on river Ganges . Walking is the best option to feel it perfectly though it is the only suitable option . We could see sometimes some 2 wheeler are there . We saw the endless flow of river Ganges and there is a holy ambiance in almost people mind. There are pujas going on in the temples on the banks of Ganges . Lot of people are standing and taking pictures of Ganges and full bridge . We were of course one of them . A bit careful about monkeys as they may attack if you are carrying some food / fruits without hiding anyway.

title: Beautiful Views (loud scooters) and the occasional cow crossing
review: The two bridges for car to cross from one side to the other are many Kms away and the foot path is way more fun! Vendors leading up to the bridge on both sides and a temple to worship.

title: Good place
review: This place is pilgrim an you will see lot of people visiting this place

title: Laxman Jhoola
review: This is definitely a must see and must experience spot in Rishikesh. Although it is always overcrowded, a shaky walk on this narrow suspension bridge alongwith the devotees, animals and some bikes also is worth of an experience.

title: Rishikesh
review: The jhula or the suspension bridge is on the river ganges in rishikesh. It provides spectacular view of the river. A walk in the evening would bring you close to many spiritual centres, restaurants and shops selling gems, stones, artifacts n clothes..

title: Get some clicks
review: You might think what would be so great about a "Julla". There are few feeling which you will have you go in there, standing above mighty "Ganga" is in itself a amazing feeling. Then you should visit this jhula at least thrice a day(Morning, noon and night) if you are staying in Rishikesh and you can see the magic of nature and environment of Rishikesh. And yes it oscillates as well that's why a Julla not just a bridge.

title: Historical place
review: This one is historical place. People are always busy to take selfy on the bridge.

title: Great heritage site..but no disciple of locals
review: Two wheelers & cows roaming freely...no one to take care of tourist or religious persons problems. Peoples sentiments are badly hurt.

title: Lovely
review: Most remarkable landmark in Rishikesh. Historic. Lots of shops and restaurants and hotels around. Less traffic.

title: Swing by!!
review: Try visiting during early morning hours, when it's not that crowded for a quiet walk and to witness the soothing morning breeze.

title: Amazaig View of The Ganga River
review: You can have a breathtaking view of The Holy Ganga Rivier flowing out from mountains from Laxman Jhula.

title: Rafting at its best..
review: Went to rishikesh this summer... A place which gives you an opportunity to get closer to God.. Feel and hear the blissfull chantings.... Ganga arati was something which you have to experience at least once in your life...

title: Adventure tour
review: Lakshman Jhulla is famous for its historical and spiritual background. Moreover I suggest you people enjoy Rafting in Rishikesh which give you a wonderful chance of looking Lakshman Jhulla from mid river. This is an speechless experience.

title: beware of the monkeys
review: It used to be an amazing childhood memory, sadly it's a dusty crowded place now where monkeys rule the roost!

title: swing with MIST
review: good memories of childhood revisited with my kids. crossed the bridge and felt the Ganaga ji with the mist.

title: Laxman Jhula
review: Unnecessarily surrounded by hype.

title: Nice Walk
review: I like walking along the Laxman Jhula. It is my favourite bridge there. The view of Rishikesh, and the hills is really nice.

title: Lakshman Jhoola
review: I had a mornings walk which was quite pleasurable seeing architectural wonder of the bridge & people crossing for morning divine dip in Ganga

title: very disappointing
review: the bridge can be reached after a lot of struggle and finally the bridge itself is so overcrowded with people, motor bikes and even animals.

title: Good view but!!
review: The shaky walk on the laxman jhoola is amazing with the views around but the two way too wheeler traffic with continnnuuoousss honking is something that i dint quite like. Maybe an early morning or a late night walk on the bridge will be peaceful. The views are great though.

title: Overcrowded, overhyped
review: We drove from haridwar to laxman jhula and it was very slow moving traffic all the way. It took us 3-4 hours to reach and it wasn't worth it.

title: Worthwhile
review: Bridge with great view on Gangas river. So many people, bikes, motorbikes...  very crowded and noisy but worth it because of the view.

title: Just the bridge
review: When you cross the lakshman jhula bridge and go over the other end to visit its temple actually it isnt a temple it is like a buiding which has a lot of chambers or mini rooms with idols of every god. It is not crowded and when we went we were the onlyu people there. finished off in just 15 minutes.

title: Good
review: It's like a ritual to go to Lakshman Jhula that's why we went, otherwise I feel it's lost it's original charm.

title: Attraction of hanging bridge across Ganges
review: It was a exhilarating experience to cross the ganges on the hanging bride, Lakshman Jhula. This is one of the two hanging bridges. The view of Ganges is fantastic from the Jhula.

title: Nice
review: Special energy on this bridge while passing through ramjhula and tapovan.i go Rishikesh every six month for ganga dip.

title: Good place to hang out
review: You would  like depending on month you visit. Nov to feb seems to be best months to visit as weather is cool and you can feel the breeze flowing through your hair while you are standing on Lakshman Zhula. There are lot of good cafes to eat around. View of Ganga view cafe and Little Buddha cafe  is great.

title: Picturesque
review: Crossing the Lakshman Jhula suspension bridge is a must while visiting Rishikesh. Beautiful scenery of the mighty Ganga, the Himalayan foothills and a bustling, colourful array of people. There were a lot of monkeys on the bridge which added a bit of comedic value. Cows also cross the bridge so watch out for cow pats while walking across. There is an array of colourful shops, restaurants and beauty parlours on either side of the bridge. I couldn't find an ATM anywhere so bring some cash with you.

title: A quaint suspension bridge across River Ganges.
review: A link across River Ganges linking Rishikesh on one side and tapovan on the other side. It. Is a narrow bridge which is almost a pedestrian bridge, but two wheelers and cattle complete with pedestrians.

title: Weekend outing
review: At this time  of the year not much overcrowding.  Perfect season to enjoy the place. The view of Ganga is amazing.

title: Great view, Fresh air and Awesome feeling
review: While walking on Lakshman Jhula, you will get such a great view of mountains, ganga river, river rafting, temples. It feels great. Seems like stand there for sometime and enjoy the view and feeling of river nearby.

title: Great Feeling At Early Morning
review: Reaching here at the early morning at the time of Sunrise you can have a spectacular view of the Sunrise. Fresh air and the most important is the less crowd. As the day rolls on the crowd starts swelling. You are most welcome for a rafting from the adjoining area of Shivpuri. Be sure to get a good bargain for the same also to have an expert guide who can guide you through the rapids. Avoid rafting during rainy days, though the rafting is not permitted during monsoon. Beware of the Monkeys. One most important point to note. If you are moving in your own cab be careful of the police who at time do not allow private cabs to move up.  Never to forget the holy dip in the Ganges. Will advise you all to bathe at the location of RAM JHULA. Cross the bridge to the other side and walk towards your right till you reach the ghat where you would seen a green fenced area. Very safe for the female visitors. Also least crowded. Enjoy your visit. Blessing from the almighty GANGA. Har Har GANGE!! You  can cross from from RAM JHULA by motor boat @ 10/- per head.

title: Stand There and say 😍
review: It's been my all time favourite thing to do , every time I step on moving Lakshman jhula I stand there in middle of the bridge , close my eyes and feel that coming nice and calm breeze , it's that much awesome that you cannot move your feet away, you can spend whole night , watching that space and feeling that breeze

title: Great bridge
review: Visited in month of May. Very hot . It is heavily crowded and you see many motor bikes crossing the bridge as well. You can see a beautiful and lifetime memorable view from here.

title: Amazing
review: View of mountains, river and the temples across Lakshman Jhula was great experience.

title: It was so scary
review: The bridge was very old and was moving a lot. So I got scared but it was really great and fun. My small brother who is 10years old also enjoyed. So I would suggest to go along with small kids who will really enjoy this place and natural beauty.

title: NIce place for pics
review: Fantaastic looking Laxman Jhoola. too much of crowd around, though.Can skip a trip closer, if it is crowded, since it is clearly visible from many places enroute.

title: Good
review: My family and I visited Laksman Jhula. This is the good tourist attraction. Always good place to visit.

title: Nice
review: Nice river and jhulas we seen at rishikesh.. crowded areas but locations was excellent n relax ...................

title: Nice place
review: Verry good place to see the ganges and Aarti .they should stop bike riding in the bridge, because everyone there is honking you must stop it.

title: Lakshman Jhula Rishikesh
review: Beautiful place at Rishikesh. It is iron suspension bridge for walking across holy river Ganga. It rocks and shake lightly as you/people walk over it. One of the main attractions  in Rishikesh. There are parking, shops, hotels, restaurants near it.

title: Nice Cafe
review: Loved the quaint cafe serving interesting food especially Yak cheese that I tried for the first time :)

title: Great
review: It was a great and must see place. You can saw a beautiful and lifetime memorable view from here. Don't miss it if you are in Rishikesh..

title: Thrilling!!
review: The way it swings with people stepping forward, makes your heart skip a beat if you're there for the first time. And then you start enjoying to see the water under you... the Bikes crossing the Lakshman Jhoola rises the adrenaline. Best of luck.

title: Good shopping, good restaurants.
review: Nice westernized area of Rishikesh.  Good shopping and good restaurants.  Definitely must try Ramanas Garden if you are a vegan.  Beautiful spot and all the proceeds go to the orphanage.  Beware of highly painted Sadhus selling prayers.  They get pretty angry if you don't give them a big enough tip!

title: A pedestrian bridge with noisy two-wheelers
review: There is nothing special about this bridge, except its link to history and legend. You need to take this to get to the other side of the Ganges and sway as you cross, ambling with selfie clicking tourists. The scooters and motorcyles that also use it (against the rules) ruin the fun with their blaring horns.

title: nice place for ganga view
review: nice place to view Ganga over bridge... you can find small and big shops for cloths,foods. near by you will found many hotels and lunges.

title: Mountains,rivers and the Temple
review: Went there  in the month of march for white water river rafting! And it was one of the best thing we have ever done in life. Rishikesh is famous for Ganges, temple, its cultural history and white water rafting. And don't forget to meet the sadhu of rishikesh.

title: Hanging in the sky
review: Ancient suspended bridge in Rishikesh. This is the best area to stay at in town with all the best restaurants and temples.

title: Good place to visit
review: This is a good place to visit at least once with your family......Nice to see the gangaji from the top of jhula.....

title: thrilled to walk across river Ganga on suspension bridge
review: Ram and lakshman Jhulas offer unique experience of walking across the river Ganga on suspension bridges. Its heavily crowded and you see many motor bikes crossing the bridge as well. Honestly i felt authorities should restrict motor bikes to one of the these Jhula's instead of both.. You will also find amazing street food experience on the banks of Ganga, once you go to the other side... sit on the river bank, eat street food, hit one of the many cafes around... watch Aarti to river Ganga... bliss full experience

title: Visit this place @ Night
review: At night this wire rope bridge looks mystically majestic. With very few people around and the sound of the river flowing by it creates a divine atmosphere .

title: Nice attraction
review: It is a very nice place to see .. ganga is more beautiful here.

title: A walk to remember
review: It was a walk to remember with my friends.

title: crowdy and good attraction for childrens
review: Interesting for children's. It is a suspension bridge and takes you from one edge of rishikesh to another side which has parmarth niketan , gita bhawan, triveni ghat , ganga aarti.

title: Lovely bridge
review: I made the round trip countless times while in Rishikesh. It's quite an experience to go along the colourful ropes, with great views to the Ganges and trying to keep away from cows and motorbikes :)

title: View of Ganga ji is good
review: Very old one,swings a lot ..animals and two wheeler and torurists..I don't understand why they were allowing two wheeler on this historical place.Animals also.crowded we need to be cautious for children. View of Ganga ji and rafting is excellent

title: Good visit
review: One of the historical place which is loved by all, right on top of Ganga river, it gives an amazing view.

title: Can not think of Rishikesh without Lakshman Jula
review: A small hanging bridge by which you can cross The Ganga on foot and reach Gita Bhavan area on the other side of Rishikesh. though it is an old bridge, the view is fantastic with the rafting boatsmoving below. However, during the Jatra season (June to August), it is too crowded. In any case, one must visit it while staying in Rishikesh.

title: Was Hilarious
review: Visited Lakshman Jhoola with family and little kids.

title: Good but very crowded
review: Lakshman Jhula is a must visit place in Rishikesh. River Ganga looks beautiful from Lakshman Jhula. However it always remains crowded because of two wheeler, animals and of-course humans.It is difficult to get a snap on Lakshman Jhula because of irritating crowd.

title: Fabulous
review: I went there for fourth time and always feel such a nice place for vacation and always have a great experience there..would like to suggest Everyone to go there and feel the lovely environment

title: Land mark of Rishikesh
review: This is a 450 ft long iron suspension bridge built in 1927-29 by Britishers after washaway of even older bridge in 1924.

title: What to do on jhula is the question
review: The Jhula is like a moving bridge with very less movement. It is not the Jhula that is the main focus of attraction, its the adjoining market area where one may find small souvenirs and hence get the taste of Rishikesh. Bargain and please verify the prices online as the souvenirs are costly in that region.

title: Great place
review: Me and my friends spent a lot of time standing here and feeling the positive vibes. Laxman jhula is a Good example of great engineering .This bridge is very safe and you can get perfect views of River Ganga and mountain .

title: Awe
review: It's nice to see Ganga from lagan jhula. And we found a big market both side of jhula. Everyonr must visit their.

title: Jhula
review: It is a bridge only, but the view of the river Ganga from this bridge is very beautiful, and keep your food inside your Bag while crossing bridge,there are lots of monkeys

title: Mussorie trip
review: Enjoying mussorie, Rishi Kesh, Haridwar trip wid ma family & frnz.....:)

title: Over crowed
review: One of the attractions, usually over crowed. View of the peaks is amazing but the place is just too congested

title: just a hanging bridge
review: Nothin much o say about this bridge, just that it is a hanging bridge. you will find people walking all over and even riding two wheelers, honking all along. View of the Ganga from there will help with understanding how enormous this river is

title: Got caught up in a storm
review: Visited in the evening for Ganga Aarti.

title: Amazing jhoolah
review: Here u will amazing while crossing the jhoola. The other jhoola is ram jhoola is also accessible while returning back. The laxman jhoola is in rishikesh and the main attraction. Enjoy the jhoola.

title: Religious and spiritual feel
review: Very narrow bridge with strong wind. Lots of cafes and ashrams around. Best place to experience ganga maiyya aarti.

title: mesmerizing veiw
review: Well it is just another bridge but it gives u a very good view of the ganga from above and it feels really good.

title: thrilling experience
review: We reached rishikesh in evening of May 27th. First thing we decided was to visit lakshman jhula as it was nearest place of attraction to our hotel. View of ganga aarti from jhula was quite good. though it was little crowded, we spent good amount of time on jhula. All of sudden weather changed. It started raining along with strong wind. Temperature came down quickly. However scary thing happened. due to rain and wind people started trying to cross over in hurry and there was Jam. people were shouting and for time being it felt that something bad is going to happen. jhula was swinging more than normal and people from each side were pushing hard. On top of it many bikewalas got stuck in between who even could not return back. anyway after 10-15 min of horror some sense prevailed to one side and all people form one side returned back letting other side to cross first. thankfully nothing untoward happened. overall it was great experience and at the same time I hope that local administration would take steps to prevent possibility of any mishap.

title: Quite crowded
review: The view is good from the bridge but it is quite crowded with bikes and people passing through a narrow bridge. The bikes honk to make space for their movement and hence it is difficult to stay on the bridge to enjoy the view.

title: Awesome view
review: The view of Ganges river from the bridge was awesome. Its a great suspension bridge. Only part is that the due to two wheelers and bicycles on the bridge the movement of pedestrians was very much restricted.

title: Pedestrian rope bridge
review: Jhula means hanging from rope, named after Laxmanji brother of Lord Ram, i. e. Lakshman Jhula. We found it crowded and the experience is not that much enjoyable due to excessive crowd. It provides beautiful view of river Ganga where you can see pilgrims having bath on ghats, enjoying boat rides alongside of river rafting boats passing under the Jhula.

title: Saw this while rafting!
review: One of many things which come across while rafting on the rapids of River Ganges. This and the second bridge across Ganges ( Ram jhula) are must see things in Hrishikesh

title: local sight seeing stuff
review: bikes, bystanders, vendors, make the fun less with lot of commotion while there. Suggest to park somewhere and keep walking to the place either from main city side or the internal roads.

title: Uttarkhand
review: Plenty of places of interest one must see in and around dehradun like Harithwar, Rishikesh, Missouri. Lakhman juhi,Bathrinath,kethernath, etc., Need atleast 6 to 12 days to cover all places. Taking a local guide who registered by Govt.is a good idea.

title: Lakshman jhula
review: Lakshman Jhula is a must visit place in Holy town of Rishikesh. It's a suspension bridge build over the holy river Ganga. It's 450 meters in length that offers a panoramic view of river Ganga and Rishikesh having numbers of temples. According to Hinduism, this bridge is built in the same place, where Lakshmana once crossed the river Ganges on a jute rope, thus making this another important pilgrim attraction. You can do shopping here, Visit the temples and ashrams. You will also find lot many eating joints nearby that offers pure vegetarian food.

title: Nice spot to spend your evening at Rishikesh
review: Introduction: Completed in 1929, it is an iron suspension bridge connecting two villages: Tapovan in Tehri Garhwal district to Jonk in Pauri Garwhal District. This bridge is 5km long compared to 2km long Ram Jhula situated 2km from here. It is said that Lord Lakshman crossed Ganges on jute ropes between the place from where this bridge is built. Apart from this, you would find a small market while going to this place. Also, there is a famous restaurant Chotiwala, where you can stuff your stomach in the evening.

title: Appreciate this ancient Structural Marvel
review: The Suspension bridge is sure to give a tinge of adrenaline rush especially when the bridge wobbles due to motorcycle movement or a strong breeze...Its an experience of its kind...

title: a good bridge
review: it is a bridge on river.. you can spend 30 minutes here.. you will enjoy if you will come early morning. after noon you will get much crowd. and try to come in rainy day. you will capture good photos.

title: Must visit place in rishikesh
review: Just visited lakshman Jhula at Rishikesh.Nice place .Lots of suspension on it.Ganga river view from Jhula is awesome.

title: Sareen Himalaya beauty
review: Laxman Zula is a great attraction with Sareen beauty of Himalayas with amazing Ganga River flowing with full force before entering ground level at Haridwar.

title: Holy Bridge
review: Lakshmana Jhula is the shorter bridge across Ganga River in Rishikesh. Here another long bridge called  Ram Jhula. Most of the people see beginning of Ganga River from here. Interested people can go towards Gangotri the real beginning.

title: Just a metallic bridge over a river.
review: There's nothing to see it here rather than travel on a metallic bridge from one end to another.

title: nice view
review: If you are in Haridwar/Rishikesh, then you must visit this place.Its a long suspension bridge built across Ganga . Its very crowded. Also, bulls roam around and 2 wheelers are permitted to ply over the bridge which further makes walking across the bridge little bit troublesome. However, the view around is nice with the Ganga flowing below and the magnificent Tera Manzil building in the backdrop.

title: Laxman Jhula the swaying bridge
review: It was our first day(morning) in Rishikesh and the local driver told us that it might rain soon as it has become cloudy, the same evening the wind picked up and when we reached Laxman Jhoola it was very windy, had not seen such strong winds in Mumbai.The bridge sways when the wind is strong and at first it is scary, but there were too many people on the bridge clicking selfies and we too had a good time. The bridge is about 400-500 meters long over river Ganga and it is quiet a view. Must visit , it is an amazing experience.

title: Bridge over Ganges
review: My favorite bridge, Ma Ganga temple is at the foot of the bridge. THis suspension bridge can get very crowded and cows cross the bridge as well. Feed the fish and they will jump up from the Ganges

title: Hanging bridge
review: Laxman jhula is the best place for tourist spacialy the hanging bridge it's a good example of great engineering.

title: Hanging Bridge
review: This bridge with other one (Ram Jhula) is the major attraction in Rishikesh. Bridge is very narrow and will keep on shaking due to people moving or the vehicular movements. The bridge is a great example of Engineering. The view is awesome from the bridge. Ganges running under the bridge, mountains on both the sides of the bridge.

title: Good and religious place to visit
review: It's beautiful and marvelous hanging bridge in the rishikesh. Similar to this a Ram Jhula is nearby.

title: An iconic bridge but very crowded
review: A must visit when you are in Rishikesh its a long suspended bridge made for pedestrians but 2 wheelers also use it some times. The bridge is always crowded be careful from picpockets. Also lookout for monkeys they might just snatch your phone when you are taking a selfie.

title: Very good view
review: Very good view over magnificent & majestic Ganges ... but the Jhoola itself is very crowded and two wheelers make things difficult for pedestrians

title: Swing
review: The so called laxman jhoola is a bridge like a swing... a great moment to stand in misdle and clixk urself with ganga flowing.... mindblowing

title: Beautiful view, great breeze and a light swing
review: An experience in itself to be standing at the mid-point of this bridge.

title: Awesome view
review: Excellent view, this is a must do for anyone visiting Rishikesh. This suspension Bridge offers an imposing view of the numerous ghats on either bank of the holy ganges that flows underneath. Normally it is a crowded place so please go prepared to see a sea of humanity on the bridge.

title: Crowdy Laxman Jhula
review: Its Nice Place to visit in the evening for Sunset but it is little bit crowded with bikes also ferrying on the bridge

title: Wonderful View
review: A wonderful location to visit at. In mid of river, on a bridge with such a windy environment is pleasant and pleasure time spent.

title: Good
review: This is a bridge to walk from one end to other end of Ganges. Sometimes it swings slightly. It's great to see the Ganges River from this bridge. Many people, cows and sometimes 2 wheelers use this.

title: Cool place to visit in summer. Mornings
review: If in rishkiesh u have to go there,  a must visit,  there are a number of places nearby like bharat Mata mandir etc,  and. Loads of accommodation also avilable. Close by.. Go for a riverside place.. It will be an adventure

title: interesting cultural taste
review: nice experience to get a taste of the culture with really cheap souvenir but not clean not safe to eat.

title: Hanging Bridge
review: While walking on this bridge, we feel the shaking of bridge. Good experience & very nice view from the bridge of river Ganga.

title: Visit to Lakshman Jhula
review: We had walk a lot as auto rickshaw do ply to this place...

title: Review
review: Good example of great engineering. Very safe and you can get perfect views of River Ganga and Rafting too.

title: Amazing view
review: the walk away is very nice you will love it  pls make sure you shop along the acarde and small shop damm good

title: The jhula above the holy ganga
review: One can find it hard to cross this moving bridge. ... Because people even ride two wheeler in it witch makes one really difficult to go about.... Yet if you are a selfie lover than dis is the best place to click awesome selfies as well as photos with the great view of the ganga..... Cool place yet very rush..

title: Best Weekend Visit
review: Lakshman Jhoola is a hanging bridge and it was little crowded to cross over, but great place for photoshoot, there were too many monkeys. You can enjoy the visit of Lakshman Jhoola.

title: Peace of mind
review: its one of old cable bridge in india & all over the world people came here & enjoy the beautiful nature & temple.

title: Bustle
review: The bridge at laxman jula is quite something with cows, monkeys, bikes, and lots of people on a bridge of only around 6ft wide, has lots of shops and cafes, cows in the street and no one seems to clear up there mess hence lots of flies.

title: Suspension Bridge...
review: I remember a incident from my childhood when one of my relatives visited this place and told the stories of a bridge which doesn't have Pillars. When I walked over this I understand what kind of Phenomenon it was in early years .

title: You mist ride across it
review: Riding a bullet (cruiser bike) across lakshman jhulla is totally bucket list worthy. If you're a person who love heights and adore the fear of falling/flying, you mist ride across it. I wasn't aware until I did it. This long narrow bridge shakes when there are too many people on it. And the view is unimaginable, you must go there to see how it looks.

title: Best and thrill jhula
review: The jhula is high enough for people to trigger the thrill. With ganga ji flowing underneath. Simply awesome

title: nice place
review: very good view and good place to visit and see when you stand in between feel like jhula , parents visit with your kids they can enjoyed

title: Can't skip this one.
review: If you are in Rishikesh you absolutely can't miss it.

title: Jai Ganga Maiya
review: Nice experience to take your two wheeler over this place.

title: Good
review: The view from the bridge is good you will love it. The only problem I faced was the bridge is hardly 5ft wide and people are driving their two wheelers in the bridge it's not good

title: Hanging bridge
review: Place is of religious importance. Bikers zoom in making bit difficult to walk. You can feel the bridge shake and if strong winds are there (as today), you also need to do the balancing act.

title: Good, crowded, but good to get momentos
review: Laxman Jhoola is a lill crowded, but great for selfies,,, however the shopping area around that is worth visiting the place...

title: good place to cross over
review: very good point to cross over .. must see place to visit.. easy to access at this place... must see spot

title: weekend visit
review: too crowded on weekends and evenings. why they allow two wheelers i dont know. nice view, but you can hardly enjoy it bcos of the crowd

title: Must vist location
review: Traditional hanging bridge will accomodate two wheelers too with occassional friendly monkeys too. Do give them banana. They will snatch it from you

title: Beautiful environment ruined by motor bikes
review: The view from the bridge is spectacular but ultimately the experience is ruined by motorbikes coming over the bridge along with pedestrians. Constant honking from continuous motorbike traffic (often going too fast for the narrow bridge) meant I had to wear hearing protection and cross the bridge as fast as possible. The bridge and shopping area should be free of automobiles and motorbikes - pedestrian only. Shimla's mall road is a perfect example of how well this works.

title: Visist to the famous Lakshman Jhula
review: On our way from Haridwar to Mussoorie, we had a 2-3 hours tour of Hrishikesh. Lakshman Jhula is the icon of this place and is a must visit for historical and other reasons. Built by britishers, it is very well maintained suspension bridge.

title: BEST
review: WE visited RAM Jhula and LAXMAN Jhula this time while doing RIVER RAFTING

title: LAXMAN JHOOLA
review: Flaxman jhoola must be visited once during a lifetime.

title: Must Visit
review: laxman jhula is must visit if you are in Rishikesh. Crowded place always with tourists. This is hanging bridge used to cross river Ganga. Amazing experience crossing this bridge and good ganga river view.

title: No stop in Rishikesh is complete without seeing the Lakshman Jhula
review: Hold on tight to all the goodies in your hands so no monkeys take it and walk your way across the large suspension bridge to see the other side of the river. Watch rafts float below and feel the slight sway of the bridge.

title: One of the main attraction of rishikesh .
review: Comes in important list of attractions of Rishikesh.

title: Having seen so many suspension bridges around the world, this one is nostalgic bringing back memories of childhood visit
review: Grealiss and sainhood here.t view both side of the bridge. Have a swing and enjoy the sacred pure ganga. Ashrams on the other side of the bridge are worth the visit. Lots of great saints had b

title: good placr
review: awsome place.. and the adventure walking  on the julla... please visit.. the ganges is so beautiful from here

title: Pretty cool
review: It was kind of adventure to walk on this, it actually keep on moving up & down depending upon the wind while ganga is flowing down.

title: Rishikesh beauty
review: i have been travelling this place while my yoga course in rishikesh.....the bridge is beatiful and happy to be here....

title: Crowded Place
review: Our auto dropped us 1 kilometer away from lakshman jhula. Then we walked to reach there. It seems that it remains crowded all the time. Two Wheeler creates a lot of nuisance there. The scene from Lakshman Jhula was awesome.

title: amazing place
review: A must visit place..such a beautiful place to visit this place has got everything to satisfy adventurous groups and people

title: Surreal experience
review: As soon as I was outside Jolly grant airport, the atmosphere was full of religion and spirituality​. With the road lined with restaurants and shops inviting the tourists.

title: Awesome Experience
review: It was awsome experience at Lakshman Jhula .

title: No use
review: I don't know about others but I didn't loved it though I don't have any complaints. Seriously people are visiting this place to just have a look of jhula I am surprised

title: Walking Bridge
review: It's an average walking bridge that gets very crowded with people, mopeds and cows. It is the best way to cross the river but nothing special.

title: Pride of Rishikesh
review: Lakshman Jhula is to Rishikesh what the Eiffel tower is to Paris. Ok I am taking it too far, but we get the drift. It's a cable strewn hanging pedestrian bridge (used by two wheelers too) across the Ganga river. Commissioned in the 1930s, Lakshman Jhula is built where it's said Lakshman performed penance for his killings in the Lanka battle.

title: Must visit once.
review: If you are in Rishikesh, you must visit this attraction once for sure. Always full of tourists, it is a busy place. However, even if u try to skip it you can not coz every1 present there will suggest & you to visit it.

title: Amazing view of rishikesh's ashrams
review: We visited during late night. There wasn't much crowd, it was an nice experience - cool breeze, great view of ashrams.

title: Too crowded
review: It is too crowded. Two wheelers are allowed on this narrow bridge makes it messy. Nevertheless it has beautiful view of river Ganga.

title: A place to remember.
review: It was my twice visit in life in Rishikesh. Fantastic ! Even if you have no religious mind, will love to visit the place. The place could really be the world heritage and could be the international tourist attractive if the Administration could be proactive. It is really true sense of "Incredible India"! Unfortunately, we are destroying it day to day, every day ! The calm, cool heavenly environment is becoming ruthlessly destroyed by all of us.... we the poor Indian responsible for such destruction !

title: Good view point
review: A suspended bridge with great views but walk across carefully be ready to encounter cows , motorists on this bridge. Amazing Engineering skills. A marvel to experience wherein with so many footsteps it still stands head strong..A must visit

title: too crowded
review: religious significance apart the place is too crowded and with motor cycles zipping across it is a bit congested can spend about 10 minutes and looking at ganges is breathtaking

title: Picturesque bridge, but motorbikes and cows bloke it.
review: It gets blocked to the point where foot traffic will come to a standstill. Putting up posts on either side to prevent cows and motorbikes would prevent this.

title: Blessed to be near Ganges
review: Laxman is the place where all the year so many tourist come ,it has its own energy of place there is first of all maa Ganga is blessing people and second there so many activities providing,one of the best place in India..

title: Holiday trip
review: Worth visiting, take guided tour the first time so you see all the best parts, then it's worth going back on your own. To have a more in depth look around. Not just this place but all around this area. Well worth it.

title: Old bridge busy with foreigners, monkeys, beggars, photographers....
review: It's so mesmerizing to visit Luxman Jhoola bridge and specially when you struggle to cross it on foot. Monkeys, beggars, bikers, cows and what not. Luxman Jhoola receives more foreigners & have more restaurants catering to their palate than anywhere else in Rishikesh. I will highly recommend jet boat tour which is  when you cross the jhola ( Rishikesh end ) and take a right. Operators name is Arpit Kukreja & his number is +919897390760. Can communicate in both. Prices are reasonable.

title: Bridge over the Ganga
review: Great view of the famous Ganga river.  Both sides have shopping, food and accommodations.  Great sunrise and sunset views.

title: Its Wonderful
review: Since Childhood we heard about Ram Jhula & Laxman jhula. Its an amazing experience to walk on this specially during Morning.

title: blissful
review: Well I intended to review my whole journey but its fine. The sight is worth visitng. You will find everything you need to visit in rishikesh near laxman jhula. Go for river rafting and campling. make friends. look at the stars at night. the place is amazing. wnt find anything better

title: Divine bridge
review: This bridge is overcrowded but still worth a visit.One can enjoy a walk,seeing ganga river.One can also spot some rafting boats.

title: Crowded bridge
review: Beautifully situated bridge, but look at it from a distance. On the bridge the constant honking of scooters makes it not so suited for tourist visits. It gives a nice view over the Ganga banks though

title: Amazing vibe
review: Amazing place so much culture so much to see i can only say take a walking tour to get the most from this trip food is also available everywhere were

title: Lakshaman jhulla
review: It is bridge (Laksahman jhulla ) over the gangas river and at the middle of the bridge nature view is awesome and you can click the nice pics and enjoy the weather if you will visit in rishikesh must go to over there.

title: Good view at Sunset
review: If you are there in Rishikesh, you surely cannot miss this.

title: One of two iconic landmarks
review: I have made a number of trips to Rishikesh these past 16 years and each visit I sense the backdrop that the two bridges place in anchoring this town above Mother Ganges. Located upstream is Laxman Jhula bridge and for me it first begins with a visit to the German Bakery.  The many monkeys about the bridge are more than willing to have a go at stealing your boon should you not be attentive to their presence.  The stroll across the bridge is shared with two wheelers and four legged ones and of course the humans, the latter in abundance on Special holy days.  Temples abound as well as street vendor of all sorts.  Cross the bridge, turn right and approximately a kilometre downstream across from the police station take the break in the wall out to Mother Ganges where you can bathe, if so inclined. Carry along the river bank southward and you approach the other bridge Ram Jhula. Here you can walk across or take a boat ride.  Catch a Vickram back to your beginning.

title: Imp part of Rishikesh
review: Below the Ganges is the very beautiful built Laxman jhula.. connection two sides of the city

title: Great views
review: This bridge offers great views, but watch your surroundings! There's lots of people, monkeys, cows, scooters, people wanting photos, all the typical roadblocks in India.  I think that an improvement that could be made would be to make it so scooters cannot access the bridge. It might make it less busy.

title: Strong infrastructure
review: You would find a lot of temples & ashrams from this place. Some of which have Ganga aarti in the evening. This is well built, a lot of 2 wheeler travel throughout the day on the same.

title: certainly not just a landmark
review: A lot in Rishikesh goes on at and around "Lakshman Jhula". So get off there to explore gems, religion and shopping you don't want to miss as a tourist. Then walk the bridge. It feels gigantic. And then go and compare it with the other one, "Ram Jhula".

title: Worth visiting even if you have been before
review: This place is worth visiting if you are in that area. My only complain for this place is why two wheelers are allowed to cross on the pull which is meant for people.

title: Good and attractive place.
review: Good and attractive place.

title: Mixed review
review: The location is awesome. The view is out of the world. The environment is very serene and intoxicating.

title: Good view but annoying surrounding
review: The bridge itself looks serene over the river Ganga.

title: Nice view but crowded.
review: So this bridge is a very crowded area with people, bicycles, motorcycles and monkeys. It's a nice view over the Ganges. It's nice to cross it once, after that it feels more of a burden when you need to cross it because it's usually very crowded.

title: Its a brand for rishikesh
review: I have been to this place many times. You just need to stand on it and lost in the sound of holy water of ganges........

title: View
review: Prefer morning walk to enjoy the breeze and calmness, and mesmerizing ganga river in it's full glory. Peak hours it's mess with tourist posing for pictures and two wheelers honking.

title: Too crowded
review: The only thing which makes this bridge special is its proximity to Ganga river !

title: Must See..!
review: This Jhula is something everyone must cross once. This beautifully done and more then 50 years old now.

title: Will be difficult to avoid if you go to Rishikesh
review: Laxman as Ram is the bridge that connects the two sides of Rishikesh above the ganga, it has an amazing view towards the ganga and the two sides of the town, in pick up hours is full of people and bikes, is good to be aware while crossing the bridge. One must go place if you´r going to Rishikesh, will be difficult to avoid it hehe.

title: Cool place
review: It's a suspension bridge connecting the two banks of Ganga river painted in tricolour. Too crowdy on the weekends. Good construction. Lots of shops on the other end of bridge. Worth spending an hour walking across the bridge and shopping in the adjacent shops.

title: Can You Review a Bridge?
review: It's not the most wide of river crossings so you have to share it (at close proximity) with cows, monkeys, motorbikes and many camera happy salesmen but it makes it very lively, for a bridge.

title: a suspension bridge
review: connects the two banks, you get a spectacular view of river Ganga. as it is suspension one, you can feel the movements of the bridge.

title: Mr
review: Vary Good Arti and joy to participate and feel the peaceful ceremony at Triveni ghat

title: Beautiful
review: Lakshman Jhula is a beautiful area with a cool walking/motor cycle bridge to get across the Ganga. Be aware of the monkeys though, if you have any food or drink they will try to take it and sometimes can be scratchy and bite.

title: Relax
review: Enjoyed our journey during whole travel of irishikesh ..visit both the bridge of ram and laxman jhula and enjoyed with aarti  section also ...

title: Jhula trek
review: Nice walk to other side of Rishikesh. Crosses over to more shops and cultural sites. There is a lot if bustle on the jhula from motor bikes to cows and monkey's.

title: Great place
review: Religious place.

title: Lovely
review: I love this place! It is full of interesting people, events and workshops. If you enjoy yoga, this is the place to be!

title: Hell
review: Once, crossing the jhula was an unique experience. The view from the Jhula with its rhythmic movement used to provide another dimension to overall experience. Now the jhula has lost its old charms due to heavy traffic of motor bikes and cycles. Whole surrounding area is highly commercialised.

title: Fun but busy!
review: Both the bridges in Rihikesh are a must! It is lovely to walk over the Ganga but the constant honking and cajoling of the motorbikes is annoying. You have to keep moving and its hard to take in a good view.

title: amazing view
review: since being a spiritual person my main moto to visit the lakshman jhula was to attend the ganga arti. It was such an amazing experince for me.

title: Stunning view!
review: Lakshman Jhula is the most popular landmark in Rishikesh. It is a 450-ft long iron and cable suspension bridge and connects Tehri and Pauri district. Walking the bridge is not so easy. It sways to and fro even on the calmest weather days. You can find scooters, bicycles, monkeys and cows trying to use the bridge and things become tad bit difficult. But the stunning view of the Ganges makes all worth it!

title: Nice view of the City and Ganga
review: Being a must visit place in Rishikesh, it is crowded. Even the two wheelers ply on the narrow suspension bridge. But still, when atop, you get a very good view of the city at both ends. Even the clear greenish water of the Ganges when looked form the top is exhilarating.

title: Visit to rishikesh
review: Excellent wonderful designed bridge from there u can have good picturesque of holy  river Ganga. The laxman  jhulla connect the swarm ashram with main badrinathroad

title: Ganga Aarti
review: Excellent view of holly river Ganga from Lakshman Jhula . Good restaurants and market near Lakshman Jhula

title: Nice to bounce back
review: It's a beautiful bridge made up with wires and bounce back if you jump on it. :) Nice view of river Ganga. Surrounding market is good but too costly.

title: Awesome View
review: This place is incredible.

title: Stay at Green Hills
review: Hotel centrally located, clean ,rooms spaceous and very comfortable.

title: Wonderful
review: Loved rishikesh. Amazing views, experience and atmosphere at the bridge. Loads of food, shopping and activities right beside the bridge

title: Awesome
review: Yoga heaven. This is a great place and great location. So many awesome people. Such great colours. You can do yoga everywhere as there is so many schools. The bridges are a little small so it's hard to get across during busy seasons. I will definitely go back one day.

title: Interesting with stunning views but annoying motorcycles
review: The bridge is interesting and there are lots of activities on both ends.  Pedestrian traffic is heavy and non stop.  Annoying however are the motorcycles. Their honking is just ear piercing.  They should not be allowed on the narrow bridge.

title: Picture Perfect
review: Rishikesh is a beautiful city and the Lakshman Jhula bridge is a perfect place to enjoy the sites and scenes.  Besides being one of the few ways to cross the river, the bridge is a destination point all on its own.  The graceful suspension bridge highlights the unique architecture of the city and green forests climbing the hills beyond.  Picture Perfect.  The surrounding streets are great for wandering, exploring and soaking up the culture.

title: Must visit if you're in Rishikesh
review: Some of the best cafes are around Lakshman Jhula area and it offers the better views of Ganga. If you're hungry and looking for some delicious, healthy, vegan or raw food - Head towards Lakshman Jhula.

title: The main attraction in Rishikesh
review: If you are in Rishikesh, the first place you would be compelled to see is Lakshman Jhula. It is a suspension bridge across the Ganges for people to cross over from west to east or vice versa. There are scores of temples around this place. You could buy curios, jewellery, idols or learn yoga, go for a massage or adventure activities. The Ganges is calm and the flow is slower compared to Haridwar.

title: Good Site Seen
review: Site seen are good, view from the temple top  is very awesone. full enjoyment place for all guys, a place for meditation as well, bath with holy water a unique exp.

title: A nice confusion
review: Pedestrian, moto, bycicles, cows, monkeys all together going across and rafting below. Restaurants both sides

title: Monkey Bridge
review: Watch out for the produce carts, motorbikes, and monkey fights. It's a busy bridge, so be mindful while enjoying the wonderful views.

title: BEAUTIFUL AND STRONG
review: Amazing must watch place... its very windy on the bridge... plus below the bridge u can take nice swim in the fast flowing cold watered ganga river...

title: Interesting around this area.
review: Do spent some time around each side of the bridge. On the west side (left) tucked up on the the hill a little walk from the bridge is an alley walk way that weaves around some very cute shops and cafes. If you didn't know you could easily miss them. Cafes have floor mats and cushions with views over the Ganges.

title: Сrowded, but in good condition
review: Before nine at the morning bridge  is almost empty, during the day it's always full with tourists, motorbikes, monkeys and beggars. It opens nice view to Ganga and it was very windy at the morning time. You can not visit Rishikesh and have not cross Lakshman Jhula.

title: Prominent attraction in Rishikesh
review: This is an iron suspension bridge built over River Ganga.  We visited it during the evening time.  It was very crowded at that time. Pedestrians, bikers and animals like cow and bull were seen using this bridge to cross over to the other side of the river.  Several monkeys could be seen on the poles around the bridge.

title: Fun Experience
review: Great market place with a variety of cafes and bistros and mouthwatering roadside eateries

title: Bridge over Ganges
review: This bridge gives a glimpse of Ganges from a good height. You can see fishes in water from there and pass from one end to other end of Ganga.

title: Ideal location for photography
review: Visited the Lakshman Jhula at 7 in the morning. Was very windy and enjoyed the cool wind soothing the face. Ideal location for selfies and nature photography

title: Home away from Home
review: With a wide range of cafes and hotels and shops this is purely a home away from home. This is also the last point of rafting in rishikesh and the best time to visit is december to march.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: A suspension bridge with a difference for anyone from the western world, given its historic significance and the atmosphere.

title: Monkey mischief.
review: Stayed in Haridwar and went to Rishikesh for the day. Crossed the bridge and an Indian man walking in front of me was grabbed by the leg by a large male monkey. I kept my eye on it as I passed but another male on the railing grabbed my arm leaving superficial scratches. Neither of us was carrying food and luckily they had gone when it was time to cross back over. Don't like monkeys much and probably more of interest in Haridwar with the variety of people along the Ganges and at Har Ki Pauri Ghat. I guess it is more about meditation and yoga at Rishikesh and there are a lot more 'Europeans'.

title: Must Walk on this Bridge
review: India first motorable iron suspension bridge . Must experience walk during early morning or late night when no one is there on the bridge and to much flow of wind

title: The moment of mental peace
review: Lakshman Jhula over the river Ganga is situated in Rishikesh to connect the two opposite parts . One of the main attraction is the Arti during the evening times around 6 pm . The Arti gives a different feel to you , a sense of calmness  and positively all over you . Thats what god is all about .

title: Holy place Rishikesh
review: Laxman Jhoola is a place for every one to visit who is in search of inner peace.

title: Marvelous Engineering
review: An iron bridge built over River Ganga to connect it's two banks during British Period.  It's a motorable Bridge.  Two wheeler and pedestrians are allowed on the bridge.  Several monkeys can be seen on the bridge railings and also walking on the bridge, without any fear of humans.

title: Good attraction
review: The bridge is a very good attraction , the walk over Ganga river is very enjoyable . Please try to take a guide , who can show you many temples situated around this area , including Lakshman temple , Shiva temple and a lot of ashrams , and explain their significance .

title: Great Central tourist location
review: The Laksman Jhula bridge is an impressive piece of engineering. It is a great central location with many restaurants, shops and temples on either side of the Ganga river. The bridge can be a crazy place, with people, motorbikes, cows, monkeys and dogs all vying to get across. But that is just the wonderful nature of India.

title: Laxman Jula visit
review: Lovely bridge accross the Ganges. What was ment for walking is now used by two wheelers !!!what a shame. People get knocked by these motorbikes. Now cows ,monkeys and monkeys on bikes compete with humans....a disaster awaiting to happen

title: Interesting place for visit
review: There is a possibility to be aware about local traditions, spirituality, to see Ganga valley. There are different caffeys, small local shops

title: What a view of mother ganges
review: bridge is always crowded but the view of river flowing under is really pleasant.Try to visit early morning you would find it peacefull

title: Lakshman jhoola
review: Just don't opt for any guide as there is nothing historic that only a guide can tell u. Chotiwalla restaurant was very gud. Cheese pizza can be a must try here

title: Lakshman Jhula in Rishikesh
review: Jhula in Hindi means swing and this bridge really seems to move.You can feel it like ripples. A beautiful,serene location where from both sides you can see the lovely temples and the Ganga flowing.Been thrice and would love to go again. If flying to Dehradun you can go from airport and then go to Rishikesh town or on to Haridwar.

title: Bridge across the Ganges
review: A very busy pedestrian bridge across the Ganges used happily by not only pedestrians but motorcycles, monkeys etc

title: Architectural Marvel
review: An architectural marvel of modern times, this is an Iron bridge built to connect two banks of River Ganga in Rishikesh. This was built during British period. It's a great experience to walk over the bridge, watch river Ganga and distant Himalayan foot hills.

title: Classic experience
review: Peaceful... Mind blowing...N very spiritual.. Experience at Rishikesh....Every one should visit at Rishikesh..It's ultimate experience..

title: Fun in every swing
review: Good and refreshing, clean breathable air. The view is very good and it connects two side of majestic scenery.

title: My favorite
review: This is my favorite place and you can spend hours standing on lakshman jhula.  you will find many monkeys and you have to be little careful.

title: It's a bridge!
review: It's just a bridge with a few monkeys, an odd cow and way too many motorbikes.

title: Main spot of Rishikesh.
review: It is the main spot of Rishikesh. Generally crowded at all times, great view of river Ganga from here. Evening aartis ( prayers ) are must if you are at Lakshman Jhula

title: Ganges flow is best felt here
review: If anyone wants to feel the magical prowess of Ganges its the place to be. Walking to the spot is best way to feel the fresh cold moisturised air. Ignore animals and heaps if garbage along the road leading to it

title: Ancient architecture is the best!
review: Just spending a few minutes standing on the bridge, listening to the natural sounds of river flowing, wind, etc will get you energized!

title: Nice place full of tourists
review: The lakshman jhoola is smaller one of the 2 suspended bridges. Ram jhoola and Lakshman jhoola. Its nice n full of tourists. The mandir on the other side is very popular and there is also a german bakery serving delightful meals.

title: Magical Mother Ganga energy!
review: While in Rishikesh, this is a must! The bridge crosses over the emerald green Ganga River where you can watch children bathing, people doing their pujas (rituals) while placing flower offerings on the water,  rafts drifting down the river rapids... And of course, be prepared to share the bridge with awesome monkeys, cows, motorcycles and lots of tourists :) All this, sorrounded by majestic Himalayan mountains and crisp blue skies!!!

title: Best people and monkey scene!
review: So amazing to watch the activity here! Monkeys, cows, people, motorcycles, bikes, music - spectacular mix of sound, smell, sights, sensations & organized Chaos ever!

title: Best of both worlds
review: The Ganges can be seen in its raw beauty from Lakshman jhula. Stroll in the lanes and by lanes and discover lovely cafes and bakery , junk jewellery and reasonably priced spas. It's amazing how it can be peaceful and hip and happening at the same time!

title: Get the Feel
review: I visited in first week of January & I just took a slow walk with my friends over the bridge and the air was so fresh & refreshing.

title: Mesmerized by its location
review: Excellent place, so calm and peaceful.. The only annoying thing is people on two wheelers honking.. Government should ban such people

title: Brilliant bridge design
review: It was awesome experience walking on Lakshman Jhula!! It sways a bit whenever a 2 wheeler vehicle passes through, quite a thrilling fun! View of the mighty Ganges from the bridge is quite scenic with the mountains in the background.

title: Great Walk
review: All the way round is what you need to do. Cross this bridge, enjoy the view of the Ganga and both sides of it, Tapovan and Laxman Jhula. Watch out for the scooters and monkey's. Once on the other side follow the Rd down to Ram Jhula and cross back over the Ganga, then follow the road back  up to your starting point. It's a great walk.

title: just lovely
review: its always nice to come here and interact with lice. just colourful and amazing…what with all the jewellery

title: Great view of the Ganges
review: The sheer view of the Ganges makes this a must visit place. Very nice place but overcrowded most of the time.

title: Watch Ganga Aarti and take a walk
review: Evening walk along the river was unwinding! there are several Ganga Aartis in the evening. for photos and prayer.

title: great architecture
review: we liked the architecture and view from jhula. and yes the thrill of movement in the bridge is nice. its very crowded during afternoon and evening so prefer night.

title: For coffee
review: I go lakshnan Jhula for coffee so I got honeyhut it's great plays for coffee and sweet all this by honey it's lovely

title: Bridge over holy waters!
review: The Lakshman jhula is a suspension bridge over the river Ganga in Rishikesh. It is something of a landmark here with large crowds of people visiting especially in the evenings. Surprisingly 2 wheelers abound on the bridge and have  tendency to keep honking which detracts from the experience. Also watch out for the monkeys on the bridge.

title: ONCE
review: Historic..... and a must visit once. Cross over and come back to original bank in the the boat .... thats where ur car is....

title: Great view - slide through the alleyways as people wake, the city awakes. The jhula is relatively quiet and beautiful.
review: Go early in the morning, as the city awakes. You will never forget the scenic beauty, the quietness and tranquility of the ganges

title: A must for India travel.
review: Maa Ganga at her best! Expect to be approached for everything. Donations, hand-outs, food, jewelry, you name it. Monkeys and cows included will also approach you for anything good like. Bridge is chaotic and busy afternoon until dusk. Best time to visit is in the AM before noon.

title: view
review: Lakshman jhula is a hanging bridge on river Ganges .water is very transparent.from bridge lot fishes can be seen.good for photography

title: Nice place to hangout
review: Was not very crowded but I m sure will be very crowded in the season. Good place to hangout.

title: A very interesting place spoiled with lot of tourists and commercialization
review: The place is filled with tourists and sellers of all sort of things. The bridge is a steady one and not a hanging bridge. You find animals to vehicles to lot of idiotic people on the bridge.

title: Interesting, but too commercial
review: The bridge itself is OK, but it's spoiled by the fact that motorcycles and scooters are allowed on the bridge and the drivers are often completely inconsiderate of pedestrians. It should be a foot bridge only. Sometimes the winds coming down the river are so strong you can't even go on the bridge. I tried one time even though I saw no one else on the bridge and I was immediately flattened against the netting. I had to inch my way back and wait for the winds to die down. Don't have food in your hand or the monkeys will steal it. Yesterday I as I was crossing, I saw three monkeys with stolen ice cream cones, etc.

title: FAVORITE PLACE ON EARTH
review: I absolutely loved crossing this bridge almost everyday. There's always a lot of rich life, conversation, and energy every time I walked through it. Great food and cafes nearby too. I miss this place!

title: Excellent Place Spoilt by locals
review: This is a busy bridge from where we can have great views of River Ganga. However, as is every where else, proper maintenance is a problem and locals have not maintained approach road to Laxman Jhula. We can maintain such places to boost our ratings in the eyes of all Indians as well as Foreigners who come to rishikesh pulled by our rich heritage. We must show them our neat and clean places with pride.

title: Crowded bridge
review: One of the twin bridges over Ganga in Rishikesh.  Its a bridge from which you can have view of Ganga for free.  Most of the times it's crowded with constant honking from two wheelers.   This is not a destination per se. You can visit Laxman and Ram Jhula(bridge) while exploring Rishikesh.  Beware of monkeys on the bridge- do not eat, carry or open any eatables while on bridge.  Also,  be careful if you click selfies- there are lot of holes and if the mobile slips from your hands,  it'll go down straight  to Ganga.

title: Amazing experience !!!
review: Had a great time....... Visited many temples and had great fun with friends. The place need to be more tidy and clean.

title: Disappointing
review: We had heard so much about this iconic spot but it was a total disappointment. Scooters and motor bikes made it impossible to walk. To enjoy the beauty of ''tis place only pedestrians should be allowed on the bridge. Otherwise there is nothing great about trying to save yourself from the two wheelers.

title: Iconic
review: The most iconic scene in Rishikesh.

title: Spiritual Retreat
review: Visiting Rishikesh and the wonderful sights and sounds at the Lakshman Jhula is a profound experience.

title: Wow
review: Such a creative stuff by the nature, this is the most lovable place in Rishikesh. I would be going again in next winter again to experience the Jhula

title: Wow feeling
review: I was very scared of height and when I travelled on lakman jhula was not aware about that it swings for bit and when I was walking on it. The feeling was that I am on se-saw. Brillant stuff and people are honest and helful

title: Still the same but still very lovely
review: Yes whenever I had stand in the middle of the bridge or jhoola I felt the same old feeling of my childhood enjoying the bridge shaking or like flying between two worlds. You will really love this place without doubt.

title: Must visit
review: Long hanging bridge across River Ganges . once you cross it takes you to Ram jhula,Nice walk  on other side of the river

title: Connector
review: Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula is connectors that are part of your daily city travel. When you walk first time across Jhula its full of excitement as you can enjoy top view  Divine Ganga. Good selfi spot.

title: Visit early morning
review: I visited Laxman Jhula early morning - it was very chilly and a bit foggy. If you are looking for a different experience all together then do visit in early morning time.

title: Fun and Memorable Part of Rishikesh
review: This bridge is one of the main pedestrian (and motorcycle) connectors between Laskhman Jhula and Rishikesh. It's a cool suspension bridge, but beware of the monkeys who will take any food you have while crossing. Also, there are many tourists and Indians who want to take photos with you so it's not a very quiet place.

title: Enjoy the Chilled Wind Flow
review: The most beautiful click one can have of Rishikesh is from here. The Bridge vibrates when the wind flows hard. The Scenery on both sides are amazing.

title: Bad maintenance by govt
review: A very good spot and can be a beautiful tourist spot however is very badly maintained. Tourists are allowed to throw plastic packets, food objects, other/disposable objects from the jhula to the Ganges below. Small bridge and all kind of vehicles are allowed to pass on it causing chaos. The Ganges from that point is just allowed to get dirty. The govt or local administration need to take responsibility for keeping the Ganges NAD area clean, they get paid for it.

title: Must visit
review: Excellent view of the Holy Ganga. Good for shopping some Gems and prayers stuff., A place full of Ashram

title: Great Ganga View but very crowded
review: Laxman Jhula offers great views to the River Ganga & a good picture spot. However, the 2-wheeler passing by all the time on the narrow footover bridge makes it very crowded & noisy.

title: Good view of Sacred ganga along with peace....
