review: Rishikesh is one the most sacred place for hindus... Lakshman jhula is located in the main city of Rishikesh and connects the ghats with the main city. You can get an amazing view and feel the breeze of river ganga flowing down this bridge...

title: Religious
review: Worth one time visit. Nice to see a hanging bridge. Hope government would put up some information on its design.

title: a must see in rishikesh
review: cool suspension bridge with lovely views over the ganges. traffic over the bridge includes people, cows, scooters and motorcycles. be wary of the cheeky monkeys climbing on the bridge too.

title: Excellent View
review: Lakshman Jhula is one of the main attraction in Rishikesh.It has a beautiful view .Its main bridge to cross the Gangas

title: Awesome View
review: The best view to have a glimpse of the river. The annoying thing is 2- wheelers moving thru the bridge, because of which there is lots of disturbances to stand still and view the scenery.

title: Visit, if you like small street shops
review: the jhula, (bridge) has mythological significance though it's now rebuilt for the convenience of the commuters. the way to the jhula goes through a small passage, which has a lot of small shops that sell jewellery, clothes, fresh lime sodas, statues etc for the tourists. Bikes and pedestrians can pass from this bridge, but no four wheelers.

title: Good views, but not so great a walk
review: Walking on this bridge does give some great views of the Ganges especially during dusk, but the constantly honking vehicles passing by this narrow bridge make the walk not a very pleasant one. Crossing the bridge from Rishikesh city side leads to small street shops selling various paraphernalia. One can find some good book shops too.

title: Its winters and the wind so super chilled
review: I revive my childhood memories visiting this place and it feels so into peace every time I  am here, Love this place!

title: laxman jhoola
review: a good place to roam around. the local market and the shops around are great. the experience on the bridge above the river was great

title: Its a very nice bridge over the flowing river
review: Its a good place to go if visiting with family. They will love a little walk over the river. Also there are lot of temples around laxman jhula, which elders can enjoy in Rishikesh

title: Iconic landmark lacks maintenance
review: This iconic landmark is the best place in the world to witness activities on both sides of river. But unfortunately one won't be able to stand for a second to soak the atmosphere. Always honking 2 wheelers passing across the 3 feet wide bridge with both directions traffic is going to annoy one. Will request relevant administration to create another flower for transportation commute to retain originality of the landmark.

title: Peace in the air
review: Had awesome time with my two kids they loved it! Had coffee cross @ German bakery which was delicious. If you have time then take cup of coffee Abd look the scenery!

title: lovely walk across the river
review: laxman and ram jhula are the two walking bridges across the river ganges in rishikesh and there is a lot of buzz around these bridges with hawkers selling their wares, food stalls, eateries and restaurants. overall a brilliant hangout place

title: Nice spot!
review: The German Bakery right next to Laxman Jhula serves the yummiest pastries, rolls and coffee. Also watch out for the monkeys on the Jhula.

title: Temple heaven
review: Amazing area ...endless opportunities for yoga ,meditation, prayer.

title: Nice experience
review: Laxman jhula is iron suspension bridge when you cross that you feel like it is swinging so it is called jhula. It leads you to parmeshvar aarti and other ganga Arti places. You cross Ganges via this bridge to go on the other side. You should go to have fun while crossing it. Two wheelers also go on this bridge. We went on foot and it was a nice experience.

title: Don't miss feeding trout!
review: Laxman Jhula is the most popular attraction in Rishikesh. But not only the bridge itself attracts people, but school of trout that appears right under the bridge, hungry for the food. Just buy a bunch of wheat balls from locals sitting next to Laxman Jhula, and drop it down into the waters from the bridge. You'll be amazed with the amount of the fish and its size! Don't miss it!)

title: Nice quite place
review: Green river, nice quiet people, good food, ayurveda massage , clean city , nice to walk in the night, many temples, fire ceremonies by the river every nights, very nice landscapes.

title: Everything!
review: Watch the monkeys, the bikes and cows crossing the bridges, the saddhus and all possible traffic on the bridge. Everywhere you turn, there is a yoga school or a store that offers something for the yogi, incense, meditation singing bowl, punjabi pants, malas, shawls, bangles, restaurants, good eats, puja items, everything to feast the senses. The most iconic landmark, the Triyambakashwar temple at the foot of the bridge. You can also float on the raft to the Ganges. You can spend a day here feeling holy, looking awed or just relaxing. This is the best of Himalayas

title: Good for travellers
review: Lots of café's, shops, yoga and massage in Lakshman Jhula.

title: Good sightseeing
review: Very nice sightseeing spot for buying buddhist souvenirs although i wish there were more Jain food options here.

title: Nice experience
review: Lakshman Jhula provides a nice experience. I believe it is best enjoyed when there is less crowd. The Ganga and the cool breeze make this place worth visiting. The two-wheelers can be a nuisance though.

title: Authentic beautiful area of Rishikesh
review: Local, authentic, hectic, yoga and yogis everywhere, great cafe was next to Ganga, beautiful, India.

title: Average
review: We walked from Ram Jhula to Laxman Jhula. The walk is pretty good all along the Ganges and thru rural surroundings.

title: A good experience
review: A great experience working over the Laxman Jhula.  Looking down over free flowing of the Ganges river. Before you reach the  Jhula ... there are some good shopping with good prices. An amazing experience.

title: Old memories
review: Reviving my childhood memories of Lakshman Jhula, I felt the same excitement on it. When you stand on the jhula, you can actually feel the swing which has given it its name.

title: Great View from Jhula
review: A must visit for trourists. It is nice to walk through Lakshman Jhula and take some good snaps :-) We had great View from the Jhula. Enjoyed seeing newly built Sathya Sai Ghat from the Jhula.

title: Great view
review: Lovely place for sunrise or sunset photo shooting. You'll have a great view for the entire zone, also you'll fine very good places to shop and eat around.

title: The hanging bridge
review: I was in Rishikesh for 3 days in October. Lakshman jhula is usually very crowded in the evening and almost vacant early in the morning. I experienced it almost during the entire day n evening too. If u really want to click pictures and experience the best of it, do visit this place during the sunrise (early morning).

title: Must Visit..
review: A must visit on your trip to Rishikesh. The plus points are the views, the feel of the floor moving due to the weight bearing on the hanging bridge. The downside is the monkey menace, who scares the children and grown ups alike. Must visit but only once.

title: Visiting Lakshman Jhulla
review: This is the Most Popular attraction of Rishikesh. You can cross this Jhulla & take pics as many as you wish. One side is connected with Hotels & the other side is connected with Markets.

title: Beautiful Riskikesh
review: We visited here in October 2016, its the place that the Beatles landed in the 60's and stayed for 3 months! To get to the Aarti ceremony you cross the suspension bridge which is absolutely fine in the daylight but coming back in the evening was a bit hair raising with motorbikes crossing as well!  The ceremony was very spiritual and took place whilst the sun was setting, very lovely.  Rishikesh itself was delightful to walk around, lots of things to buy and barter for!  Hoping to go back some day!

title: A Nice start in India
review: As a first timer in India, i find This place very easy. People talk english, there are a lot of Nice guest houses, and all kinds of activities. Yoga and meditation is the main attraction, but there is a lot of other things to do here. We rented a scooter and watched the sunrise from Kunja Puri, took a swim on a beach by the Ganga, and saw a lot of great nature along the ride. You can also visit the Ashram where Beatles stayed, have a talk with babas or enjoy some alone time at the many nice cafes in town. If you are interested in knowing the Indian culture then it probably isn't the best place, but if you make an effort im sure they will take you in. Now in December the Ganga is pretty and greenblue and I find that the place has a nice spiritual atmosphere.

title: Modern Architectural marvel
review: Walking on the bridge is thrilling to reach the other side of the river bank. People used to cross the bridge by scooter/bike too. Expect some cows and monkeys on your way in the MIDDLE OF THE BRIDGE.

title: Good experience - nothing astronomical
review: This is a good place to spend 10-mins in between your planned day at Rishikesh. Nothing great, the ghat looks nice during sunrise / sunset. There are rafts coming downstream all the time, adds to the scenery. The swing on the bridge is minimal and there is always 2-wheeler traffic on the bridge which is agitating.

title: A wonderful experience
review: It was really an experience beyond words. Lakshman Jhoola,  the beautiful hanging bridge,  built in 1930 is 450 feet long.  You may encounter the strong wind that blows along the course of the river,  when you reach midway on the bridge.  Since our hotel was situated on the other side of the river we travelled along the bridge a number of times.  Its a wonderful experience to spend time enjoying the breeze.

title: Unique have to experience it
review: Very unique bridge. Unlike anything we had ever experienced in our lives with the Beautiful scenery as well as the Monkeys, Donkeys and Motorbikes to keep you on your toes. Fun!

title: Amazibg jhula......
review: To cross the holy river ganga this the bridge and other one is ram jhula..... Both are tourism attraction and transportation part.

title: Very crowded
review: The place was vwry crowded. Lots of monkeys. Vehicles also passing by....chaotic...view was good but not great.

title: Awesome View from the Jhula.
review: The View from the Jhula is Great & Awesome with Thrilling Trekking kind if thing on the jhula. It was Good.

title: I wish I could jump directly in water from lakshman Jhula
review: Holy place, Not so Scary, but good vibes because of coolness of water and wind. You can pass your motorcycle for fun :p

title: Stray Cows and noisy bikers are a mess
review: The view of Ganga and mountains is good but 2 wheelers are a real mess and are always noisy. I fail to comprehend why they do not understand that they are at one of the biggest tourist place in their city and that the honking will not help!! Stray cows are also a big let down.

title: Ancient bridge
review: An ancient bridge to cross over to the other side ove the Ganga. All that you want is visit is only after crossing this brodge, including the Arti. In ancient times,it is said the start of the char dham Yatra too began from here.

title: Fun -river  crossing over Ganges
review: Narrow bridge..  mostly pedestrians, occasional cows and motorcycles and of course, a huge army of monkeys. ..

title: Amazing place
review: Great energy, wonderful people, best  yoga schools, amazing views, incredible food, new experiences , ayurveda , peace, chill and rest.

title: A good view of Ganga Ma from here
review: The setting was really amazing on the day we visited the bridge, windy and cool with a good amount of wind blowing over the Ganges.  This place is more of a view point of the Ganges and history says that people began their Char Dham yatra from here.  It is quite an old bridge and could be better maintained, especially being a tourist spot.  A lot of monkeys and cows on the bridge, however the disturbance is more from two wheelers who keep honking knowing well that the place will be crowded!

title: Nice View of Ganges !!
review: Gorgeous view of Ganges from Lakshman Jhula ( A cable suspension bridge) in Muni Ki Reti. on Badrinath Road.

title: Nice Bridge with lots of history
review: As it was my second time in rishikesh,so i was exploring this place to my friends,as they were new to this place,As down the bridge white water rafting is been carried out which is very energetic activity. People can also enjoy this part of activity over here.

title: Very very crowded
review: The bridge is very crowded as they allow two wheelers on the bridge. There is a lot of nuisance of monkeys as well.

title: Amazing view of sunset
review: It's a landmark place in Rishikesh and a must-visit site as it connects to the main walking street on the other side of river where all the cafe and restaurants are. The other side is also very peaceful.

title: One of the main attractions in Rishikesh.
review: This is one of the main attractions and also a bridge that one might cross several times if you live in tapovan area of rishikesh. Around this bridge is touristic area and so loads of tourists and shops. Lots of cafes and restaurants have a view of this bridge and its great. Usually during the day time it is busy with people, monkeys, cows and motorists. In the evening or late evening the rush reduces.

title: A very popular jhula
review: The lakshman jhula or rope bridge is quite a very famous bridge in rishikesh and it is a very exciting place where you can discover whole rishikesh

title: Main attraction of Rishikesh
review: It's an amazing suspended bridge over the Ganges , the main attraction of Rishikesh ...you get the best view of Ganges from here and thebmost popular selfi spot ! be aware of rhe monkeys though, they can snatch away anything n everything!!

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: Beware of the monkeys. They are very clever.

title: Nice walk across
review: Many people sharing this area and all pretty courteous. Views are amazing and say hi to the cows walking right next to you...

title: Awesome Jhula
review: It is definitely a must view in rishikesh holding the two banks together. However, it is always crowded and you can find two-wheelers, cows and obviously people on it. But, a must go.

title: Love to shop
review: Impressed with metal idols of gods at very cheap all pooja items gems jwells salagram Rudraksha every thing

title: Saw the age old jhula reminiscent of Ramayana
review: I saw the laxman jhula from far while rafting on the river Ganges. This jhula is rumored to have been built by Prince lakshman, brother of Ram. It is a swinging jhula, not sturdy, making one feel scared of the swinging moving of the jhula.

title: Duniya ka Mela
review: Visited the Laxman Jhula. It is a great spiritual place...sort of that awakens you...

title: Impressive construction
review: I had been waiting for a very long time to visit the place and finally the wait was over when we planned for a weekend trip to Rishikesh. I was staying near the Lakshman Jhula at a place just 15 mins away. It was a comfortable walk from the hostel to the Jhul and further onto the other side. Amazing places to eat and amazing bakery's along the road. Lots and lots of Yoga centre and shops with traditional items. Beware of the people who would sell you false stones and pendants. Amazing construction over river Ganga in such a magnitude that the bridge support even movement of vehicular traffic. Must visit place for all the traveller who are looking out for good food and good place to hangout.

title: nice exp
review: it was nice exp . hire a guide for rs 100 & he will do the rest. around 15 temples located on way to jhula.

title: Time to take Photos - Don't Forget to use ur Selfie Moments Here
review: Me and my friends spent a lot of time standing here and feeling the positive vibes. Locals roam around freely and the sound of Gangaji is awesome here.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: Good location and view , the atmosphere is good . the water is clean, enjoy the market near the Lakshman Jhula .

title: Gr8 Place to visit
review: Laxman Jhula is a cable bridge which is only used for pedestrians. it connects two river bank sides of ganga. mostly autos and taxis drop you at laxaman jhula and pick you up at ram jhula. famous terah manzil temple is just by the end of bridge. lots of shops are there which sells art and crafts items. you can see white water rafting boats passing in ganga from above during your walk on laxman jhula. .

title: Walk from Ram Jhula
review: More touristy than Ram Jhula.  People lovely. The walk from Ram Jhula is a must do. Great view from German Cafe at the Lakshman Jhula bridge. Vintage India has some lovely items and onsite silversmiths working in front window room.

title: Panoramic view of River Ganges & its surroundings
review: This hanging bridge, which is one of the Icon structures of Rishikesh, connects Rishikesh main town with other small town situated on the east of River Ganges. Even though, one can have beautiful panoramic view of the River Ganges/valley & its adjacent sloping hills from this bridge, but due to continuous & busy traffic on this small width bridge, you can’t patiently enjoy the adjacent natural sceneries. Especially, on this bridge, one should be very careful of monkeys & cows, which will be moving on this narrow bridge, as the tourists have the habit of feeding these animals

title: Magical place!
review: I have stayed in Laxman Jhula for nearly a year now. I only planned to stay for three weeks if that tells you how much I love it here. There are so many good cafes with an amazing music scene thriving here. Laxmanjhula is especially specially because it is tucked in the foothills of the Himalayas and Ganga River winds through. One of the cleanest areas of Ganga as it isn't too far from the source in Gongotri. Great place to visit!

title: Lakshman Suspension Bridge
review: On asking people about places to visit in rishikesh, everyone aske dme to visit and walk along this bridge if i had never used a suspension bridge before. And i had never before; so there i was, walking on the Lakshman Bridge. this bridge is quite long for a suspended bridge. When i happened to use the bridge there was lots of rush with loads of things happening on it. There were people trying to get photos clocked and there were people scared of heightstrying to get over their fear and there was a cow midway through the bridge which wouldnt budge one bit. I guess thats what this experience was all about. I would still ask all of you to still go visit it!

title: Fun time
review: It was a nice experience to stand on the Laxman khula and watch the Ganges and even more fun when you stand in the middle and feel the bridge swaying to and fro

title: Visit once
review: Rishikesh means picture of laxman zula comes to your mind.nothing much to see but visit once .At peak time laxman zula means cows,monkeys,pedestrians,tourist posing for pics etc but do get yourself clicked there.Dont give it a miss.you will get to see graceful ganges and mountains.

title: Must visit in Rishikesh!
review: I have been to Rishikesh multiple times and inadvertently you end up visiting Laxman Jhula. It basically connects 2 ends of the river and is used by the locals for daily commute. It also kind of sways which can be experienced when you walk on it. There are a lot of restaurant and eateries on one end where one can relax once you are done with your rafting.

title: Rishikesh is not "IT" without the hanging Bridge called Lakshman Jhula
review: No Rishikesh pic is perfect without the great hanging bridge called "Lakshman Jhula" i.e. India's on Verazzano Bridge in the backdrop.  I've countless memories of this great piece of marvellous Architecture, right from the time, I came to Mother Earth.  Everytime, I look at her, I can't really stop appreciating this great cultural monument.

title: Scenic Beauty in the lap of Nature
review: This is an architectural Marvel,with historical significance.Grear experience to walk on it,above,River Ganga and by the side of Himalyas for company.A good place for sight seeing and photo session.

title: Rishikesh landmark....
review: But so crowded!!!! I got hit by ppl, cows, scooters. But good fun anyway. Can't go to rishikesh and not go to lakshmi jhulla

title: Beautiful view
review: It has been cemented now... It does not sway but has a slight bouncy feel to it.. Motorcycle go on the Jhoola...you have to see this if you are in rishikesh

title: Nice place
review: Rishikesh is heritage place situated on mountain rages The Himalayas. It's on the banks of river Ganga which is considered to be a Holy river. So Laxman Jhula ( swing ) connects you from town to the most happening place with cafes,shops,Astros, temples etc etc

title: Over crowded these days
review: You can't stand. You can't walk. Too many two wheelers passing through. But if you get a chance to look around.. It's wonderful.

title: Be wary
review: Jhula brings memory of carefree swinging. But be wary as you walk along this landmark bridge. If you

title: Awesome
review: Just amazing. Just go if you have not. It's the beauty of Rishikesh, world's yoga capital.Winds blowing through the bridge has a calm yogic energy in it... Just loved it during the night.

title: Amazing view of river Ganges from bridge
review: One of the two hanging bridge in Rishikesh..Laxman jhoola seems quite large compare to Ramjhoola.Mostly tourist of India knows Lakshman compared to Ramjhoola. Feeding small wheat floor balls to fishes from bridge seems great. However, it is also crowded by tourist and local peoples, the night feeling is awesome. Standing in the middle of bridge,when the wind touches you, it seems amazing. A must to visit place if you visit Rishikesh.

title: Awesome
review: I just love to walk around rishikesh....from ramjhula to lakshmanjhula and back....because I get to see sooo much of India in these few kilometers....a must visit place for anything traveling to this part of the world

title: India at it's best!
review: Crowds with people ,cows and monkeys ,locals and tourists,by foot ,bike or motorcycle,this place is an absolute must while visiting the region!!

title: Crowded, chaotic
review: We went in the night , so there was nothing much to see. It was terribly crowded and there were scooters and bikes using the bridge and honking incessantly! Ganga cafe is a good place to hang out near the bridge if you happen to be there.

title: Really nice place to visit
review: Visited the place during evening and got the chance to see the Ganga Aarti on the banks from the jhula. A great mesmerising experience. Try to go to this place during evening to avoid the heat during day time and enjoy Ganga from the jhula.

title: A bridge between modern world to spiritual world
review: Its a bridge over ganga at rishikesh.. People cross this bridge to visit various ashram and ghats.. There are lot of ashram and ghats to stay in a peaceful environment.. This is also the end point of rafting

title: Awesome
review: Lakshman jhula  is the place for young crowd..  Awesome cafes around it..  Must go and explore food joints and shopping nr lakshman jhulla

title: Suspension bridge
review: At the foothills of the Himalayas and the mouth of the river ganghes overlooking the famous suspension bridge Laksman jhula in northern india

title: Very famous and histrionic place in Rishikesh
review: Laxman zula is one of the must visit attraction in Rishikesh. Very old and historic place with great view all around.

title: Has been
review: The place is easy enough to get to with a decent collection of pretty decent eating places/ cafes and shops selling curios. A one time visit only though.

title: VERY BEAUTIFUL
review: but. really touristic,expensive,and not so authentic.

title: beautiful view , nice walk
review: crossing the Ganga river on foot, then try using this bridge. A walk across this bridge is beautiful and serene. view from here is amazing.

title: Broader than ram jhula
review: View from laxman jhula is great as the 13 storey temple with mountain in the backdrop gives it a really beautiful and grand look. It is broader as compared to ram jhula.

title: Visiting Lakshman Jhula is Thanksgiving for us
review: LJ occupies a place of reverence in the psyche of most Hindus. I have visited LJ several times since my childhood, with my parents, children, ..3 generations in all. LJ has always inspired a feeling love and admiration for Mother Nature, Ganges, hills and pure air....memories of my parents who somehow loved this place. For us, visiting LJ was a kind of Thanksgiving to our parents and...God.

title: A bridge for walking. Look out for the bikes.
review: This is a very narrow bridge , and mainly used by pedestrians. Unfortunately the locals in rishikesh ride bikes on the bridge and cause havoc. I went there on Dussehra night and we were watching ram leela on the banks of the river. A group of miscreants parked their bikes in the bridge and created a huge hue and cry among the other bikers. It was a huge letdown. The bridge itself is wonderful and sways in the wind.

title: A lovely view of ganges
review: I love on pass ganges over this footbridge. Though it's also used by two wheelers and very busy yet it's one of my favourites.

title: Nice view from atop
review: This is one of the historic places to visit in Rishikesh.. But the view from the Lakshman Jhula is really enjoyeable. You can view the complete mountain range along with a good stretch of the river Ganga.

title: Breathtaking view
review: Gods creation is one of it and by standing on it you can just me absorb by the godly breeze and view andof course not forgetting GANGA the holy river. Buit across with full faith and thousands of them walked on it. Beautifully build with love. Dont miss it,

title: It moves!
review: Well it does not quite swing, but vibrates. It would be more enjoyable but for the idiots on two wheelers scraping you every 10 steps. Nothing spiritual here

title: Home of adventure junkies
review: Best rafting experience from Lakshman Jhula...... We didn't had enough time to explore more places here, but with what we have got that was awesome and will come back again and visit one more time need to explore the unexplored....

title: A must Visit place in Rishikesh
review: The Jhulla is suspension bridge on Holy Ganga river which actually swings and vibrates.. it's not risky but it's a kind of experience one has to take while at riskhikesh, just roam around Laxman and ram jhulla area for a blissfull experience which gives breathtaking panoromic views, one can feel the breeze of Holy water of Ganga river. Once can spend upto full day over here as there are so many sovernior shops, gift galleries, spa/yoga points and restaurents/Café around this place provided the weather is good. Try to keep your sun glasses, caps or scarfs handy in summers ....

title: nice visit
review: be careful of movin 2 wheelers and animals like cows - monkeys too snatch your food - so dont carry any - no not even in ur bag

title: Hanging bridge across river Gangaa
review: This bridge is first hanging bridge in Rishikesh to cross Maa gangaa. This is just in the beggining of Rishikesh when you enter from the Hill side. After about one kilometer they have constructed another hanging bridge by the name of Ram Jhula. Now they are constructing third one at Muni ki reti which shall be named as Janaki Jhula. This will take about one year to complete.

title: Must visit
review: Amazing engineering build over ganga in rishikesh this pillarless bridge is made with steel wires hanging and swinging.

title: great scenery and nature at its best
review: we went there with family, it was a busy jhula as compare to Ram jhula. you will find so many foreigners over here and all are busy with their own work. the main beauty is the floating Ganga river and mountains bigger than anything. its a great place with so much happening at the same time. moneys coming. photos are clicking , Ganga river floating and your mind rushing in catching all moments in your eye camera. if you are in rishikesh, your trip can not be ended without a visit of Lakshman jhula

title: Lakshman Jhula Visit
review: An average visit. I felt it lost the charm due to modernization and crowd. Could not feel the same thrill as I got when last visited 37 years before as small kid. Still one has to visit as this is one of the famous attraction in Rishikesh.

title: a must visit when in rishikesh
review: if you are in rishikesh, you will cross this bridge to be on the other side of the ganges, most of the rafting trips end here.

title: Heritage and Culture Sightseeing
review: A nice excursion for sightseeing near Rishikesh. Enjoyed walk on Laxman Jhula and the view of Ganges. Some nice cafe also around.

title: Unique view of the Ganges
review: The place retains its charm and between even in this day of commercialization. The scenic beauty of the river and flowing amidst the mountain makes the trip worth it. Try to visit the bridge when it is less crowded like very early morning, otherwise you wiill find it crowded.

title: Yoga & Shopping for travelers
review: Very westernized area in Rishikesh waiting to fill your belly, your bag and help you delve into yoga classes. Some of the best shopping in Rishikesh. About 30 minute walk from Swargashram area.

title: Better for winters
review: Nice for walks and views of Ganga river but not too recommended for summers. Would hope to visit again in winters.

title: The epic place
review: It's an amazing place to enjoy the cool breeze. U are actually standing above the river Ganga and watching it flowing down majestically beneath.It's a breathtaking view.

title: Good area for shopping and cafes
review: This area of Rishikesh has lots of shops and cafes and is a good place to just walk through the streets of Rishikesh.

title: Connecting two banks of River Ganga
review: Lakshman Jhula is a suspension bridge that connects two banks of River Ganga in Rishikesh.  This bridge is used by pedestrians and two wheelers to cross River Ganga.

title: Beautiful swing in the middle of nowhere
review: Jhula means swing. Laxman means Laxman. Laxman Jhula means Laxman had a swing.

title: Gives a good idea of how it feels to hang-up in air
review: The Jhula (Bridge) is small, in a kinda congested place, but crossing it will give you goosebumps, at-leaset for first trip across the bridge.

title: Great view!
review: To cross Ganges on the bridge is an fantastic experience. You share the road with colourful Indian people, some tourists, cows, monkeys, donkeys and motorbikes and you need to watch your step.

title: stunning place.......
review: wow, you would just love this place full of crowd, at times you need to just crawl when there is tourist inflow, this place is also for food lovers and shopping fanatics.

title: nice sightseeing place
review: if you come to rishikesh it is necessary to visit laxman jhula. i have been here many times in the past as well still love coming here. was impressed to see the new cafe and eating joints here.

title: On hanging bridge, enjoyed with family
review: Very good to walk on this jhoola and taken picks with family. Only problem with bikers who also use same bridge for crossing the river.

title: Must visit once
review: I think this is most happening place in rishikesh. My hotel was at waking distance so i visit this location. Very crowed place and its become more crowed when people stop there to click picture.

title: Lovely place with a gorgeous view!
review: Nice and clean place.

title: Good Place
review: One should visit this place and stay here for at least few days to feel the holy refreshing environment. This place is few KM above Rishikesh and in local auto usually take Rs.50-60 to visit here from Rishikesh. There are few very good hotels are there to stay.

title: Divine place with great natural beauty
review: This famous iron rope bridge over river Ganged, I'd located in Moon me Reti near the religious town of Rishikesh. This bridge was opened in 1929. The view from the bridge of the river, the surrounding green mountains, the ashrams are fabulous. Be careful from monkeys. They are considered holy in this area but they can attack you and snatch your camera and hand bags if you are not careful.

title: A different experience
review: This a great place to visit and experience the natural beauty. The crowd and the experience of the jhula makes it a nice one. But the area to reach there is not so clean.

title: Great to walk on the suspension bridge
review: We visited the Lakshman Jhula in Rishikesh on our way back from Gangotri during the evening hours. The bridge was over crowded. Apart from pedestrians, cattle and bikes were also going over it, which was really creating lot of inconvenience for the pedestrians.  We walked over the bridge amidst this crowd and saw spectacular view of river ganga flowing below it. We clicked some photographs to capture the moments.

title: The best of all attraction at Rishikesh
review: People walk over laxman jhula and feel some butterfly in their stomach and few people fear crossing it barefoot

title: main attraction when in rishikesh
review: Do not miss visiting ram zula and lakshman zula when in rishikesh...

title: Great location
review: A lovely area. Great resturants to relax in with yummy food and nice vibes. Good place for buying gifts and doing yoga and meditation. Great place for meeting people.

title: Scienic View
review: A place with few temples nearby, take a walk from laxman jhula to Ram jhula and feel the Holy river with few open access near river bank.

title: Entertaining bridge crossing
review: This bridge comes to life around lunch time each day! So many tourists, locals and animals crossing it makes for a fun/funny experience... There are also a lot of potential to take some great photos for anyone with an eye for photography!

title: Normal jhoola, nothing more... Nothing else
review: We read reviews regarding this before visiting jhoola.

title: Nice view
review: The bridge offers a great view of the temple on the other side. Crossing it is a total local immersion because you'll be in the middle of people, cows, monkeys and motorbikes.

title: Exhilirating Experience!
review: Truly magnificent structure across the Ganges. It was quite an experience watching the beautiful Ganges with force but you may want to avoid watching right under if you are acrophobic. The bridge was heavily crowded and it was therefore appalling to find this bridge open for two wheelers who were zipping by and not just for foot traffic. If someone wondered about the name, it apparently has nothing to do with Rama or Lakshmana.

title: awesome experince
review: one the most adventurous bridges in India and its has beautiful scenic view of rishikesh. its a life line of rishikesh..

title: Crowded
review: Lovely bridge made zillion years back. Well maintained

title: You can spend an entire day here
review: This place have lots of options in terms of eateries and shopping. German Cafe on Tapovan side have nice and close view. You can spend your entire day here.

title: The famous landmark!
review: Laxman Jhula is one of the two main bridges across river Ganga, in Rishikesh. This is a famous landmark, and is surrounded by temples, hotes, cafes, etc. There are taxi stands on either sides of the bridge. While you are walking on the bridge, monkeys are watching you from top, and eatables and shiny/fancy objects may attract them. I stood on the bridge at night when there was absolutely no crowd, and the strong wind and sight of Ganga was an experience that I would cherish for a long time :)

title: Windy
review: Ah! the surreal beauty of rishikesh and the magnificent expanse of Ma Ganga is a sight to be cherished and stored forever in your neurons. The wind that blows across as you walk over the jhula feels like a breath of fresh air in a world dying of hypoxia.

title: Historical suspension bridge
review: It is a breathtaking experience to walk on this suspension bridge. It is a narrow bridge which allows only two wheelers to cross. We walked the bridge and the cool breeze of the ganges was very soothing.

title: An absolutely chaotic bridge crossing
review: I stayed in Rishikesh for a month for yoga teacher training which I wasn't near impressed by the either the teaching methodology and the organisation. We were there the end of July till August and it was an absolute madness to cross the bridge to the mainland during Shiva Ratri festival, like ages. For me, it was an ok bridge but it still a very popular destination for Indians to visit.

title: Iconic, historical and functional
review: This iconic bridge was built in 1930 to replace its predecessor. It's very popular amongst the visitors for photos and used to cross the Ganges River.

title: Best place in rishikesh
review: This is one place to be in Rishikesh. Lined by many lovely cafes and restaurants. Just sitting by the side of Ganges is a great way to unwind. Of coz...take a dip and wash away all the sins !

title: Adventurous city
review: Very awesome and holy city.and best adventure site...beauty of lakshmam jhula ,ram jhula .,water fall,river rafting..etc attract my heart....river rafting was very enjoyable....finally big centre for yoga also...

title: Tourism
review: A place to sit on the river bank and view panoramic vista .It is a place to feel spiritual ,to be within oneself ,to see the nice engineering of suspension bridge .

title: Beautiful view!
review: Laksham jhula offers a great view of the mountains and river ganga.  I love the place around lakshman jhula. Its better than Ram jhula.

title: Beautiful peaceful ghats
review: Way less crowded compared to Ram Jhula, and you can easily find your own quiet spot near the ganges. This area has alot more cafes as well.

title: One of the few things to do here
review: It is a rope bridge ... Keeps shaking slightly when you walk over it ... Loads of public generally ... But not too crowded... There is a new stairway shortcut so try that instead of the long slopy route ...

title: a holly suspension bridge
review: Lakshman jhula is an iron hanging bridge built over River ganga in Rishi Kesh.  According to Hindu mythology at this place a rope bridge was there which was used by Lakshman, younger brother of Lord Rama to cross the River Ganga.

title: Great bridge
review: Laxman Juhla built by UP PWD before independence at the site where Laxman once crossed river using Jute ropes. I was annoyed with administration allowing Bikes to cross layman Jhula. Unending horns by these idiots spoiled the fun. District administration needs to wake up

title: Once amazing, now main mode off connectivity and crowded
review: This is one of the two hanging bridges across Rishikesh and is crowded with locals, tourists, cycles, two wheelers, cows and monkeys. It is a destination with a must click pictures on, and beautiful view on both sides

title: Relaxed cosmopolitan area of town with great views, a variety of shops, ashrams and eateries .
review: A brilliant place to chill. Very friendly, but without the hassle of downtown Rishikesh. Great starting point for trekking and visits to waterfalls. My favourite spot in Northern India.

title: Nice place not much to see
review: It's nice place but not much is there to visit.

title: Touristic
review: This is the most touristic area in Risikesh, but if you are practicing yoga in Ram Jhula, maybe you would need a good western food or wifi once in a while in laxman jhula. Also, you can walk even upper and you have nice walks to the waterfall, nil can cave, etc

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: The place worth seeing.

title: Suspension Bridge
review: The Ganga river flowing underneath is choppy yet tranquil. The aarti at Parmarth Mission is surreal & divine.The amount of people at Lakshman Jhoola confirm the tourist hotspot that it is. Beware of the monkey's though especially if you are carrying the atta balls for the fishes. One snatched it straight from my daughters hand.

title: Peace and beauty Ofcourse it's the place Where Ganga flows.
review: A beautiful religious place with an average crowd a great attraction for foreigners an overpass to cross the River called 'Laxman jhula '.. Hotels and quality food available.. A great place to stay and enjoy the peace here.. We arrived at evening it was beautiful and I am sure morning would be even better..  Be here as soon as you get time..!!

title: A must visit place in Rishikesh
review: The feel of a Jhula (swing) will give you a altogether different feeling with mighty Ganga  flowing underneath.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: Lakshman Jhula or Laxman Jhula is an iron suspension bridge constructed over the river Ganga and situated in Muni Ki Reti area, which is 5KM away from Rishikesh, on the way to Badrinath. Lakshman Jhula connects the borders of the Tehri and Pauri districts. There is belief that Lakshman (Brother of Lord Ram) crossed the river Ganga on jute ropes between the same place of present Lakshman Jhula bridge. Regardless of the fact that, according to the modern day history, the first Lakshman Jhula bridge was constructed by Rai Bahadur Surajmal Jhunjhunwala father of Rai Bahadur Shewpershad Tulshan but it was totally washed away by the flood of October 1924. Present bridge replaced the old bridge and opened for public on 11th April 1930 by H.E. Sir Malcolm Haley C.C.I.E. K.C.S.I. Governor of the United Provinces.

title: The hanging n shaking bridge
review: Lakshman jhoola is a unique bridge which is built over the River Ganga and the most important fact associated with this bridge is that it is not having any pillars to support. It is just a hanging bridge. Yet it is so strOng that even cars can get through it. But i guess now they have stopped vehicles and only pedestrians are allowed. The bridge shakes as people walk through hence it adds to your adventurous essence.

title: vibrating
review: When i was walking first time on it it was vibrating but i enjoy my walk on lakshamn jhula. Nicely made bridge without any support in river. Must visit place in rishikesh

title: Peaceful serene!
review: The walk on this bridge gives such a good feeling. You could see the deep river, feel the cold breeze. Amazing it is.

title: Hanging Bridge
review: Every time Its Feel It Will Fall Down In Ganga River But Its Stay Even In The Rush When Cow Motorbike Are Cross Through This Water Flow Through This Is Very Fast Its Make U Feel Amazing

title: Bridge That Make U Thrill
review: I Visit Hare 2 Time In The Manson Bridge That Suspension A Lot When Wind Flow And In Under Ganga River Flow Very Fast Every time You Feel That It Will Fell Down In River But It Stay And It Is Very Thrill Experience

title: Beautiful Bridge.
review: We used the  Bridge to cross and go to the other side of the river and took a boat to  return back to the original side of the river. It  was  awesome journey both ways.

title: Landmark of Rishikesh
review: Lakshman Jhula is a landmark of Rishikesh. It is 450-foot long iron suspension bridge erected over the Ganges river. A similar bridge further downstream from Lakshman Jhula is Ram Jhula. As per Hindu mythology Lakshmana (brother of Shree Ram) crossed Ganges on jute ropes between the place where this bridge is built.

title: Enchanting view of River Ganga and Distant Forests
review: Lakshman Jhula is an iron suspension bridge situated in Muni Ki Reti near Rishikesh. It is built over the Ganges river and is a landmark of Rishikesh. It's a wonderful experience to see the Lakshman Jhula standing over the powerful River Ganga, connecting it's two banks.  We walked over the bridge and saw the River Ganga flowing underneath. We got few spectacular glimpses of the distant forests from the bridge.  It was evening time when we visited the bridge.  The bridge was over crowded then.

title: Staying in Rishikesh is a charm & passing thru Lakshman Jhula adds to it
review: I simply can't erase the moments spent during our stay at Rishikesh. Lakshman Zula is lovely & appears more beautiful in night time. I was simply mesmerized by the aura.

title: Shopping part of Rishikesh
review: 1 of the 2 parts of Rishikesh. Lots of shopping, many différents types of yoga for all levels any time, Méditation also proposed. All prices very interesting in comparaison with others places.

title: The place to be in Rishikesh
review: Best restaurants and cafe overlooking the ganga. This the place has so much energy. I'll be surprised if you come here and do not end up wanting to stay longer. It has a gravity about it.

title: Engineering done with a tourist attraction
review: A must place to experience when visiting Rishikesh  where you can observe and understand of how way back this engineering model was being made which creates a sense of jhula because of lighter vibrations when you walk on it.

title: Gud place but beware of the monkeys
review: I visited with my family during july...the view from Lakshman Jhula is awesome...but if you are going there with your little children take extra care as there are lots of monkeys in and around this place...overall a good place to visit...

title: Best view of Ganga!
review: This is one of the most famous landmarks of Rishikesh. Its more or less just a suspension bridge connecting two parts of Rishikesh.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: Needs no introdction..Connects Main Road and Neelakanta Road. You will like it more when it sways smoothly with wind, of course its a cradle!

title: Nice place to visit in the evening or early morning
review: Gets very crowded during the day so will advice to visit at early morning. Their is a very famous bakery near it - German Bakery, go and have nice coffee and pastries and enjoy the view from there.

title: Crossing on a Sunday is an experience
review: ts almost impossible to come to Rishikesh without crossing Lakshman Jhula as this is the main bridge to cross the Ganga. This bridge can become seriously packed and it is almost impossible to cross on a Sunday as you squeeze through the crowds and pass by the cows, mopeds and selfie sticks.

title: laxman Jhula
review: its a worth experience visiting luxman Jhoola. River Ganges floww at its best at this place and the view is breath taking

title: Overcrowded.
review: The bridge is one of the two that allows you to go across the river. Its extremely crowded as you will find animals crossing it along with people. Two wheelers also allowed on the bridge which make it inconvenient for the walkers.

title: Grate feeling
review: If you go to rishikesh or haridwar you  must go there its a beautiful place and also having many places to see near it...

title: A Bridge to cross
review: Well its a bridge connecting different hills built above the Ganga river. One can take any two wheeler here to cross the bridge.

title: A Bridge across Ganga
review: A Swinging bridge across Ganga. A Peaceful location along the river. A walk during sun rise or sun set is a must.

title: OMG
review: Awesome during raining mausum(season). It is an amazing experience to see from laxman jhoola, “Ganga” river flowing with thundering sound under you. At night too it looks amazing seeing beautiful lighting of houses along the bank

title: Landmark in Rishikesh
review: Lakshman Jhula is one amazing landmark in Rishikesh. The suspension bridge is a must visit when in Rishikesh alongwith Ram Jhula..

title: No words can explain the feeling
review: Just standing in the middle makes you wonder how they built it  and you can just feel the power of the Ganga. Nothing is impossible if we humans make up our mind to do something

title: Fabulous bridge
review: It's a good place to visit if you want to see the architectural marvel of the suspension bridge. It has the markets on both sides with small shops. Bridge itself is very narrow and you have to jostle among crowds to cross it, along with cows and scooters. It is nice to see the river flow beneath it with all those rafts.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to visit. Try the motor boat ride which costs approx. Rs 550/- per boat for around 5-10 minites

title: Oldest Suspension Bridge
review: This suspension bridge has been named after Lakshman brother of Lord Ram who  as per belief ,crossed the river at this point  by a jute rope.This a beautiful bridge meant  for pedestrians only.Now-a-days we find rules are openly flouted by two wheel drivers.This iron bridge is made of iron , suspending over the river Ganga by iron wire fixed/held tightly  on both  sides of the river.It trembles while one walks on it.Downstream there is another such jhulla called Ram Jhulla.Both these jhullas help people to cross the river, to visit Ashrams, meditation centres etc .Temples are there on both sides. .This jhulla is crowded most of the time.One should be careful about monkeys.Generally they don't harm, but sometimes snatch eatables specks,bags  from the carefree visitors.

title: Beautiful and Not Crowded
review: Loved this Lakshman Jhula Suspension Bridge. It was beautiful and also not crowded like the Ram Jhula was. It was peaceful and the view is serene. I also liked all the matkets on the Lakshman Jhula side of the bridge...they have amazing shopping there!

title: Memorable visit
review: Very memorable visit...same feeling as if used to visit in 1980's as child...Same crowd...same style as earlier...

title: Suspension bridge: Laxman jhula
review: It's a suspension bridge. We went early in the morning, not that much crowded that time, we heard that normally it will be crowded. The temple is on the other side of bridge and Gangaji flowing below. From main road it's about 1km. Taxi / auto are going near, also anyone can walk down to this place.

title: It's a bridge.
review: This is a bridge. There are some okay views from the bridge. It is supposed to be a foot  bridge however there is no road bridge for 6km in either direction. As a result the bridge is also used by motorbikes and at some times of day donkey's transporting goods. The bridge is also very busy through a lot of the day (not helped by the aforementioned motorbikes)  There are monkey's if you like monkeys but they descend on the bridge in large numbers and some of them are quite aggressive.

title: Mayhem...
review: As there are lots of people on the bridge the suspension bridge effect was absent...Go there if you like scores of people rubbing shoulders with each other just to cross it...

title: Unique experience
review: Lakshman jhula is full of buzz. The bridge is really busy most of the times with pedestrians, two wheelers, animals all using the way. This is what makes it unique. The views around are fantastic.

title: Triple experience of History, Pilgrimage & Nature
review: It's a personal encounter with history for me only because I've grown up seeing the pictures of my family members from just previous generations posing at the Lakshman Jhula & queried why it's called Jhula when it is a bridge. Pilgrimage is whole Rishikesh area where you can feel the nature & spirituality. Both the sides of the river Ganga is beautiful without comparison, only difference is crowded around the city side.

title: Hyped bridge...
review: Very crowded and difficult for old people and young children to reach the jhoola. Though connects some important sites to see. There are a lot of temples around. Lakshman temple is one of the such rare ones. Beware of the shops and perso s selling fake stones and rudraksha

title: Jhoola - yet another suspension bridge
review: The place is too hyped and too many people on the bridge at a time. If you have seen suspension bridge then there is nothing new new to it apart from the name itself.

title: bridge above river
review: A beautiful place , bridge over the river, its windy and the atmosphere is great, there are temples on both the sides of the bridge.

title: It's worth visiting place
review: It is a place of Nature, fun, religiousness,  and excitement. The great Ganga river view look awesome. It's vibration gives you a thrilling feel, once you see through the middle towards Ganga.

title: Highlight of Rishikesh.
review: Nice restaurants and shops. But best of all is the walk to (or from) Ram Jhula - across the river. It's one of the less busy paths in town, and takes you by the sandy beaches of Ram Jhula.

title: Beautiful
review: Great and beautiful bridge connecting Rishkesh. When i went down the river on a boat it was amazing see it from below.

title: Badly illuminated
review: We went there late in evening thinking that we'll get great view of Ganga. But to our surprise, it was badly lit. Very uncomfortable for family outing.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: iron suspension bridge erected over the Ganges river .

title: view
review: when you walk down on it you feel so good :) all the people passing by you some are going for ganga arty and some click selfies over there .. such good experience

title: Go for the view
review: So it's basically a suspension bridge between two parts of the city going over the Holy Ganges.....  It's very crowded throughout the day...  So if you want a really good view ho up there at 6 in the morning....  And you might actually like it...

title: Beware of the monkeys
review: They are so cute but they might steal your ice cream or knock your glasses off if you get too close.  Be warned

title: Difficult to walk
review: It's difficult to walk as over crowded and people driving two wheelers. Not much to say. Overall OK, it depends what your purpose of visit is actually.

title: Amazing experience
review: Lakshman jhoola adds to the mystic magic of the land which is rishikesh. However the best time to experience its magic is at night or early morning. During the day and the evening its just 2 crowded and you won't get opportunity to enjoy the jhula- just managing to jostle your way through the crowd to the other end. Whew! Go and enjoy the jhula and the market on either ends

title: Mystical bridge of the yesteryears
review: One of the engineering wonders of the yester - years. Made very simply and still standing with pride for tourists to enjoy.

title: Ganga Dussehra at Lakshman Jhula
review: Visited the famous Lakshman Jhula on the auspicious day of Ganga Dussehra in June (by luck and not by design). It was thus very crowded. I guess on a normal day early in the morning, it would be a terrific sight.

title: Average bridge
review: Just like Normal bridge but worth visit once, scooters/bike also pass through same bridge. You have various eatries nearby.

title: Good view
review: I went to Lakshman jhoola thrice during my visit to rishikesh. It was overcrowded. But it was a great experience to cross it .it shakes  a bit. Two wheelers should not be allowed on this as it has a v narrow path.

title: busy and loud but nice shops, restaurants and cafes
review: The area Lakshman jhula is very busy and loud because of the horning motorbikes. but the area offers a lot of nice shops, restaurants and cafes as well as guesthouses.

title: Lovely view of river ganga
review: Make sure u dont have height phobia..

title: Has religious sentiments but surroundings not clean
review: Has religious sentiments but surroundings not clean. I personally feel that two wheelers / motorcycles spoil the fun as they travel to & fro.

title: its a must visit in rishikesh
review: Laxman Jhula is one of the main attraction in Rishikesh, its a hanging bridge and too crowded, issue is with the two wheelers who keeps on coming to the bridge. should have been banned. overall good view of Ganga

title: a normal hanging bridge.
review: No importance, you can stay around it and shop around but lakshman jhoola has got nothing to offer you. mostly crowded and locals even drive their bikes on it.

title: An iconic bridge but very crowded
review: A 77 year old suspension bridge on the Ganges, this along with the Ram Jhula is an iconic suspension bridge in India. However, it is always very crowded with people taking photographs on selfie sticks and standing there posing not thinking about others who would want to cross the bridge. Another headache are scooters & bikes riding on the bridge honking big time.

title: Great view
review: We stay at Hotel near to Laxman jhula and view from Laxman jhula is awsm, cold wind and water view.  Any one can go near water and can enjoy in water even with kids.  No problem at all. Avoid in rainy season to go in water at this place. Water rafting at Laxman jhula also available so go and enjoy

title: No two wheelers should be allowed
review: No two wheelers should be allowed on laxman jhula It was becoming very difficult to walk with small kids.

title: Great fun
review: It's just above ganges.if you go rishikesh it's a must watch place.just go this bridge with family and friends and enjoy the sunrise or if you go in the evening enjoy cool weather. Have some selfies with friends and spend a good time

title: Beautiful Bridge
review: This is type of Hanging Bridge built over river Ganga connecting rishikesh city internally. Its a nice place form where you can experience the Ganga river

title: architectural wonder
review: The bridge was overcrowded during the day so we went early morning when the crowd  was very less. nice exp.

title: Suspension bridge on the Ganges..!!
review: Laxman Jhula is located in the town of Rishikesh on top of the holy river Ganga. This one was very crowded on the day we visited the town,

title: Nice Hanging Jhula
review: The most busiest walking bridge over ganges to connect Rishikesh & Swargashram near parmarth niketan.

title: Much Hyped Place
review: Nothing to see except a bridge which is too crowded. They should stop 2 wheelers moment on the bridge as it is narrow.

title: It's a Bridge! - but it has to be experienced
review: One of two "footbridges" across the Ganga at Rishikesh. It has to be experienced to be believed. For most days it is packed end to end with a slow steady stream of bodies! Most are people, many are Indian tourists with a minority of foreign tourists, some are local photographers trying to sell instant print photos to tourists, some are beggars who sit on the bridge to try to cadge a living but sadly just get I the way, many tourists hold things up by stopping to take selfies overlooking Ganga. Other bodies are cows which wander freely among the slow moving crowds and others are the red faced monkeys, which can be pretty aggressive, so take care. Among the people occasionally a vendor pushes their cart across to the other side to sell their goods, with cries of Challo Challo again to get the masses to move. To top all of this, motorcycles and moped squeeze noisily through with a cacophony of horn noises as they try to get people to get out of their way. Pretty selfish and rude, but this is India. Like I say one to experience, but with an open mind!

title: Not so cool... Crowded
review: Good to experience as architecture and mechanical work but it is so much crowded. With pedestrians vehicles are also allowed which makes it congested. But if you are visiting Rishikesh then it is a must try to experience.

title: One of India's most iconic suspension bridges
review: The Lakshman and Ram jhulas are must-experience in Rishikesh - there's not much to do apart from just walking across, but it's worth walking down the most iconic suspension bridges you will see anywhere, with the Ganga flowing under. Most of the river rafting trips terminate around the Lakshman Jhula, so it's easy to couple a walk down the bridge with your rafting trip if you keep a set of dry clothes.

title: Crowded but worthy even after so many visits :)
review: It always feel good to cross Lakshman Jhoola. Better avoid during May June coz you might not be able to even click a pic. View is amazing.

title: Super experience over the Ganges on a suspension bridge
review: An evening walk across the ganges on the Lakshman Jhula with cool breeze blowing is one nice experience. The locals also use their two wheelers over this bridge. On either sides of the river, on the banks are small shopping places all along the road.

title: Hanging Bridge and Happening Place!
review: Though the Laxman Zhula is shorter in length than the Ram Zhula, it is the most suitable place for travellers. This area has the cheapest hotels for the travellers. Also offers all the basic needs in the nearby vicinity. Street food, Western restaurants, ethnic shopping, Travel material, local items, transportation on rent, bookings for Adventure nearby, Travel agents.. you name it and you will find everything there.

title: Awesome view at Night
review: It is always pleasing to visit Laxman Jhula being localite we do visit frequently.

title: Must visit once and everytime if you can manage to visit
review: Its similar like Har Ki Paudi. Must visit once and everytime if you like this and manage to go there.

title: It is just a bridge
review: It is just a bridge and for me a way to come from one side to the other. On certain times it is really crowded with motorbikes trying to pass by. But a lot of Indian People love to take picture there and the view to the gange is indeed amazing!

title: Activa ride on d bridge
review: Awesome feeling...nd driving activa in d crowd over d bridge nd watching river Ganges flowing at d bottom ws amazing...jai gange maiyaa ki..

title: Old but robust
review: The bridge is one of it's kinds in India.

title: Wow but we had an earth shaking experience
review: We crossed this jhula to the other side where all the yogic ashrams exist ; to discover it.. and on our return ;we encountered a hailstorm n sudden thunderstorm that was larger the life n not expected .

title: BEAUTIFUL AND UNIQUE!
review: beautiful view from the bridge, unique! some restaurant have views directly on ganga and on the bridge, super nice! bridge is always crossed by lots of people, bikes, monkeys.. really unique! worth the experience!!

title: Very different experince
review: This cable supported bridge is the connection from main rishikesh road to the older city, on a drizzling day had a good experince while going up, while returning it was very congested with all kind of two wheeler traffic which was a bit disappointing..

title: Amazing view
review: It was look to see this. Nice place for photography and people rafting in river. Must go there to get nice experience .

title: Swing bridge that would be more enjoyable without the motorcycles / scooties
review: This bridge is lovely and fun to cross when things are quiet, but is an absolute congested nightmare during peak times. When it's really busy it could take 30 minutes or more to get across, with motorcycles blaring their horns in frustration right next to you. This kind of crowding doesn't stop people from taking their time getting photos -- even if that means blocking traffic entirely while they get their perfect family shot or selfies. This advice applies everywhere in Rishikesh -- bring your earplugs and plan for things to take a long time.

title: This jhoola still rocks!
review: Despite my last visit to the laxman jhoola being almost 2 decades ago, the jhools still managed to thrill me..the still vibrations with the wind and the view of the river are to die for...literally, if one is not careful! did not appreciate the 2 wheelers and their honking on the bridge. good to spend 10-15 mins soaking in the view.

title: Nice Religious Place
review: its nice religious place.the bridge is good. many places near lakshman jhula is good for visit.there are lots of temple.

title: Holy place with beauty all around
review: Lakshman Jhula has a very important place in Hindu mythology. This is a very nice place to be for scenic beauty. The view of Ganga from the Jhula which moves when you walk over it. The Ganga Aarti is awesome at the ghats.

title: Amazing
review: We were at 9 in the night.    We first stayed in hotel that night ...and on the next day we started our exploring in rishikesh ....This was our first time on lakshman jhula. . ..

title: It's a bridge
review: It's a busy and narrow river crossing that has many young men riding motorcycles through the crowds ... I did wonder where they were all going

title: great photo op
review: located on the holy river Ganges ... this is a nice place to stop by and click a few pictures with friends/ family

title: Bridge on Ganges at Rishikesh
review: Serves as link for two opposite sides of Ganges at Rishikesh. Has a very big market area nearby. Nice place to spend some time. View is marvellous and the breeze is exceptional. Avoid visit on weekends and holidays.

title: Epitome of Spirituality
review: Lakshman Jhula as an area is the core of Rishikesh and is flooded with people and surrounded by cafes, spas, shops, ashrams, guestrooms, etc. It is a suspended bridge that connects the two banks of Rishikesh. The bridge is has something very overwhelming about it and it oozes of positive energy and spirituality. A must visit. Although we went in the summer, a heavy shower of rain presented us the opportunity to cross the bridge that was briefly deserted while the water of the skies merged with the holy water of the Ganga.

title: A hanging bridge to cross Ganga river
review: The bridge is constructed with no support . It is hanging on iron wires . the bridge is painted colorfully and only pedestrian are allowed . The Ganga looks  beautiful from Lakshman Jhoola . There are two similar bridges on Ganga approx 2 km apart the other one is called Ram Jhoola. The lakshman jhoola takes you to other side where there are many temples . You can shop Rudraksh and crystal show pieces made out of compressed snow.

title: The most famous suspension bridges in India!
review: It's one of the most famous suspension bridges in india and very popular point in Rishikesh.  It gives you a great view of holy river ganges. It serves as a link for river banks. On the other side there is a 13 story famous temple and a local market to explore!

title: chaotic in Summer season,people + Moto Bikes
review: High Traffic,People,tourists and lots of chaos..though fun ..it's India.

title: Just enjoy the nature
review: Enjoy the nature at middle of bridge, although there is vibration too. A good place for river rafting but be ensured with related security gadgets and equipments. One of the best places for Yoga and meditation and taking dip in adhaytma too.

title: So, it's a bridge
review: It's a usually very congested bridge with people driving their scooters across

title: Lakshman Jhula is now Selfie Jhula
review: Despite of mindless crowd and 40 degree temperature people were busy taking selfies. Amazing!!!

title: A good place for local site seeing
review: Good place, Lachhmanjhula is the main attraction but also some good Ashrams.. Roads are good but little bit hilly road driving. Ram jhula is another 3 km drive

title: lakhsman jhulaaa
review: should go there in morning hour as less crowded and u can enjoy the nature at its best....no other thing to do nearby...

title: Bridge is worth seeing
review: We staying across next to the bridge and spent hours watching life was fascinating. It's a mixture of people, motor bikes, cows and the one night a horse too

title: beautiful everywhere
review: Lakshman jhoola is one of the most ancient places to visit in Rishikesh.. awesome experience.. in months of may lot of rafters can be seen floating in ganges.. beautiful everywhere

title: Great View
review: You can get the great view of river while crossing the bridge. Try to avoid this place in summer's afternoon as everything is hot. A maximum thirty minutes are enough for this place depends upon the weather condition but you will like this place.

title: Nice experience
review: I've been to rishikesh 4-5 times and everytime I come here, its been a wonderful experience. Lakshman Jhula offers a great view of Ganga and mountains.

title: Very good experience
review: I really enjoyed crossing the famous Lakshman Jhula,of Risikesh.It was very crowded in the evening time.Their were people both the sides,we have to be very careful while walking.The bridge,in the middle of Ganga River,we get a perfect view of GangajiThe other side,were two big temples,One of the 12 Jyotirlings,and other of all the four dhams.Both the temples were very crowded.I bought Ganga Jal from the market.I was very fortunate to be in Risikesh,truly a very good experience.

title: Great Art of Work- Good Natural views
review: Laxman Jhoola is a great and very first attraction of Rishikesh. This can be considered as good example of great architecture. Its a bridge at holy river Ganga which shakes and gives feeling of swing while movement on bridge. Views of both sides of River Ganga and hills are mesmerizing. Its a must visit for people going to Rishikesh. There are lot of temples near to laxman Jhoola.

title: A memorable Trip
review: We went to Lakshman Jhula when it was raining.It made our visit memorable.Jhula was less crowded and we could move around for some time.The view from the jhula was breathtaking and simply the memorable one.

title: Don't miss it
review: The steel of this suspension bridge looks new, and it is very well constructed to reduce swaying. It hardly moves considering the numbers of people, motor bikes, cattle and monkeys that can all be on it at the same time. The best part of the experience is the sheer number & diversity of the Pilgrims present. We were here over a weekend in May & were told that this is the busiest time of the year. Road congestion was dreadful, but the experience of seeing the Jhula at this time was well worth it. So many people stopping to take photos & selfies in the middle to have memories of the place can't be wrong! Great place. Don't miss it if you get close to Rishikesh. Don't come to India if you can't cope with crowds.

title: Its a stroll across the bridge.
review: Not an attraction from my perspective since its a normal pedestrian bridge. Pretty crowded and frequent visits by 2 wheelers honking too much. Btw its the only way across the river so you will have to cross it.

title: Memories revisited !
review: Its better to visit the Jhula in the morning or in the evening. You can enjoy the sounds from nearby temples and cool breeze.

title: It is not just a bridge!
review: Lakshman Jhula is one of the best things that you can witness while in Rishikesh. It is actually a suspension bridge that connects Tapovan and Swarg Ashram/Ram Jhula area.

title: Religious
review: Mostly I travel solo. But in laxman jhula you can feel the nature is also travelling with you. Here you find the community of different countries people's. They love this place so much. All the market and shops are full for the travellers need. Beach sites are best for activities. You can take sun bath too. Nature view will recharge your brain with positivity

title: Lovely day
review: Amazing had a Awesome lunch in German bakery .....the view was just Wow love being here lucky me ...The lassi was yummy...

title: Simple pedestrian bridge
review: Simple pedestrian bridge which is quite over-hyped location of Rishikesh.You have to walk a lot from the parking place. Once u cross the bridge there are series of ashrams and mandirs.......

title: Crowded
review: It's too crowded during weekends enjoy the fun of hanging bridge..which actually sways with movement.

title: Hub of rafting booking offices
review: One of the place, you would like you hotel to be near to. View of The Ganga is amazing from the jhula. There are famous temple across the bridge and a market to roam around. You can also catch taxis from here to Neelkanth Temple. This place is full of rafting booking offices as most of the raftings end at Laxman jhula.

title: Amazing view of Ganga
review: while crossing laxman jhula, one can see amazing view of Ganga River. One should visit this place to enjoy.

title: Great Suspension Bridge
review: Great foot bridge.  The monkeys were very entertaining.  Very busy bridge.  Crossed many time to enjoy both sides of the bridge.

title: Enjoy the view and the thrill when it shakes
review: The view from Lakshman Jhula of the hills and river, the serenity and calmness is awesome. Only drawback being the usage of the bridge by vehicles which actually leaves little space for tourists for walking or clicking the photos without being knocked down or horned by some or the other vehicle, slightly loses its sheen because of this vehicle usage.

title: Wonderful and unique experience
review: One can have wonderful experience of crossing the river using Lakshman Jhula. The bridge is always crowded. Nice view.

title: Too crowded
review: The famous Lakshman Jhula is a good place to visit but is too crowded with bikes and people moving in parallel on the narrow bridge.

title: Really a Jhula (Ride)
review: It felt amazing when you walk here. You can feel the wind and slow jhula while walking. . .

title: Must visit when you are here
review: Just see from up side  view balcony , above Germany Bakery. Very crowded area  also terror of monkeys in this area

title: "Ok" place
review: Well of you are in Rishikesh, you go here as ritual. However there is nothing great about this place. But can be visited once if you are in the town.

title: Laksman Jhula visit.
review: Great experience. Watching Ganges from this bridge is a nice experience the clamness of ambiance is soothing.

title: suspension bridge that sways gently!
review: a suspension bridge across the Ganges that gently sways in the wind.  A prime attraction in Rishikesh town. offers an unhindered view of the Ganges. Guaranteed to be crowded always.

title: Experience the tranquility at night
review: One of the best things to do with Laxman Jhula is to be there at night around 9'ish and you can feel the tranquility within. The place at that point in time is overwhelming and more so if there is a chilly breeze that occupies the environs at that point of time. Easily comparable to one of the best experiences that I have had abroad whilst visiting Paris, Rotterdam etc.

title: okayish
review: It is one the famous attractions of rishikesh.. but the best part here is lots of places to east and shop surrounding the attraction. but it was scary to walk on the jhula

title: Adventurous break
review: Recently did a quick trip to Rishikesh on this weekend and frankly i realized there's nothing much to do in Rishikesh apart from Rafting and Bunjee Jumping.The roads are all jam packed with cars, so there is practically no charm left.

title: Family trip
review: Good place with lots of options,for youngsters also .lots of adventure also

title: Hanging Bridge
review: Great view from the bridge, one will enjoy crossing it, beneath it the almighty Ganga gives you the chills.

title: Nice bridge
review: Good place to visit n roam around. Ganga view is awesome. Sit some time on the banks place your feet in cold water. You will be recharged.

title: Good views but the experience is marred by bikes, monkeys and dogs
review: Good view from the bridge of the Ganga coming from between the hills. However there's just too much congestion on the bridge with bikes, dogs, cows and monkeys vying with hundreds of tourists. The area around is also quite filthy when compared to Ram Jhula. If you've been to Ram Jhula and found it good, this can be given a miss. If you must, visit early in the morning.

title: Love this peaceful place
review: Ganga will warm your heart.

title: Icon of Rishikesh
review: A beautiful suspended bridge over the holy river and main attraction of Rishikesh attracts lots of visitors and to take nice photos

title: Mesmerizing view from Lakshman Jhula
review: While standing on lakshman jhula you would enjoy the flowing river beneath your feet. and mesmerizing view on either side.

title: Good Experience
review: Lakshman Jhula is similar to Ram Jhula. It remains very crowded since two wheelers also pass through this bridge.

title: Good place
review: It is a suspended bridge over the Ganga connecting both the banks. You can feel the vibrations when vehicles pass from it as government has now allowed 2 wheelers to pass through bridge. You can only enjoy this place in morning by watching Ganga river when there are almost no vehicles. As day progresses vehicles increase and this becomes irritating. The morning cool breeze while crossing it is really good.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to visit.. too crowded.. Motorcyclists keep honking. Govt should ban vehicles on LAxman Jhula

title: Science meets nature
review: An extraordinary thing to see from perspective of science. you see a blend of nature surrounded while standing in mid of bridge which has clearly no support from the pillar.

title: Great view
review: This is the most exciting part of the city. All the yoga ashrams and rooms on rent are near by. and all the organic cafes are situated here as well. River side cafe with great view and hippie gatherings here is a plus

title: incredible construction
review: awesome view of ganga from this ancient bridge. incerdible place peacefull one of the best place for yoga and meditation

title: great place to stay nearby
review: great view of the ganges from the bridge.nice,clean and good maintenance.

title: Good Place
review: Too much crowd in evening, bikes driver will keep honking and push you here and there. If you want to enjoy this place you have to be here early morning or late night only.

title: Very nice to watch fishes from upside down
review: Must visit place, enjoy boat ride available downstairs to  it and have a dip in cool water of Ganges.

title: Happy to see Bikes riding on the small bridge
review: Surprised to see bullets crossing the river from this birdge. It actually shakes when you walk over it. One time visit it nice.

title: Nice place for family outing
review: Very nice and beautiful place spl very peaceful... You want to visit this kind of when your family is you where you can relax and have fun filled outdoor activities...

title: Too many two Wheeler's
review: It's a FOB....thr should be no two Wheeler s allowed on it. Not child friendly and a lil over hyped. Can avoided as it's just another bridge.

title: Picturesque Laxman Jhula
review: Visited Laxman Jhula and had lovely photos of the river below. Had a lovely glass of sugar cane juice from the near the temple complex.

title: Pilgrimage place with beautiful Ganga river
review: Ganga river is beautiful. Serene and peaceful place. Walking along jhula is a good experience.  Even people drive two wheelers on this bridge.

title: Nothing much to say
review: It is attractive just because of it's name. Lot of pilgrims visit the place considering it as sacred. Apart from that, government has allowed vehicle to cross the bridge which has become inconvenient and less enjoyable.

title: Saddhus
review: Give 70 beggars or saddhus ten rupees. A lot you might think? Its exactly 70 smiles for 10 euro's

title: good for first timer
review: it is only a hanging bridge...you can have a good view of Ganaga from bridge. It will not take much time to visit this place.

title: Peaceful walk
review: Quite - nice to go early morning or late night. Click a few pics of the Ganga below or just walk towards the other side.

title: Mythology revisited
