review: A suspended bridge over the Ganga connecting both the banks. It has mythological significance but now it is a nuisance wit two wheelers whizzing across. Pedestrians are harrowed by all the honking. Should be used only for walking to enjoy the views of the Ganga.

title: nice bridge
review: very strategically placed bridge.

title: Not a jhula
review: Its not a nay kind of jhula. Its a human made bridge but yes i enjoy walking on this jhula. It was really amazing.

title: Good view
review: Calm serene place, lot of options to go for rafting, good cafes to eat out, mostly foreigners stay close to lakshman jhoola and hence this place has good hostels/ hotels with clean bathrooms and clean rooms too

title: Great place lots going on
review: Laxman jhula is a great place with lots to see and do whether you're seeking spirituality or just want to shop and bathe by the Ganga. Lots of great hangouts and coffee shops

title: Amazing Cafe
review: Laxman Jhula has got very nice cafe and restaurants now. Earlier it was popular only among pilgrims but now it is very youth friendly

title: Relaxing place.
review: Not dangerous as Delhi, so in the evening also we can enjoy walking.

title: Lovely!
review: It feels great to watch the holy river, Ganga flow beneath you while you cross the Lakshman jhula. I don't how they allow bikes to cross through the jhula as well. It shakes (only a bit) while things move through it. Its decorated with lights all around in the evening. Its pleasure to watch it glow sitting on the banks of Ganga.

title: Nothing special
review: The view os great, but there are a lot of places quere you can get a simular view. It's crowded with people taking selfies, cows, donkeys, bikes and monkeys. No special history as well

title: The brother bridge of Ram Jhula
review: This Lakshman is the brother bridge of Ram Jhula, located a km or so away from the Ram Jhula , It connects the other side of the land over the majestic Ganges, Its a splendour to stand on the middle of the hanging bridge and see the river flow down with the wind swaying the bridge. Thrill of a lifetime. Mus visit place.

title: Very interresting, much to see and experience
review: Lakshman Jhula is a must visit and must see during a visit at Rishikesh. A lot of restaurants and many many shops. Poeple are very friendly and the walk over both bridges is or might be scary to some but an experience negotiating cows and scooters on the bridge

title: Didnt like the monkeys
review: Most of the time Its too busy .lots of people ,cows,bikes,monkeys....

title: Ten minutes walkable distance from this hotel.
review: You can reach Laxman Jhula within 10 minutes walkable distance from this hotel. It's awesome and hotel is near to this place

title: A Mythical Bridge
review: Saw this place while at Rishikesh. Both from the river, as well as on top of it. Nothing much to write about, being more a "functional requirement bridge" now, than a "mythically significant bridge", as it is being marketed. Motorbikes, scooters, cyclists, small pushcarts, all add to the chaos on this bridge, along with boisterous and over enthusiastic pedestrians. Be careful of the numerous beggars squatting in, around and on the bridge.

title: Brilliant
review: This is a must do if you are in Rishikesh.Its one of those attractions that never grow old. Its meant for foot traffic only but you will find loads of scooters and motorbikes going up and down, which is a bit annoying. be wary of the monkeys as they can get a bit more friendly than you would like them to be. Best not to try to pose and take photos with them either. Would highly recommend trying the German bakery on the other side of Laxman Jhula as well

title: mrs
review: Good for the experience but extremely busy with motorbikes. It has a lovely view of Ganges. It is very popular. There were also monkeys enjoying it

title: I wish it were a pedestrian only bridge!
review: Best view of the town, the only irritating factor really is that a few motorbikes always force their way through pushing aside hundreds of pedesrians

title: Visit to Laxman Jhula
review: Amazing experience, must visit!! Please do also visit various temples in the the vicinity of Lakshman Jhula. Wonderful history. Hire a guide we did and it was great.Try various precious stone, rudrakash etc at Khadhi Gramak Udyog shop. Very genuine and reasonable stuff.

title: A swinging bridge with a history
review: This is a classic suspension bridge -- the weight is taken by the cables on top from which the bridge deck is suspended. As one walks across, the bridge sways in the wind. The original bridge was washed away in the great flood of 1924 (reminds one of the floods of 2013). It was rebuilt in 1930 as the first jeepable suspension bridge in Uttar Pradesh. The interesting plaques at one end of the bridge are worth reading, and state the bridge was funded by a private party and that no toll would ever be charged for crossing this bridge.

title: Just a quick view
review: It should be a quick trip as area is too crowded. If you are driving, then get ready to find a parking.

title: View
review: Beautiful view of river ganga. Water is clean and green between Jan to March and view from Lakshman Jhula is beautiiful. You can feel the swing in air

title: Suspension Bridge!!!
review: Superb Suspension Bridge popularly called as Lakshman Jhula. You will enjoy your walk on this Jhola. Build over River Ganga. The Bridge sways in the wind and two wheelers are allowed on it. The view from the bridge is serene. Plan to visit this place in the morning as it will be less crowded.

title: Bobbling jhula
review: It is a bobbling place. but people are crossing it bindaas. on two wheelers, mostly firangis. But lot of crowd in & around the temples. View is idealic. rafting going on below in the river and all around temples. Monkeys too are around snatching eatables.

title: An iron suspension bridge
review: It was erected over the Ganges river and is a landmark of Rishikesh, It has a lovely view of Ganges. If you have to visit this place then prefer early morning.

title: Unsafe and annoying!
review: Walking with monkeys shoulder to shoulder, they snatch absolutely anything that's in your hands. Bikes and scooters are also permitted on the bridge which is barely 4-5 feet across making it congested not to the least very dangerous too.

title: Must visit
review: This is an engineering marvel. The bridge is a solid sturdy structure build by the brits about 50 years ago and still working. It shakes and vibrates with moving vehicles and people. Pretty amazing view of river ganga

title: Family place just like Ram Jhula
review: The Jhula is good but there are good local shopping areas around the place and also some very good restaurants.

title: Time Pass Only
review: me and my friend visit there, nothing to do and see Only  Pretty amazing view of river ganga from jhula.

title: Its nothing like image.
review: It's a bridge to cross river. It's hardly 4-5 ft wide on which they allow bikes to cross. You can't stand for 2 mins as too much two wheeler movement.

title: attraction
review: good shopping place. Cheep and good stuff from local vendors. Better not to bargain on streets. Its nice buy

title: Nice place
review: Serene and beautiful place in Rishikesh. A suspension bridge across river Ganga which is surrounded by holy places and yoga centers and ashrams. You can also enjoy river rafting and boating!!

title: A fascinating bridge!
review: I stayed at Kunwar Residency hotel which overlooks the bridge so spent a lot of time watching all the people and animals going over it.It is a suspension bridge crossing the Ganges which gently flows under it.The bridge is usually full of local people,I ndian and foreign tourists,photographers,motor bikes,and an assortment of animals.You can watch it all dY and ever get bored!

title: Swing Jhula
review: As the name goes this jhula actually swings in the mid air. the area is famous because of Ganga river at the bottom.

title: Love the vibe of this place!
review: We fall in love with Rishikesh, although travelling with little kids can be a challenge, but that applies to all India in general so was expected. The only thing about the bridge is constant motorcycles passing and being there with a toddler makes you extra cautious as it's very narrow.

title: Beautiful scenery of Ganga
review: It was nice to see Holy Ganga ji from the Lakshman Jhula while going across the Ganga ji. It is one of the oldest Jhulas and is the means of the transportation and connects Risikesh to Garhwak district.

title: Shaking bridge
review: This is a narrow cable suspension bridge which shakes all the time beacise of the movement of people.  It is approx 5 feet wide and people animal and bikes all cross the river on it.   This is a good bridge an a must visit one

title: Recap of old memories
review: More crowded with two wheelers on the jhula... German bakery had lost its charm. Good items are not good. Pineapple juice was fresh and good. Fed the fish from bridge.

title: Avoidable, too chaotic
review: Extremely bad infra, too congested and very crowded, avoidable if with kids, Ramjhulla is much better.

title: Historic and beautiful
review: Its an old bridge but looks beautiful. Scenic view of it is photogenic. Looks beautiful even in d night. Old but maintained and must visit place when you are here.

title: Incredible views
review: There aren't too many places you can mingle with many other people from all over the world, cows, motorbikes, merchants with carts, bicycles and monkeys in one place. The height of the this bridge affords fantastic views of the Ganges and both banks. Many great restaurants are at either end of the bridge. During the busier times it can be quite tense, especially if there are many motorbikes. Just keep going.

title: Love It
review: It never gets old. Visiting the place on and off for last 20 years.....but never gets old. The sirinity, the mesmerising tranquillity of the place always keeps me spellbound.  However be aware of the monkeys and don't have food items on your hand while crossing the bridge. The monkeys may pounce on you otherwise....

title: 👍 bridge of sprituality and westernization influence!
review: Laxman jhula, a suspension bridge which connect two banks of river ganga in rishikesh. On eastern bank you will find lots of cafes, resturants, ashrams and lots of foreigners! This bank shows how much rishikesh influnced the world. I was happy to see that they were quite comfortable there and to me it seems they feel safe also foe them. Thanks to the locals and officials to gives them safety assurance.

title: Great place to chill out n shop
review: Nice walk to a lovely market.

title: Sacred home of my heart
review: You should go, see and feel the high vibes around.  A wonderful place for soul seekers, yoga lovers, ayurveda fans. You can try traditional food, do some Indian clothing shopping and open a new soul by attending any satsang or trying various yoga or meditation courses.

title: Great Little Walk
review: Worth the walk through the old markets to get to the bridge. It's a short bridge at only about 450 meters. Awesome views of the Ganges from the bridge.

title: Beautiful
review: It really look amazing from below when the weather is great. Lucky enough to saw this view as it was about to rain. Beautiful

title: Consider it as a suspending bridge made by jute rope, steel and concrete.
review: A bride which crosses by thousand of peoples a day, amazing (else it's just a bridge). Can stand on the bridge and look at peoples if have nothing to do.

title: Mesmerizing place ...!!
review: It depends on what time of the day you visit this Jhula (massive hammock or swinging bridge)... I would recommend to visit very early in morning specially in summer days ... all you will hear is the wind blowing ... the sound of the water and the birds and the "feel" the sunrise (obviously only possible if you reach before sunrise) ... I can tell you from personal experience that it was mesmerizing .... try it and share your experience

title: Good
review: Its a Jhula aka hanging bridge.The only worse part about this was they allow bikes on it and people drive crazily even in the midst of so much crowd.Its a mediocre place.

title: One the few things to do in rishikesh
review: This jhula rocks! I mean literally .. It's simply a bridge with suspension to cross one end of ganga to another .. I m unsure of its history but we used it as we wanted to visit the other side

title: Not a pleasant experience
review: I'm not sure what the big deal is about this bridge. I mean, it's an efficient way of crossing the river and I suppose it some sort of a landmark in Rishikesh, but apart from that it's just a bridge. Most of the time it's quite crowded. Expect honking from the motorcycles and scooters that are allowed to drive on it, and be prepared for hoards of people taking selfies and blocking your way.

title: Exotic view of jhulla river hill and temples.
review: we use yo go this place once or twice a week. to sit here in evening is devine. Some good places like Beatles caffe, german caffe, Ganga beach,ayur pak, ganga view etc here you can eat whatever you like with great natural view. so enjoy

title: Holiday
review: There are lovely cafes and shops. And also at 5.30 the ceremony begins . For ceremony u have to walk about 2 km buf u can also ride a taxi very cheaply. I had really good time.

title: Scenic Hill and Ganges View
review: A walk in laxman jhoola will give you beautiful scenic view with mountains on the backdrop, ganges flowing below and the spiritual fervor a must one to visit in the holy city of Rishikesh

title: Go through the town which has a real charm and wonder into the hills
review: Much quieter if you keep to the lanes and across the bridge you'll discover the real charm of Rishikesh ...

title: Must do for a tourist in Rishikesh ?
review: The suspension bridge experience is good. The bridge swings every time you walk on it, or course you feel the bridge swaying more when you are still.

title: An ancient cable bridge very popular related with RAMAYANA times.
review: The bridge is related to Ramayana epic. people used to cross Ganges through this bridge on foot, that time it was regarded very sacred. However now 2 wheelers are rampant and maintenance is very poor.

title: Reserve more days to Rishikesh
review: Rishikesh is just a wonderful place to relax and get in India's rich culture. Experience one of the Ashram's, try massage, yoga, ayurveda and more. Walk along the bridge, try the restaurants, the temples, simply purify yourself.

title: All the buzz is around there
review: Lakshman Jhula is a meeting point, a reference and it is also where a lot of the buzz happens. It is fun just to stay close to one of the entrances of the bridge and see what is going on. Although motorcycles are not allowed on the bridge, they go in all the time, causing havoc. The monkeys also love the place, different species roam around. When it is sunny the river down below shines it's beauty to the top of the bridge.

title: Nice place to be in amazing weather..
review: Sometimes weather plays a better role in your trip. It was amazing weather and the place is good with nice scenery around. Staying around is also good.

title: amazing suspension bridge
review: when many people walks on this bridge and if there is fast wind blows then it will move in air slightly and shocked you.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: the lakshman jhula, is the second bridge in Rishikesh,

title: Walking bridge
review: Lots of fun to cross, especially if there are monkeys about.  Families and individuals use this bridge to cross the Ganga River to visit ashrams any time of day or evening.  Occasionally there are motorbikes crossing too that you have to be careful to avoid.

title: Place is nice
review: This place is beautiful. You will enjoy this place. Sad to see that ganges water is getting dirty these days. But you will love this place. Only bad thing about it are the localities here. They behave like goons. They stare the females...........

title: Well worth the trip...incredible views
review: Rishikesh itself is a wonderfully tranquil and beautiful place.  The Lakshman Jhula is incredibly high and tends to wobble a little but it is stunning.

title: Beautiful landmark.
review: Lovely bridge to walk across, both directions.  Great views of the town and the beautiful Ganges.  Great marketplace as well.  The monkeys are fun to check out, but watch out... they will take stuff out of your hands (see photo).

title: Nice Place
review: Nice place for an evening walk.The view from there is also pretty good.Very good restaurants near by as well.Good place to be to view the spectacular sunset.

title: nice view
review: laxman jhula is  nice place , must visit place in rishikesh.

title: Colourful during Ardha Kumbh
review: The jhula was decorated with LED lighting which was quite delightful to watch at night. The security here is beefed up. Monkeys did not seem to harass anyone during the 5-6 times that we were using the bridge or around it.

title: I was impressed by the view to Lakshman Jhula
review: I was impressed by the view to Lakshman Jhula. The bridge is very nice to cross high over the rapid Ganga River, at the end of the bridge there is an amazing temple. You can see a lot of monkeys and cows crossing it as well, but be careful monkeys can steal your food and cameras. I assume at evening time this place is amazing.

title: Monkey business!
review: Lakshman Jhula lived up to our expectations. Hindu families tossing offerings to the fish they hold sacred. Monkeys swinging from the wires and hoping for a handout. The great view of Mother Ganga below. Can't wait to cross Lakshman Jhula again.

title: Experience suspension over the ganga
review: The laxman jhula is a suspension bridge built over the ganga and is an exciting experience to cross. The light sway of the brigde can be felt, especially when the bikes cross on it. It was decorated during the ardh kumbh and looked lovely. Should be visited during a trip to rishikesh.

title: Amazing suspension bridge !!
review: The biggest attraction of Rishikesh. The Lakshman Jhula is an amazing suspension bridge over the holy Ganga river. There are many shops on either side of the bridge selling idols, offerings, souvenirs and eatables. The Lakshman Jhula is close to the Tapovan area of Rishikesh which also houses many  yoga ashrams. One can notice many foreigners in this area.

title: Nothing to see anything
review: The architecture of bridge is good but Ganga is flow-less. Some old temple are present there. The car leave you at lakshman jhula and you can walk from lakshman jhula to ram jhula. you can also take car. The rent of the car is Rs.10 each.

title: Quaint town of commerce
review: Really nice place to go, a short walk from rishikesh! Commerce and kindness all around. I enjoyed myself and the food at blue moon cafe is amazing

title: Hanging bridge
review: Great view is sat rounding over her

title: A big tourist attraction in Rishikesh
review: It is located about 3 km away from downtown Rishikesh This famous hanging bridge is 450 feet long at a height of 59 feet from summer water lecel. It was built in 1930 after the old one was washed away in a flood in 1924.It is also famous due to it's ancient origin and religious sancity. Enchanting mantras and shlokas from nearby temples create very calm and religious ambience. There are a lot of shops nearby selling wooden goods, Rudraksha, gems, holy books and tasty street food. Worth seeing in Rishikesh.

title: Peace and calm place
review: The place is so lovely, very peaceful place, best travel destination. The restaurants near Lakshman jhoola like honey hut etc are so awesome. Love this place...

title: Don't skip the walk on it
review: It's a suspension bridge named after Sri Ram younger brother.

title: Good restaurants and accomodations
review: I recommend the walk between Lakshman Jhula and Ram Jhula on the far side of the river. It takes you through all the shops and restaurant areas, as well as the best beaches in town. Also Lakshman Jhula taxi area at the main Badrinath Road at the top of the hill has the best organic grocery shops and organic restaurant in town.

title: Major tourist attraction
review: Lakshman Jhula is a nice place to visit in Rishikesh. It is suspended bridge hanging with cables across Ganga river to help people cross it.

title: The place to be in Rishikesh
review: I also visited Ram Jhula and was disappointed. Lovely atmosphere at Lakshman Jhula. Good cafes and overpriced little shops. But hey, look at the view! :-)

title: A wonderful experience
review: It's a hanging bridge named after Shri Ram's younger brother Lakshman overlooking the mighty river Ganges. Rare gemstones are sold on either side of the bridge. The local food served there is very tasty. Visit the place for a wonderful experience.

title: Nice cafe and good souvenir shops
review: Laxman Jhula is a great place for a mall road kind of walk, through nice eateries, german bakeries and shops selling sovenirs.

title: Lakshman Jhula
review: This is a bridge on the river Ganges . It does not have any sop port down so it swings a little when you walk on it .so is the name hula means swing . I was really disappointed as it was very dirty and full of cows dun .

title: Fun, festive place to be
review: The whole area is fun and light.  It is great to walk across the Laksman Jhula bridge across the other side which takes you into the countryside and then cross the Ram Jhula bridge back.  A lovely sight, easy walk, joyful experience.

title: Be welcomed by monkeys!
review: Amazing bridge with nice view.  Nice temple the other side and shopping available there.  Good restaurants also.  Just be careful of whitefaces monkeys.  Hold your cap and sunglasses.

title: Noisyyyyy and with monkeys
review: I cross that bridge everyday and I whish one day it could be quiet so i could stop and enjoy the view.... motorcicles is just coming and going all the time and so many people and monkeys together! its an interesting place ...

title: very beautiful place
review: reminds you of light and peace, but my friend had her drawing stolen by a monkey here lol~

title: Lakshman Jhula - Make it easy for Senior Citizens
review: lakshman Jhoola is a must visit but for senior citizens, it is a nightmare to reach and use steep stairs. it may be a good idea to put elevators and charge the tourists if necessary.

title: Noissy with scotters and bike passing throuugh it
review: Although this is landmark but could have been well managed.Jhoola is full of photographers instead of tourist, Space left is used by 2 wheelers travellers.

title: Must visit
review: One of rishikesh's must visit places especially at sunrise and sunset.Icon of rishikesh and the best landmark

title: Excellent View
review: Excellent View of the Ganges clear water entering the Plains. Can go for the boat Ride from one side to other in the clear waters.

title: Nothing more than a Jhula.
review: This is a bridge which connects the two parts of city. The place is very busy all long the day and beware of monkeys at the edge of the Jhula. Overall, nothing special about the place.

title: Busy Bridge, lifeline of locals.
review: Its is a busy rope-way for commuters to cross the Ganges flowing with mighty current below. In use by pedestrians, scooters, motorcycle & cyclists alike.... One should be careful of the monkeys as they seem to snatch any suspected food items you may be carrying....

title: Suspension Bridge
review: It is a Holy Places all the way Ganga River from Haridwar to Rishikesh. seems similar places like Haridwar but different is Upper part of Ganga and it more clear.

title: good service
review: Good, strong Jhula, serves both locals and Tourists.

title: Pretty place with a good view
review: It is indeed a "Jhoola" (swing). The bridge is built on Ganga and the view is very pretty. The ghats are surrounded by various ashrams and restaurants.

title: Rishikesh is worth visit only for Rafting
review: Rishikesh has only two places to visit one for Laxman Jhulla and and other for Rafting.Jhulla is nothing great it was build 110 years ago to cross the river.if you r not planning to go for Rafting you should avoid visiting Rishikesh & Laxman Jhulla

title: A landmark
review: This is a small suspension bridge ove river Ganga but an iconic landmark there for a long time. Views of the reiver early morning are really nice, but gets crowded during the day.  Just beware of the monkeys out there.

title: one of the important landmarks in Rishikesh
review: i had heard a lot of lakshman jhula and being very close to my hotel, we went to visit it. suspended over river Ganga it looks architectural marvel, considering that it was built way back. nice feeling to be walking on it with river flowing underneath.

title: Peaceful & Beautiful
review: The evenings spent on the Ghats at Laxman Jhula are very peaceful. The days are little crowded but the evenings and mornings are silent, free, peaceful. I love the environment at Laxman Jhula.

title: Marvelous piece of architect
review: Lovely to be on the stunning suspension bridge specially in the  morning or at late night. and the feeling of the breeze flowing from the Ganges is really awesome.

title: One of the best site to view the river Ganges at Rishikesh
review: It is one of the oldest site to view the river Ganges at Rishikesh and    connects Rishikesh to  another district Pauri Garhwal.

title: Soak in the magical experience
review: Indeed a place to just experience! Was able to visit  in evening @ 5 pm of January/winter.Perched atop the suspended bridge , was greeted with a large horde of friendly monkeys. Just stood there, closed my eyes and soaked every bit of hallowed experience.Saw a couple of German and Italian bakeries enroute.Beautiful artefacts,music and book shops too. The positive vibes of this place simply de-stresses you! You also get to interact with people from all over the globe , leaving behind a magical experience of sight and sound-cheers

title: Spiritual Center
review: If you are interested in the spiritual buzz, then head to Lakshman Jhula which is much more reflective and offers diverse experiences for all from the new age hippie to the wearied traveler.  There are temples, yoga schools, shops, ashrams, ayurvedic centers, monkeys, cows and people jostling for space here. If you care to stop and experience, you may find more than you seek. Keep your eyes and mind open!

title: Nice bridge
review: Nice place to see the sunrise but cant stand in a place for more than 2 mins after 8am till 7pm and most imprtantly beware of mobile phone stealing monkeys on the bridge ;)

title: The best place
review: This is the place around where you find good places to leisure around. The Bridge is small. Two wheelers are allowed on this. Have good rush of people. Photographers are standing every 20 steps on this bridge. They carry their own printer along. Charge is Rs. 50 Per Photograph. This rate is fixed no bargaining. View is awesome. You can also go to German Bakery on the side of the bridge to have a good look of the Holy Ganges. On the other side there is a Momo Shop on the left side of the road ( 5 minutes from Laxman Jhula on the side which connects to shivpuri. Its name is Buddhas Momo. Nice momo shop.  All shops have a reasonable priced products, Bargaining is useless. Gharwali people are good .

title: Maddening
review: It is very confusing that even on a pedestrian bridge, there would be a line of two-wheelers trumpeting their horn and making you deaf.

title: swing 2
review: The prominent 450-foot long iron suspension bridge was built in 1939 over the Ganga River. It is said that Lord Ram's brother Lakshman had crossed the River on a jute rope from here. This part of town is better known for its busy bazaars, restaurants and cafés and one can also visit the Lakshman and Raghunath temples here.

title: Bridge
review: Second bridge. Popular with local tourists and backpackers. Loads of cafes and restaurants, shops etc.

title: Yoga
review: The Best Yoga Holy Town that I know . Absolutely recommended even for Rafting and Trekking on Himalaya's mountain

title: Amazing views and interesting area
review: If you go to Rishikesh you cannot miss walking over this bridge.  The views are wonderful and you will see many interesting sights from the bridge.  Be careful of the monkeys as they like to grab anything that hangs from your clothing.  The bridge is quite narrow and you can find yourself competing with pedestrians, cyclists, motorbikes, cows and monkeys to cross.  A really wonderful buzz

title: Similar to Ram Jhula
review: great place.. heaps of temples .. but food available is better in quality and has decent ambience...

title: Beautifully Uplifting
review: Beautiful experience. Great views...loved it.

title: Suspension bridge
review: This is a pictursque bridge, it is purely made of iron, moreover it is hanging from two sides on gganges.It was a gift of Rai bahadur tulshan for the memory of his father, no tax will ever imposed for crossing it.

title: A Different Side of Rishikesh
review: Many travellers arrive in Ram Jhula and miss the magic of Laxshman Jhula.  It may not have the big glamorous Arti as performed at Parmarth Ashram in Ram Jhula, if you visit Laxshman Jhula there are gems that could be easy to miss.  ShantiMayi gives Satsang at 11 am each day from Feb 1st, the big hall on the left hand side at Sacha Ashram.  Although there are two teachers at Sacha Ashram - Prem Baba a brazillian male ex psychotherapist who charges a price for his teachings.  ShantiMayi is a rare gem, she speaks english, has a great interaction with people who attend her Satsangs.  For me She is the diamond residing in Laxshman Jhula in the wetern winter.  Very welcoming inclusive environment.  Ishan is a good place to eat nearby.  Laxshman Jhula is quieter and a much more reflective area in rishikesh.  If you are attending Rishikesh for support on your spiritual path Laxshman Jhula has a lot to offer.

title: A very old connection
review: We visited Rishikesh in April 2015.  We took an auto rickshaw from Haridwar which took about one hour to reach Laxman Jhula. We planned to enter through Laxman Jhula and exit trhough Ram Jhula.  Laxman Jhula was built by Britishers some 90 years ago and upto few years back it was the only connection to cross the river.  It is a suspended iron bridge of about 500 feet long  and 6 ft. wide. It is a thrilling experience to go through it and see the flowing Ganges.  It shakes when we pass over it. Tourists who visit Rishikesh definitely visit Laxman Jhula. From the other end we get conveyance for Neel Kanth Mahadev temple.

title: The place to be for new age/hippie-yoga pretending spiritual young ones
review: That's where the intensity is, the buzz. On each side of the bridge,although the south side definitely is the hub where everyone goes. All the small temples, yoga schools, ashrams attract the kind of people who want to be in a "spiritual" place, so you find many westerners there, the lost ones in quest, very hippie, new age with egos pretending to be spiritual. I didn't find any spiritual depth there, but the classic image that sells spirituality in india.

title: Emblematic view
review: Not to miss spot in Rishikesh, links the two shores of the city and it is used by people, motorbikes, cows, monkeys, dogs...

title: Serene
review: The aesthetics of the bridge & it's surrounding river banks are mesmerizing, especially in dawn & dusk.

title: Excellent view
review: The location is perfect/Excellent for photography. you can enjoy with family. This Jhula was a hanging jute bridge, which was later rebuilt into suspended iron bridge. On the either side of the jhula, there are famous temples like Lakshman Temple and Tapovan that are also frequented by the tourists.

title: Looks amazing in all the pictures, but it's just a bridge!
review: It's just a short bridge, beggars at either end, and loads of scooters riding across it! Yeah it does give great uncompromised views of the Ganges, but your across in 20 seconds providing you don't get hit by a motorbike!

title: Crossing the Ganges
review: The Jhula can get extremely crowded on auspicious days, so choose well for a more spiritually gratifying experience.

title: Incredible India
review: It is name of the bridge on River Ganges in Rishikesh. It is actually a landmark of this small city. Very crowded but worth it.This Jhula was a hanging jute bridge, which was later rebuilt into suspended iron bridge.Yoga, ayurveda, music, shops, and backpackers.Walking down lakshman jhula is great,market both sides were good.

title: favorite
review: This is our favorite spot.  We love Ganga maiya and u can spend hours  on laxman jhula.  full of fun and quite place.

title: Worth it cause of its history
review: Very crowded but worth it. We just drove past and checked it of our list for the sake.

title: NICE
review: It is name of the bridge on River Ganges in Rishikesh. It is actually a landmark of this small city.

title: A place worth visiting
review: this is one of the few  very old suspension bridges in India though with passage of time many such bridges have come up. a must visit for Rishikesh visitors.

title: VISIT TO LAXMANJHULA
review: At the confluence of the Ganges and Chandrabhaga rivers,in the foot hills the GARHWAL HIMALAYAS ,42 kms of Dehradun.

title: Amazingly beautiful
review: Since childhood I read about this laxman jhula in books and saw it on TV,but when I happen to really see it first time I was so thrilled and mesmerized by such a great location and people their.

title: Excellent view of Ganges from the suspension bridge
review: Get a Good view of Mighty Ganges from the Suspension bridge. If planning to visit Neelkant temple, it is worth combining this location with Neelkant. Cross to the other side of Ganges and take a Taxi, Drive to Neelkanth temple is worth with Ganges and Jule rivers on the valley sides, the drive itself has quite a lot of Camping/trekking grounds. For those who can't do rafting, can at least see rafting from the suspension bridge.

title: Nice location
review: very Nice location must visit laxman jhula if you travel to rishikesh. great loation i like this area

title: Excellent place
review: It is an iron suspension bridge made by British situated in Rishikesh. It moves like jhula while walking. Temple complex is beautiful.

title: laxman jhula
review: it was again a good experience ...we went there at 8:00pm and rush was very less. and yes the jhula was moving little up and down ...the cold breeze was also making the experience exciting

title: nice landmark
review: walking down lakshman jhula is great . market both sides were good. even monkeys in the lakshman jhula were very decent and didn't harass anybody. in fact they allowed clicking selfies with travellers

title: Good place to hang out
review: Great place to sight see in morning hours. Life is situated around the jhula with travelers, cafes, book shops around it.

title: Important Landmark
review: Rishikesh is a beautiful place with an iconic landmark (Lakshamn Jhula) The ganges flowing beneath the bridge, This place offers a great spot for scenic view...One will find shops on either side of the bridge and MONKEYS! loads and loads of them.

title: An Awesome Place
review: It is must to visit at your tour to Rishikesh. I would suggest to hire a bike and travel all the places around Rishikesh. Ganga at this height gives very beautiful view.

title: Yoga, ayurveda, music, shops, and backpackers
review: Nice vibe, beautiful view on Ganga river, a lot of tourists, a lot of tourist shops, a lot of yoga, ayurveda, concerts, and music classes, sometimes very business orientated, sometimes genuine, it needs to meet people and talk to find the right places. I wanted to relax and finally I moved uphill in Damandha, really nice guest houses far from the horns, smokes, and shops, just beside is Samarpan ashram, genuine yoga, super cheap, for dedicated people.

title: Not Bad
review: Nice bridge marred by the incessant intrusion of motorcycles and scooters who may not hesitate to knock you. The bridge offers a very good view of the Ganges but the visit can be peppered by continuous horning from these 2-wheelers.

title: A nice place
review: Lakshman Jhula is a nice place to visit in Rishikesh. A tourist spot accompanied with a market to buy winter wears situated at the foot hills of the Himalayas.

title: Must walk on this bridge
review: This is one bridge I have heard of and seen in pictures countless times. So it was surreal to actually see it and walk across the Ganges - it goes through cycles when there will be throngs of people on it and then suddenly, nobody but you.

title: Commotion commotion everywhere
review: Animals, vehicles and people on the same 4 feet width of the road. Lots of commotion and not worth the hype. It is akin to standing on a road.

title: Lakshman Jhula at Rishikesh
review: The bridge is crowded and we also see many two wheelers using the bridge. They continuously honk and make sure you are always on the guard and cant' even pose for a pic at ease. The view was exciting though

title: it should be maintained well
review: there should be tourist activities near by this bridge otherwise there is nothing to spend time at this bridge.

title: My favourite bridge
review: I stayed most of my time in Rishikesh in Lakshman Jhula and it is a really special place. Walking across the bridge with cows, monkeys, motorbikes it's quite an experience. Lakshman area is also good for restaurants and chilling with good river views.

title: A simple rope suspension bridge
review: Lakshman Jhula is a very famous bridge, across the north india located at Rishikesh. Basically its a steel rope suspension bridge, which is built over river Ganga, obviously its engineering is great and very old, and it shakes all the time if you stand over it in the middle of bridge, but don't expect something high, its just a rope bridge as told earlier.

title: peaceful view
review: While standing Jhula you can a very nice overview of ganga review & ghats of ghanga!!!  .   one vewi when you are doing raflting & other one us when you actualy on the Jhula bothe are vew nice!!. one should visit the place in a life time .

title: A hanging bridge
review: Laxman jhoola is almost synonymous with Rishikesh. It is suspended bridge hanging with cables across Ganga river to help people cross it. The bridge is 4 feet wide and shared by pedestrian as well as bikers. One must be carefull while crossing otherwise any bike will hit you. View from the middle of the bridge is awesome. You can see the great Ganga river flowing in full flow beneath you. People sell flour pills to offer to fish. When you through these flour pills in river, lots of fishes gather to eat which is quite a fascinating sight. Overall if you are in Rishikesh you have to cross Lakshman jhoola or Ram jhoola to go across Ganga. Go have a good time.

title: Must Go, if visit Rishikesh
review: The main attraction in Lakshman Jhula is a hanging bridge having around 300 ft long across the river Ganga. Lakshman Jhula is approximately 8km away from the main city of Rishikesh. The Auto rickshaw (Tuk Tuk) journey was unforgettable from Rishikesh to Lakshman Jhula, but the fare was very cheap (the road was very bad condition when i visited,  may be because of CHAR DHUM season).

title: Breathtaking views.
review: A must visit spot when you go to Rishikesh. The suspended bridge is the best I've seen over the Ganges. Lovely, breathtaking view of the Mighty Ganga.

title: Beautiful experience
review: Suspension bridge is scary and good fun. The bridge is a beautiful piece and the view of Ganges and mountain is breath taking. Must visit place.

title: Maa ganga
review: Very rare jula.and very near to hotel kunwar residency .

title: Clumsy place and unfriendly tourist place.
review: Most of the tourist offices are located here,however cleanliness of place is not great and Auto or Taxi guys will literately loot you, if you don't have your vehicle.

title: ok
review: its must visit place who is visiting rishikesh not so special bt the ordinary one else then its religios value.

title: “Himalaya Astrology Bhupendra Sharma - Reiki Healing”
review: Bhupendra is the real deal! I have been to other Reiki healers all over the world, and Bhupendra is by far the most effective.  His beautiful soul and calming presence shine through immediately.  His Reiki treatments allowed me to release a lot of tension and toxicity stored in my body.  I recommend him to all my friends who are traveling to India, and to those who seek his online services.  We still keep in touch and when I return to India, I will definitely return for another treatment and to say hello to a blessed soul!

title: The View Of Ganga From Laxman Jhulla
review: The view of Ganga River from laxman jhula is amazing . The famous hanging bridge across Ganga river.

title: awesome place
review: nice place for yoga & maditation. weather is also nice in winter sission and all cafes and hotels nearby the bridge.

title: The most beautiful place in Rishikesh!
review: This is by far the most beautiful place to visit in Rishikesh. This place offers mesmerizing view of the Ganges underneath and the winters there are lovely.

title: If you are in Rishikesh you should not miss this place!
review: Do not miss the market near the Lakshmi Jhula.  You can buy nice clothes at cheap prices. Bargain hard as the shopkeepers hype the prices looking at tourists.  There are also some really nice cafes near Lakshman Jhula.

title: Good
review: It was a good experience. It has good restaurants near by (on the parking area road) where you will find fresh and very reasonable food.

title: Must visit of Rishikesh
review: If you are in Rishikesh, this place is a must visit. Walk among the narrow lanes to get there is fun. The moment you step on this bridge, you can see ganges passing by fron both the sides. Almost enitire Rishikesh is visible from here. There are lots of monkeys jumping around in here. While walking you just have to sometimes be careful about the speeding bikers.

title: Heritage Sites & a must Visit
review: A small  area within Rishikesh about 5-6  km from the main Market.  Technically its a suspension bridge connecting the two banks of river ganges! The bridge is always crowded with people taking pictures and Langur monkeys( always looking to snatch something or the others from the passers by)! The langurs are smart & often return the stuff in exchange for food!( I experienced the same myself)

title: Heritage site - poor maintenance
review: It is really sad to see such beautiful historical place like Laxman Jhoola, is poorly maintained. The approach road is broken,dirty, filthy, no dust been around. Stairs broken and unclean. Were really disappointed. How can you attract Tourists to such places. The restaurants around the places were also average.

title: Over hyped
review: There are a 1000 people standing on it with 3-4 cows trying to make their way through the crowd. Makes one wonder whats to special about this

title: Must Go
review: If you are going to Rishikesh you should visit Laxman Jhula. It takes only 10 minutes. You will have nice view of ganga and very good place for photography.

title: One of the must see places in Rishikesh
review: One can take an auto (cheaper option) from Haridwar and visit this awesome place. One should tell the driver after reaching laxman jhula that to wait near ram jhula. cross the mighty Ganga by laxman jhula, go to another side and come upto Ram jhula and cross again for your auto. On the way you can catch the glimpse of real rishikesh

title: You Gotta Do It
review: A previous reviewer asked, "What's so special about a 1000 people standing on a bridge with three or four cows trying to make their way through".  Well, if you can't understand based on that description, you never will.  He forgot to add that there will also be numerous motor scooters trying to cross at the same time. And, don't forget the monkeys making their way across.

title: An antic experience
review: Nice experience of walking over the Ganges  while on this bridge but is too congested and have to take care while crossing as two wheelers also cross across ghis btidge along with hordes of people.

title: Always great
review: Stand in the middle for sometime and enjoy the way this bridge swings. great place to stand on top of the Ganges. Never like people feeding fishes and throwing the waste on this narrow bridge.

title: A Swing in True Sense
review: This is one of the two cable stay walk bridges in Rishikesh.

title: One of the key attraction in Rishikesh
review: This place has not changed much from my last visit almost 6-7 years back. The jhoola is used by all, cows, buffaloes, monkeys, motorists and humans to cross to the other side, so a unique experience. There is a car parking stand & then you need to walk to the jhoola. There is a nice chat wala at the end of the Jhoola, pretty good chat is served by him.

title: Beautiful crossing over the holy ganges
review: If you visit Rishikesh you must go across Laksman Jhoola, it's has such a beautiful view of the Ganges and the ghats. You can see the mountain ranges in the background.  However it is a very busy bridge, the constant hooting of mopeds and bikes can drive you mad but you have to set that aside and take in the view.  Half way across you can buy fish food to drop into the Ganges and you will see shoals of fish rise to the surface to eat your offerings, I've never seen that before!

title: Superb utility
review: This jhula helps you connect on two parts of rishikesh separated by mighty ganga. You can take your bike their but not car.

title: A unique bridge - Not just a landmark
review: Whenever one goes to Rishikesh, it's extremely unlikely that one will miss the most visited Laxman Jhula. It is undoubtedly an identity of the place itself. However, it is not just any other bridge, it is an experience in itself. it is a huge wire suspended bridge with a very narrow passage but allows not only pedestrians but also two-wheelers. It is an old bridge but a safe one with a long history to it. The best way to experience it is definitely in the early mornings or late night when there is very little or no traffic on the bridge. Just go at the exact middle, feel the winds blowing along with the bridge swinging and witness the swiftly flowing Ganges below your feet. The setting is complemented by the green hills banking the river, huge boulders and the ubiquitous temples. Laxman Jhula is an experience worth having not just a bridge that connects two sides.

title: superb structure over ganga
review: very old and superb structure over ganga. after 2013 flash-flood this bridge was almost spilled over with water but not such real damage happened. You can have an auto or car to cover all this places from rishikesh.

title: Wow!
review: A great experience that you must absolutely see and cross. A real authentic Indian experience amongst the crowds, motorbikes along a cramped space over a flowing river. Great photo opps!

title: Moving Bridge
review: This is the first metallic rope bridge made over ganga way back when people have not even heard about this technology at such places. People use to refer it as Moving bridge due to the suspension caused by metallic ropes while moving over it or crossing it. It is most famous name in Rishikesh.

title: An Experience!
review: Almost always crowded with tourists, pilgrims, annoying honking motorcycles and curious monkeys. It is a fun place to be. Great views.

title: HERITAGE SITE - LAXMAN JHOOLA AND RAM JHOOLA
review: Must visit in Rishikesh. Not to miss the evening sunset time Ganga Aarti. Driving from Rishikesh side is a bit cumbersome because of the parking issues but a good option is to drive along the opposite side of the river and park and walk around. Couple of options to cross either at the barrage near to the AIIMS or at Ram Jhoola Bridge. Lovely view of the river and the Ganga Aarti. There is a German bakery right on top overlooking - though now a great place to eat, but ok to chill

title: A great experience
review: The lakshman jhula connecting the two banks of the Ganga offers a unique experience.It is a great wire suspended bridge with a narrow passage.walking on this bridge with lots of people animals and two wheelers is an experience in itself.The view from this bridge is great with the Ganga flowing below and the huge mountains on either side with so many temples all around. Best time to go would be early mornings when the traffic will be minimal and you can hear the sound of the water flowing

title: Cool shopping nearby
review: Busy bridge, watch for monkeys, motorcycles and cows. Nice shops nearby and the German bakery is our favorite

title: Best little corner of my Indian experience
review: I'll call this "Best little corner of my Indian experience" because it's adventurous in the outdoorsy way if you want, spiritual if you want, delicious if you want (no I take that back - you can't control the deliciousness)  and materialistic if you want.

title: Best view from...to see river gangs
review: This just a bridge with whole lot disturbance with two wheelers crossing. But also amazing view of gangs.must see if u r travelling to rishikesh

title: Awesome View of Ganga
review: Visited the place with my family. View of the river Ganga is awesome. The bridge remains crowded with motorcycles, monkeys, cows. There are is a very good temple located on the opposite side of the river.

title: Spiritual campus and traveller hangout
review: Laxman Jhula and adjoining Tapovan offer all sorts of traveller hangouts and accomodation, mostly moderately priced. An excellent base for attending lectures ("satsangs") of a variety of the worlds best spiritual teachers from January to April each year: Mooji in near-ba Rishikesh, Prem Baba and Shantimayi in Saccha Dham Ashram, Atmajyoti-Ma in Aranya-Kutir in Tapovan. There are more. In addition you are welcome to attend religious services and rites, yoga-classes etc. Mostly on donation basis. Many yoga-teacher institutes.  - any amount of all kinds and categories of traveller hangouts, guest houses. A dip in the wonderfully clear clean cold Ganges is mandatory!

title: Beautiful views from center of bridge
review: Bridge over the ganges, good picture scene, lots of traffic on busy days, tourist all standing around  westerners still an attraction. Beware of monkees and motorcycles

title: Always a good experience but it needs maintenance
review: Crossing the holy Ganges through Lakshman Jhoola is an unique experience. Feeling the cold breeze and watching the beautiful Ganges and the strong mountains and numerous ghats along the Ganges os really a wonderful delight. But the experience is marred by the use of the jhoola by bikers and other two wheelers riders. It should be declared a no bike bridge..allowing only the walkers to enhance the experience. The jhoola road needs repair as there  are many potholes along the way..

title: Too many motorised two wheelers
review: Too many motorised two wheelers on the Laxman Jhula are an irritant and a risk to visitors who want to enjoy being on the bridge.

title: Family visit
review: Very nice place, one should visit ;this is connect to one side to another opposite side there is beautiful shiva temple, at 7th floor very beautiful Lord shiva statue.

title: Laxman jula
review: Old iconic engineering to connect both shore of city Rishikesh ... It was made for people to connect but not become attraction for people and Comming to Rishikesh

title: go for the view and calmness to feel at heart
review: When u in hrishikesh must go.

title: Must see in rishikesh
review: When you are visiting Rishikesh this place is should be on your visiting list.Spend some time on jhula and take a mesmerizing view of river Ganga.

title: Another Must See Landmark of Rishikesh
review: This Jhula (bridge) is located a short distance away from Ram Jhula. It is not as long as Ram Jhula.  The bridge is narrow and sways in the wind. Be careful of the Motorcycles that are allowed to ply on the bridge. Good place for photography. A number of temples on the other side. One can keep 2 hours or so for this site alongwith visit to the temples.

title: so n so ok
review: Well, to see it's just a normal bridge.It's more or less a footbridge with the occasional scooter and motorbikes

title: Ok to visit
review: I visited laxman jhula as i have heard about it a lot. Haven't found anything unique. It was very congested. Bikes, cycles were also going on there.

title: Beautiful in night
review: Laxman jhula has a mythological history that's why it is specia. But it's beautiful in the night with lovely breeze. It's a different experience altogether and quite unique. One must visit it once for the feel of it..

title: interesting and beatifull
review: Very beautiful you must visit! A lot of restaurant near, lot of hostel and a lot to do in rishikesh! you have to visit this beautiful and holly city!

title: An awesome experience!
review: The Laxman Jhula really swings! its about 6' wide,crowded with people and two wheelers coming from both directions.An experience worth having.

title: An Average Place
review: A place that connects city with holy temple on river Ganga provides nice "shaky" experience in the middle. Very crowded and two wheeler are also allowed which makes life difficult.

title: FANTASTIC
review: Seen earlier in photos.Great experience after seeing.taken many photographs.But 2 wheeler should not be allowed there . Also feed food to fishes in the river Ganges.

title: hanging
review: A suspension bridge over Ganga...The view of the parallel mountains, clear stream of Ganga, river rafting all are eye-soothing

title: mesmerizing
review: Let  calm and serenity prevail over you. Wonderful place, great view of Ganga river. especially beautiful in winters and non-Monsoonal seasons.

title: Nice location to see the fish and feed them from Top
review: It's a kind of bridge which keeps swinging as people cross from one end to the other. On has to go towards Rishikesh to see this jhula.  When you are on this swinging bridge you can feed the fish in the river below. Kids will be around with some food in their hand which they sale for around Rs. 10. You can see big fishes jumping to eat the food given to them from above. Nice view and good place

title: Good place
review: Good place , lot of Yoga avenues, but only for foreigners ...Shops are very expensive and Shopkeepers are hostile to Indians because they do bargain :D

title: The first bridge across the Ganga
review: It's always fun to walk across this suspension bridge, just be careful for the motorcycles and monkeys (hold on to your bags). Very popular place for group photos.

title: Cool place to stay and hang out at
review: Laxman Jhula is in the main tourist area and one of my favourite areas in the Rishikesh city. There is a bridge that connects it to the other side of the river and you can take your motorbike across the bridge. You have to share the bridge with foot pedestrians so take care because some people are careless stopping and taking photos with complete disregard to the motorbikes. I would recommend to stay on the side with the main road as there is easy access to all areas then and you aren't constrained.

title: Divine feeling in rishikesh
review: Laxman jhula is tourist hub in town but cleanliness must be done in and around jhula nice view of river ganga from this suspension bridge

title: Laxman Jhula disappoints mainly due to administrative failures
review: Laxman Jhula is almost synymous with Rishikesh. So although we were in little mood to budge out of our cosy perches at Ganga Resort.. step out we did.. only to return with disappointed. The onward journey in an auto was okay at around RS 10-15 per head. The auto driver failed to direct us to the place and we were left negotiating througha  maze of concrete modern day structures which claimed to pay obeisance to some dinities. Long winding paths and a very steep climb down later we still could not see any jhula and were almost wondering whther we had come to the wrong place. Further directions later we land at the place only to find cows, humans and two wheeler jostling for space at a spot that mour epics say mark a 5000 year-old heritage. Some phtoo shoots later we left and were surprised to find a lovely road that brough us up to the main highway after a 15-20 minute walk. No more steep climbs ro dirty lanes. Just keep tyour right.  Laxman Jhula was a disappointment.

title: Laxman Jhula
review: It is  very old bridge on Ganga river. It is build up with steel ropes. it is take movement by air is came. we was walked on this zhula. it is amazing experience.

title: Just a normal 🌉
review: The bridge is made on suspension technology which was very rare at the time of its built so it may fascinate. The bumping feeling of the bridge while small vehicles pass by may be a good experience. In parallel there is ram jhula also near about 2 km far.

title: The art of creating
review: The Jhula was made about 90 years back. It is as good as new one.It is really a Jhula. Whenever scooter are moving on the road it is shaking.

title: Over celebrated
review: Over celebrated, always full and buzzling so you can't be a road block trying to take photos. Up close it doesn't look as great as on photos either. Good view over the Ganges, mountains and nearby temples though.

title: Lots of Monkey in @6am
review: Early Morning watching ganga from laxman julha was a good experience, It was a misty morning and the beautiful river flowing from mountains was magical.

title: Must see :)
review: One of two famous bridges in Rishikesh. Monkeys, people, cows, bikes and motorcycles - all gathered in one place :)

title: Wonderful history
review: Awesome weather, beautiful divine place.  Just a place for spiritual reasons.  Devote yourself when your there.  Lots of history close to Shiva.  Nature is very partial when you see Rishikesh and other places.

title: Extremely crowded and poorly maintained place
review: We had a bad experience at Laxman Jhula, The place was extremely crowded and poorly managed, there are no rules here. People are walking from both directions. Cow was sitting on the narrow road leaving little space for anything else. 2- wheelers are allowed in the path packed with people. You miss the whole beauty of the place in such chaos. This beautiful place has lost its charm due to the poor management of the administration.

title: busy place
review: the most busy place in town, lots of restaurant around this place. Awesome view and enjoy the aarti at the nearby ghats

title: Recommended
review: Amazing bridge across a sacred river in a mysterious and beautiful country...good walking experience full of life's diverse people

title: Beautiful
review: It will be better if you just sit near the shores and behold the bridge, mountains and temples. Very serene and holy.

title: Beautiful  suspension bridge
review: build over the river ganaga this  suspension bridge is lanmark of Rishikesh and view of river is excellent from the bridge.

title: Simply heaven
review: Laxman jhula is a place where u can see clouds almost on the ganges .... i love laxman jhula its so bfullll....

title: It's a different world all together
review: Holy place with first jeepable Suspension Bridge of U.P. Lot of temples on the other side of the bridge. Also visit the German bakery at the beginning of the bridge.

title: Beautiful place that makes you feel special and spiritual
review: I have been then only once, but I can feel the vibe..the spirituality just at the look of the environment around. It was a bit chilly weather in November and it was fun sitting beside a bonfire at night. I had heard so many stories about the walk from the bridge to the temple from my grandparents, which i could feel have relived their lives as i went past through the hundreds of retailers on the side of the road leading to the temple. We  witnessed the evening aarti, which really gives you the awesome feeling.. a feeling that makes you think that everything in life will be fine.

title: A Must Visit @ Rishikesh
review: One of the most popular tourist spot at Rishikesh, the views at this place are great, there are various shops which offer various souvenirs that can be purchased, also you can book river rafting trips which is offered by many...after you cross the bridge you can visit many temples like Tera Manzil etc.

title: It's a good place. Must visit.
review: It was a great time at laxman jhula, however it's similar to ram jhula. But i like both ones. Must visit this place.

title: Great
review: Great experience.

title: Needs management
review: It's a serene sight.

title: Star Attraction
review: This is one of two suspension bridges at Rishikesh - the other being the Ram jhula. The mythology aside, this is quite a serene place to look out from. Albeit, the bridge is quite busy with people, motorbikes and bovine poop machines, you can find your comfort spot and enjoy the vista while the bridge gently swings - hence, the term 'jhula' I guess.

title: Laxman Jhula
review: Rishikesh means Ram and Laxman Jhula one must visit. Ganges can be sighted from this Jhula very nicely.

title: Easy hiking and good views
review: It's located right along the Ganga (Ganges) and you can actually cross the river here (using the quite impressive footbridge). Hiking is also good and you can easily walk to two pretty waterfalls nearby, one on each side of the river. Don't fall prey to taxi drivers and guides when visiting the waterfalls - both are within walking distance.

title: Top spot
review: One of the busiest tourist spots in a town. Nice place to take pictures and feed the monkeys. Best walking after dark when the brige is empty.

title: A bit overraterd
review: This location is a bit over rated but no doubt its a one time visit with many attractions close by like the temple on the end of the jhula, the choti wala restaurants. This place is good to visit in the day time be here by 8 am so that you dont feel the heat and all the visiting is complete by 11

title: Great Example Of Engineering
review: If you want to feel the magic of Ganges and Nature then you must visit Laxman Jhula and rishikesh...

title: Time waste
review: I am not sure, but I did not like the place, the bridge was crowdy as   two wheelers were allowed on the bridge.

title: Over hyped !
review: Have been to this place a couple of times. It's just a bridge like many in Uttarakhand.

title: Laxman Jhula - a nice footbridge
review: Without getting too excited about the location - Laxman Jhula is a footbridge where motorcycles also tear across in the typical suicidal way in which India practices traffic control.

title: "Super View of Rishikesh"
review: Nice palace to visit here ....for photography & feel the beauty of River GANGA.....and  Rishikesh....

title: Must visit on any Rishikesh itinerary
review: This is the older of the suspension bridges in Rishikesh. A wonderful engineering achievement. Walk across it takes you to the other bank of the Ganges. Here you have got couple of 9 storey temples which are very beautiful. A helpful tip - Beware of monkeys on this bridge! And never try to feed them...

title: Photo perfect area ..
review: Really a nice place .. if you are visiting rishikesh.. this is a place you must visit .. it is a suspension bridge ... when you reach in middle you feel the movement of the bridge coz of wind ... a very nice and awesome view.

title: Laxman Jhula
review: View and heavenly feeling, Paradise on River Ganges and it is divine and mesmerizing when you in middle of bridge and feeling wind on you body

title: Beautiful Rishikesh
review: You must visit the place and cross the river to feel the charm of Laxman Jhula and a spectacular river Ganga. Amazing feeling.

title: I like the view from here best!
review: The area around the Laxman Jhula is calmer than the craziness down by the Ram Jhula, they are both amazing bridges spanning the beautiful River Ganges but I think I prefer the view from here.

title: Nice place
review: Good place to live and meditate. Sit at the banks of holy Ganges and discover yourself. One can many ashrams in and around rishikesh.

title: Lovely place with cafes overlooking Ganga and a good present shopping place
review: Great busy and busty place, full of little shops and cafes where you meet people from around the world. From many of the cafes you get beautiful views over the Ganga river. Great place to buy souvenirs. For cheaper price go to the end of the main road or wander few metres of the main street. AVOID the first 2 weeks of August where milions (literally - there was cca 11 mio pilgrams this year over two weeks) of pilgrams pass here to get the holy water.

title: A must with all sort of transport expect cars
review: Nice bridge with a real feel of the strength of Ganga river. What an experience on the bridge with crowds of people, cows and honking motorbikes... and monkeys always ready to eat your snack.

title: majestic
review: majestic view of all the temples and market  fantastic view of the mountains beyond which lies the chaar dham   kderanath badrinath gangotri etc

title: Shopkeepers Are Shortchanging Foreigners
review: Due to my own experiences, I would like to alert westerners to the fact that many shopkeepers (particularly the ones who cater to foreigners' needs) are not giving the correct change.  Of course, it's always in their favor.  Be aware that the shops on the main (Badrinath) road are the main culprits.

title: Heaven!
review: to stand on the bridge in the evening and feel the breeze flow by is simply great!. An iconic bridge of India!

title: Beautiful!
review: Beautiful view from the bridge to ashrams and temples, also crossing the bridge and the cafe near Ganges river with wifi and a view is nice. Many shops and other cafe's around!

title: Laxman Jhula - Culture meets Religion meets Tourism
review: The laxman Jhula Brighe is the only bridge in the vicinity to cross over from one side to the other. A lot of guesthouses have musroomed around this area as it is considered to be a prime locality with very cheap guesthouses and ashrams which charge peanuts and are running out of dilapidated and old building. The area though is full of different cafes overlooking the ganges. Some of these places serve good food but some just charge for the location as the management keeps changing and they dont know anything about Customer Service. Apart from the crowd there are several Temples amongst which the 13 story temple is the largest and can be visited to see the variety of the Indian Gods. I guess Someone made it to ensure that they don't miss on any opportunity of earning from the huge crowds which come to see the temple as a revered temple.

title: Average place
review: Average place and over crowded. It has lost its glory and significance due to over crowd and traffic miss management.

title: Take a walk in the evenings, its worth it.
review: What can i say about this place. Jhula means swing. And a walk on this bridge is an experience it self. Crowded though but worth it. The view of Ganges is just too good.

title: Crazy and wonderful
review: You really have to cross the Ganges at least once while in Rishikesh, and there's no better way to do it than by way of the Laxman Jhula suspension bridge. It's more or less a footbridge with the occasional scooter and motorbikes, and has its own mad bustling charm, including a subtle but noticeable under-sway. The bridge links Tapovan with the east bank and the ancient Trayambakeshwar temple, and changes mood multiple times a day. In the early mornings, you can stride across, along with a few tinkling donkeys, but at other times you'll find yourself inching your way through the hoards; families taking selfies, mischievous monkeys, locals and Western backpackers. Crossing at peak times is a meditation in agility and patience! I recommend you place yourself directly behind a scooter and try to keep up, so you can use it's 'wake' to cut through the crowds. The view of the Ganges, if you are able to pause for a few moments, is lovely, and the river's breeze can be a welcome respite from the heat. But it's the vista of the Laxman Jhula from neighbouring cafes that are perhaps the most rewarding offering gorgeous photo ops in Rishkesh's changing weather and light. July and August is peak pilgrimage season so you may want to avoid this period if you can.

title: Swinging bridge.
review: It's a small jhoola pul( swinging bridge), in Rishikesh. There r 2 such bridges, out of which, this is older one.

title: The best bridge in rishikesh
review: We regretted why we did not choose a hotel closer to this location as it is a must visit in Rishikesh. The calmness of the river and the breeze is just so refreshing. Lot of eateries and temples to visit around the area.

title: Beautiful ganga
review: If you want to see a clean Ganga river here is the place. Green waters clean enough so you can swim and be blessed. Beautiful views and loads of guest houses and restaurants and yoga classes and whatever more you need.

title: A bridge in the name of Laxman
review: One of the two bridges across river Ganga is revered by Hindus across India. It is named after Laxman brother of Lord Ram. The other one is Ram jhoola. This swinging bridge is fun to walk across to get the the view of river Ganga.

title: the long rope bridge in uttrakhand
review: the location of laxman jhula was good ,in the ganga river theat flow from gangotari glacier,had a very pleasant place

title: Bridge of Memories
review: Well, to see it's just a normal bridge. No special or innovative technology involved.

title: Wonderful attraction
review: This is the main attraction of Rishikesh and plunged by thousands of tourists at any time. Below careful about two wheelers passing on the bridge and add to this moneys sitting everywhere on the bridge.Enjoy the beautiful river flowing underneath the bridge and while crossing, feel the vibration.

title: Bridge to heaven
review: Laxman Jhula epitomized the legacy of Indian Culture....

title: Must Visit place
review: It is a must place to visit at Rishikesh. A hanging bridge which swings when you walk over it, may be frightening for few very weak hearted

title: bad experience
review: The lead in to the jhula was filled with dirt. We personally disliked the bike riders on the jhula. It was a bad experience overall but since it is a holy place it needs more care and cleanliness

title: Must experience by walking through it
review: The bridge connects two sides of Rishikesh. Only walk and 2 wheelers allowed to cross. There is a huge rush in evening on the bridge and you have to be careful if you are on foot. However the experiance of walking through this bridge was awsome. It shakes a bit when you are in middle.

title: Feel the breeze of the Ganges spectacular view!
review: Must cross to feel the breeze of the Ganges the view is amazing .  On a Sunday it can get crowded with local tourism but during the week is calm, take selfie but watch out for motorcycles! this is Rishikesh!

title: Fun and Chaotic
review: Its a must place to visit if you are in Rishikesh. Its crazy and chaotic on the weekends, but fun! Be careful with all the bikers crossing thru the bridge.

title: Calm and Relaxed
review: One of the most beautiful places in India,

title: Cafe Dr goa
review: Cafe Dr go a near laxman jhula bridge rishikesh Himalayan imagination view and peace pleasant staying

title: River crossing
review: Laxman jhula build in the name of Lord Laxman. This jhula has a beautiful view. Crossing the river gangs from this bridge or jhula is just a pleasurable moment.

title: Experiencing once is enough
review: Would be a great place to see if we remove the crowd.. The way this narrow bridge is crowded and bikes and scooters keep on honking and trying to cross everyone, the entire excitement of being on Laxman Jhula goes off. Still one should see and experience it once at least. Would recommend to go in off hours like night if you really want to cherish the experience...

title: The commercial side of spirituality
review: Laxman Jhula is where spirituality is peddled to tourists. It is a vibrant part of Rishikesh with lots of yoga studios, reiki classes, massage parlours, ayurveda treatment centers etc. So if you are into those things head to Laxman jhula.

title: VERY CROWDY, VERY NOISY, CHAOS
review: Chaos all round..... nature lovers please AVOID this place..... those who want to disrupt peace well this is the place of your liking.... all others please visit Ramjhula which is still much quieter than this one.... beauty both side is good but you will be in no mood to enjoy that as you have to be aware of collision, pick-pockets, monkeys & beggars.....

title: Great Laxman Jhula
review: Amazing build old structure where you can see hell lot of peoples, cows , passers and bike riders. It feels good to enjoy the serenity of this place in early morning due to cool weather.

title: Nice consturction
review: if you are going to rishikesh then should visit to Laxman jhula. Nice view from this jhula. and you can hear the sound of water and can see the speed of ganga.

title: Laxmanjhulla Rishikesh .....
review: We have visit laxmanjhulla during our trip to Rishikesh. It is very nice and has historical value. Nearby laxman jhulla we have visited thirteen stories temple.

title: a bridge over the mighty ganges
review: Laxman jhula as seen from atop is a busy crossing to go across the mighty Ganges. Beware of the monkeys ready to snatch any food if not carefully.

title: Holy cow!
review: Just a bridge over the ganges, lots of people, gangs of monkeys who snatch anything that looks like food, a couple of lazy cows that just sit there come what may. Just what one might expect in a religious town like Rishikesh.

title: Totally Picturesque!!!
review: The view of the Ganges from the bridge is amazing and the walk on the bridge is altogether a different experience!!!

title: The landmark of Rishikesh
review: This is the best known landmark of Rishikesh . Across the mighty river Ganga this bridge serves the both sides of the banks . There are a few tourist attractions here - usual shops selling local handicrafts . Generally busy . Be careful about the parking .  There is local Chotiwala - an eatery which serves good veg . meal if you here for lunch

title: a disappointment...
review: it is now completely ruined. it is as it is a narrow bridge and you are literally jostled around, as two wheelers are allowed on the bridge and if you dont watch where you are going, u have had it. there is no chance of leisurely standing and watching the Ganga, as the crowd will prevent you from doing that.

title: Must visit place in rishikesh
review: Best time to visit is early morning where you can enjoy the calmness of ganga river.If you go after 8a.m the sun will not show mercy on you neither the motorists. So go early and enjoy your time.

title: Very nice
review: One should must go to Laxman Jhula while going to Rishikesh and Haridwar. It is an old jhula but reminds the technology using to cross the big rivers like Ganga. Need to keep it clean by Govt. agencies and by ourselves too.

title: Never miss it
review: When you are in Rishikesh, you should pass through the LaxmanJhula and spend some time in this bridge , see the surrounding areas, Its unbelievable and it will give you a great peace of mind, if possible see it before sunset and then witness the Ganga Arti darshan.  A great relaxation.

title: Ek visit to banta h
review: Nice place (jhula too) with its strong historical backing. Feels good to be on running river with this peculiar bridge. Cool breeze and running water somehow brings positivity and happiness along.

title: Can be avoided
review: Nothing much. Not quite an attraction. The place is very crowded too. not worth the visit. can easily be avoided

title: Beautiful view!
review: It is the old bridge. Earlier the bridge used to swing now it has been made strong and maintained. Now it doesn't swing much.

title: Historical Significance
review: Laxman Jhula as the name suggest is a Jhula (Sanskrit) or a Bridge across the Ganges in Rishikesh, India.

title: More famous of the twin bridges
review: This is the more famous amongst the twin bridges over river Ganga at Rishikesh.

title: Crowded
review: It does not look a tourist attraction at all as the local vehicles crossing the Jhula create nuisance, you can not stand there without fear of being hit by someone.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Laxman Jhula in Rishikesh is a bridge which do not have any support in the middle and is hanging on ropes. So it also swings a little like a swing(jhula). The area after bridge is full of restaurants Indian Russian Italian all sort of food available here. Also has attraction of 14 storey temple. And market with clothes and wooden crafts and many things available there. Many restaurants have beautiful river view.

title: Get Rid of the Scooters and Motorbikes, Please!
review: Like many places in India.  The leap into the 21st century comes with challenges.  A big one is what to do with the swarms of two wheeled vehicles that swarm every possible pathway in every city and village.  Remarkably, this includes Laxman Jhula historic foot bridge that spans the holy Ganga and joins one side of Rishikesh with the other.  It can't be more that six feet wide, and, to allow motorized bikes and scooters to cross on it is just plain silly.  Who is in charge of this town?   And, why do they allow this nonsense?

title: Have a look around laxman Julla with India Magical Trip
review: Further upstream from Ram Jhula is the point where Lord Rama's brother Laxman is believed to have crossed the Ganges on a jute rope. Today, Laxman Jhula, another suspension bridge very similar to Ram Jhula, affords an easier crossing. Laxman Jhula is a 450 feet long suspension bridge and was built in 1939 by british. This bridge worked as a source of inspiration for the design of newly build Ram Jhula by indian architects and designers. If Ram Jhula is associated with the earnest worship with its cluster of ashrams. Laxman Jhula is the centre for good times with its bazaars and crowded cafes. The view from the cafes overlooking the jhula - temples, bathing ghats, prayer flags and strips of clean, sandy beaches lining the river - is inspiring.

title: Travel for advanture trip
review: By traveling to Haridwar to rishikesh we had seen laxman jhula and it was good experience to  pass it in rainy days

title: technology at its best.......
review: best experienced during wind & storm, it really feels aaaamazing when the entire bridge is high on winds.

title: The Laxman Jhula
review: It is a pain to visit this well known place . Walked from the hotel where we were staying in Rishikesh [ one km away from laxman Jhula ]

title: Good place for refting
review: Lakshman Jhula is one of the excellent place though it was overcrowded on the day when I visited the place with family. Localities told that this is because of last weekend before the schools in north India would open. Good place for rafting as well. Several tourism companies are providing rafting services

title: A special place in Rishikesh
