review: Laxman Jhula is a special neighborhood in the city of Rishikesh.It's called like this because of the bridge over Ganga River. But it's much more than this.It's one of the cleanest spots in the city and has special places for bathing and eating. It's the preferred place for the Yoga schools and practices and the river murmur is highly appropriate for meditation. It has many temples, but also many shops where you can buy japamalas of stones, statues of deities and jewelry.The Honey Hut is a very good cafe where ocidental people meet, but also the indian restaurants serve very good and cheap food.

title: Just a jhula, quite commonplace in Uttarakhand
review: I visited Rishikesh when i was a boy. All this time back when i visited again, it looked quite small.

title: swing walk
review: Laxman jhula has its own importance in rishikesh. The view of GANGA from the Laxman jhula is very nice and pleasant.

title: Historical bridging
review: Though built in 1928, the suspension bridge still stands proudly helping thousands of locals to walk across the Ganges.There are also lakhs of tourists who go to visit this mighty bridge as well.What is disheartening is the numerous bikes and scooties which the locals use on the bridge.They almost run u down.Since this is a bridge of national heritage,such two wheelers should not be allowed on it. This bridge should be preserved and be something to be proud of.Even if local authorities cannot keep the surroundings and roads leading to it clean,at least keep the bridge lanes free for people to walk and enjoy the view of the Ganges which is so quiet and mighty below the bridge.

title: Marvelous attraction of Rishikesh
review: When you go there must go to this place. This is one of the major attraction of Rishikesh. The bridge swings when you cross the same. This is over river Ganga, when on the bridge you can view Ganga river both side, offer food to Fishes ( available on sale there ) .Beware of Monkeys, some times money comes on bridge.

title: Wonderful and sad all at once!
review: Parts of Rishikesh are wonderful but others are awful with run down buildings, filth, and very poor sad people but really that's India all over.

title: Heart of rishikesh
review: Nice view, narrow bridge with a donkey behind you and a motor bike fighting for space in front of you. Get the picture? Must cross if you are around and there is a lot of stuff to buy or places to eat nearby. It's a bit shaky which adds to the experience.

title: One Time Visit
review: Must Go. One of the major attraction of Rishikesh and bridge swings when you cross it. Shops and people everywhere and taxi booth on one side of the bridge. A few temples around, and a lot of stores/shops. Full of life and culture.

title: Fun
review: It's fun to visit this jhula....surrounded by lofty Hills and below the mighty ganga takes ur breath away.....a mesmerizing visit...it gives goosebumps when the jhula sways

title: Laxman Jhulla is one of the attraction at Rishikesh
review: Laxman Jhulla is one of the attraction at Rishikesh for tourist. It is smaller than Ram Jhulla Like Ram and Laxman belongs to Ramayana. Market nearby this place are good specifically Gems shops are nice.

title: Crowded
review: The hanging bridge made ages ago is not really an interesting site to see. It is heavily crowded with motorbikes also trying to make their way through the narrow bridge.  The view of Ganges is great, but there are many other spots in Rishikesh where it is more peaceful.

title: Massages GALORE!!
review: A very busy and bustling area with array of massage and spa treatment facilities. Also , the area to hire and book the river rafting tours and adventures.

title: Worth a walk
review: At Rishikesh one can not miss the experience of talking a walk on the Ram and Laxman Jhullas.

title: Must experience
review: As soon as you step on the bridge you feel wow with wind in your face and bridge hanging there u feel on top of the world and can see how big is the ganges

title: its a bridge
review: its a bridge.. across the river ganga. its a good to see all the scenery on it. it is in so height on the river. we can see all the rating boats from it.

title: Beautiful
review: Well you can't say much about a bridge !

title: Lovely surrounding
review: German café great place to eat at, and a lovely bookstore beside it. Cows could stand on the bridge so be careful when passing, and for the sneaky mokeys that steals... :))

title: Pleasant!
review: The name is on the younger brother of Lord Ram from the Hindu Mythology, Lord Laxman. It is one of the most pleasant walk in Rishikesh. Just stretches for a bit more than 100 meters. It is one of the few 'Hanging" bridges in the country.

title: Nice Site
review: one should not miss crossing the Ganga flowing below. The breeze is amazing on the Laxman Jhula. The temples around are a good time to visit in early morning or in the evening.

title: The symbol of Rishikesh
review: Laxman jhula is the main tourist attraction of the city. It's an old structure which is impressive but has aged and needs maintenance. There is number of photography options nearby. There is a small make place through which one can reach the main structure. Shops are selling worship material, cloths, local art effects etc and one needs to bargain hard for a good price. There are traditional Indian food options available but only vegetarian. On both sides of the river Ganga there are numerous small and big temples which are full of devotees.

title: Great view
review: Passed the bridge from under while rafting in river. We were a point of attraction for the walkers on the bridge who were taking photos of us.

title: Excellent Hanging Bridge
review: Laxman Jhula is one of the main attractions in Rishikesh. The walk through it over Ganga is picturesque and offers many photo opportunities.There are many temples on the way and also shps to shop around.The best time to visit is in the evenings.

title: Breath taking view
review: This is a must visit place while u up for some river rafting in rishikesh. really u can take some amazing pictures , just loved standing on it for hours

title: Walk to Remember!!!
review: Iconic symbol of rishikesh.. laxman jhula is marvelous, the walk on bridge is beautiful and scenic!! Its an experience in itself!! Enjoy the view of mountains and river ganga flowing through it! the view of ghats and temples along the river... the walk along the bridge is relaxing!! must visit.

title: A rocking experince
review: The view across is breathtaking and the bridge actually vibrates, true to its name. A must visit and convenient route to go on the other side of Rishikesh. Although the speeding two wheelers on the bridge can be a bit of nuisance sometimes.

title: Enjoyable Walk with Beautiful Scenary
review: One of the two suspended bridges crossing the Ganges in Rishikesh. Although designed for foot traffic, do not be surprised to find scooters, monkeys and cows on the bridge. Early morning walk is great to avoid traffic. Plenty of vendors on either side.

title: Laxman Jhula
review: The Bridge is a masterpiece and brings upon a nice feeling while walking across the bridge looking at the beautiful natural scenery all around and the river below flowing at a rapid pace.

title: nice view and lots of monkeys....
review: view of ganga river was very nice...one feels vibration as you step at jhula...river rafting was also there...many monkeys were there...feeling afraid of them...but enjoyed a lot...

title: nothing much
review: this is just a bridge across the river. and its very crowded. frankly we didn't get why it's so famous. good for an evening stroll, i guess, thats all. the view of ganga is nothing compared to the experience you can get at a camp.

title: Very good
review: Should visit once. Same as Ram Jhula

title: Be careful........... your ancestors waiting
review: Nice place to be ....but be careful of monkeys sitting on the railing ready to snatch your belongings from hand ...so mobile in pocket and other valuables in car.

title: Nice location
review: Lakshman Jhula is one of the main attractions in Rishikesh. It is an iron bridge constructed across River Ganga. It has a host of temples surrounding it.

title: Nothing worth mentioning
review: A simple cable bridge with no story to tell around it . 500 people at one time on the bridge along with bikes and scooters . I am sorry I do not it charming and worth a visit .Rishikesh is only meant for yoga at some ashram or adventure stuff like rafting , bungee or flying fox . Anything apart from this needs to be managed better

title: Good but crowded
review: The bridge is really spectacular, but the approach and the congested area around creates a dampener of an effect. Must vist place, but something needs to be done to control the traffic around.

title: amazing wind
review: i remember  the evenings on laxman jhula... just stand in the middle of it on a windy day and feel the wind tearing through with the river flowing underneath you.. this place gives you peace  a must visit in rishikesh

title: Great shopping!
review: Oh I so love this place! great shopping and just so fun to walk around and see everything! You can find all kinds of cool clothes, jewelry, Indian art! So much!

title: Two wheelers spil the fun
review: This Jhula and Ram Jhula is a nice walk on the river. Our main complaint or what put us off was the incessant 2-wheelers that were allowed to cross - even though it is not legal to do so. I wonder why we are waiting for a mishap to occur, with children, old people being stunned with these speedy two-wheelers driving as if they have a blatant right of way. The administration is just too casual to allow this to happen, right under their noses.

title: The bridge, the area
review: When I crossed Laxman Jhula recently, there were monkeys all along both sides of the "pedestrian" bridge, perched nicely at just the height to grab a bag or treat, if a passerby held something. Entertaining if you're not the one startled, or watching the monkey climbing upward with your passport bag. There are dozens of shops, small winding alleys, and good places to eat on both sides of the bridge. It's fun to sit in the German Bakery with a chai and cinnamon roll and watch the bridge traffic. Their veggie sizzler plate is very good--a patty made of bread and veggies, rather like Thanksgiving bread stuffing, and roasted potatoes. Nice if you want a little break from rice.

title: Nice visit
review: Not for aged people though, since you have to get down stairs and walk across the jhula. A narrow bridge with rafters crossing it from below. Place to have a group photo. Go down to the ganga through steps/ rocky stretch to find Clean Ganges. Small fishes are swimming in the river, which flock near you if you offer them food. Go for the motor boating with proper safety attires and you will enjoy the ride.

title: The bridge with a tale...
review: Walk at the centre of the bridge to discover the rel thrill.

title: RIVER BELOW BRIDGE HIGH
review: Was curious to come here as everyone use to mention this in their must visit list..... Had to walk a lot to reach here as our vechicle was Parked at a distance... But it was worth it, as its an amazing place... The view is simply awesome... Must visit if you are in rishikesh..

title: Chaotic crossing on the Ganges!
review: only 4-5 feet wide, bridge was built in about 1920s, so people were using boats as means of transport to move from one bank to the other. but within a short span of 100 years, this bridge has become  main thoroughfare of the town. bullock, dogs, cows, cycles, tricycles, push carts, hand carts, people and 2 Wheeler riders use this bridge with impunity. in fact the 2 wheeler riders honk so much and in so loud, that within 2 minutes your eardrums will shatter because of noise pollution!

title: Rishikest Holidays
review: Nice feeling to walk on this old bridge. Narrow width carrying human as well as two wheeler traffic. It is wonderful experience to see Ganga Flowing below with bridge swinging (though very little)

title: Most visited place in Rishikesh
review: This is one of the most visited place by tourists in rishikesh. A suspension bridge situated over the Ganga river, the place is photoready and the other bank of the river is scenic. A walk on the other side is a walk to remember.

title: Amazing place, good view
review: Okay, so I wasnt very sure of going here but now that i have i would recommend going to the Laxman Jhula.

title: Must Visit Place
review: I visit the Place in early night and environment & ambiance was quite spiritual. It was most amazing feeling which i cn't express in words.

title: one time visit
review: Good Creation. Nice engineering . Feel the vibration once you pass through it. Its normal bridge on the ganga river . Similar to Ram jhula. Near by you can find local market with some good restaurants .

title: Chaotic - yet strangely calming
review: Laxman Jhula especially at night is  a very unique experience. Cows lazing peacefully, crazy motorbikes weaving their way at breakneck speed,  people of all colour and nationalities, from saffron robed sadhus with long matted hair to hippies from various corners of the world congregating in search of peace- you will find them all on this narrow hanging bridge swaying  gently over one of the countries holiest rivers. Temples and narrow lanes dotted with myriad shops and cafes flank both sides of this bridge. I would normally run miles away from such chaos, but strangely the experience here was  calming and spiritual - amazing.

title: On Lakshman Jhula surrounded by nature
review: This well known landmark of Rishikesh is a nice place to  visit, even if one is not religious minded. One has from the bridge top an excellent view of the Ganges, the boats  with enthusiastic people enjoying the ride and swimming along with the boats.

title: excellent location
review: monkey problem is there you have to be cautious while carrring the food items or fruits.but bridge is huge and well located

title: Nothing out of the ordinary
review: It is a simple suspension bridge on the Ganges and there is nothing out of the ordinary about it. Of course the Gita Bhavan and Ashrams at the edn of bridge is worth a quick visit and the launch srevice across the river can be exciting for small kids. There are shops too for quick shopping for souveneirs. One can also see the Ganga Aarti at the Ghats here

title: Cool place to hang out
review: It is one of the great place in Rishikesh to stroll in the evening. I would say winters is the best time to stroll and have fun eating chats or street food near Jhula.

title: Wonderful place to just sit and chill
review: The Laxman Jhula is only supposed to be for pedestrians. But two-wheelers ply freely. Yoou can just sit there, and watch the river and thick of th whole civilisation this river spawned, to a large event. Just chill.

title: Stops the bikes
review: Busy busy bridge with aggressive monkeys. Leave the monkeys alone and they'll leave you alone ..... unless you have food.

title: Jhula
review: Its a sightseeing place in Rishikesh. Its a bridge without any support over river Ganga and also known as Laxman jhula.

title: Awesome and lovely place.
review: The place is best viewed at Evening during sunset. The Steel Bridge is a masterpiece . Landmark in Rishikesh.

title: We loved the place
review: Definitely, you will not find the real genuine ashrams providing the genuine yoga sessions. Thay have all moved far away in the mountain because the location was becoming too touristic. But as a powerful spiritual place nearby nature this is it !

title: What a sight!!
review: The place is beautiful, the Ganga, emerald green here is breathtaking! Just stay there to enjoy the beauty and the peaceful environment !

title: Landmark @ Rishikesh
review: It's a old nice bridge made up of steel wires , I first visited this bridge in 1985 but after 30 years also I still remember the excitement I had ( I was 10 years old then).

title: Beautiful bridge.
review: This is a beautiful suspension located at Rishikesh. This bridge is constructed on Ganges. You get a great view of Ganges and surrounding Himalayas from this bridge. In the evening, you can see holy Ganga aarati from here.

title: beautiful !!!
review: In the evening went to the other side of the Rishikesh was a very nice experience ,On a hanging bridge ...

title: Restaurants and noise
review: The restaurants are very good, but the area is dirty and too noisy, cars and motorcycles horn too much.

title: Nice experience, crazy traffic
review: Crossing across the Laxman Jhula is definitely one of the high points of visiting Rishikesh. Walking on the narrow suspension bridge while taking in the breeze and watching river Ganga flow beneath is a great experience. What has ruined the experience is the large number of motorbikes and other non-motorised vehicles that use the bridge too. The traffic is crazy and one has to be careful to be not hit by a bike. The authorities should take note and make the pedestrianise the bridge.

title: Birthplace of Yoga...Really???
review: If this is really the birthplace of Yoga then it also died here too. Very commercial, full of businessmen pretending to get away from their stressful careers, to set up yoga schools and become Spiritual bullshi**ers! Such a shame, hardly any yoga teachers who were born here still exist and who can blame them.

title: A shaky narrow bridge !
review: Lakshman Jhula is a narrow shaky bridge located on the Rishikesh. Its too crowded to walk in the day time with frequent motor cycles adding to the agony. The good part about this bridge is the view of the ganges , mountains and the monkeys playing around.

title: Very Crowded with Unruly people
review: Though it gives a great of the river, the crowds do not adhere to any rules whatsoever. In spite of a prohibition on taking vehicles across the bridge, people take their liberties.

title: Very crowded. Seemed risky.
review: Certainly not the laxman jhula that I remember from my childhood. It was not only crowded but the sad part was that we were almost bulldozed by the two way traffic of bikes on the jhula. I was infact very petrified that the bridge would almost give in. Somehow Uttarkhand seemed like a place where rules were made to be broken.

title: The perfect place to stay!
review: I really like that part of town - much more than the Swarg Ashram Area. There are plenty of nice restaurants and cafés and many alternative people to watch. And it´s nice to walk to the other side of town and back. First I planned to switch to a place near the Parmarth Niketan Ashram, but I´m glad I didn´t. Here are just many travellers and it´s easy to get in contact.

title: Old Bridge over river Ganga
review: Its an old bridge over River Ganga. I should visit this place if he has time. There are many restaurants and ghats on both the sides of the river.

title: The view! What a view!
review: Finding my way to the bridge, through meandering lanes of Rishikesh, dotted with innumerable cafes, made me realise just one thing. It's totally worth it! A few moments spent, either next to it or over it, made all my woes fizzle out in no time. Just a look of the quaint Ganges flowing by made me feel alive. Given a chance, I can spend hours, feeling the breeze flirt with my hair and absorbing every bit of the view.

title: superb engineering marvel
review: did not liked that this bridge is being used by the local bikers.should be meant for pedestrians only.

title: Laxman Jhula – An Excellent Bridge Named After Ramayana Character
review: It is basically a bridge connecting two hills over Ganges. We went to this bridge every time crossing Ganges to go other end. During evening time and it was packed with locals and tourists. My kids really loved the water flow and the views of valleys and the river flowing down. Do plan your trip to this place in early morning to have the best while there is no hustle and bustle.

title: Ancient bridge built across river Ganga.Get nice view from it.
review: LAXMAN Jhula is the landmark in Rishikesh.Its an oldest and common mode to cross river Ganga.Its too narrow to walk as vehicles keep on passing.One can treasure the ganga view just by standing in the evening.

title: Laxman jhula is the best place for yoga,as i went to atriyogacenter the master was teaching excellent way of yoga.
review: I like mostly yoga courses there, I don't like manky s and crowd. the biker are making so much noises.

title: Great view, yoga centres all around
review: Laxman Jhula has a great view of the Ganges flowing through Rishikesh. Its very crowded, but a good one time experience..

title: peaceful place to meditate down in ganges
review: last saturday,i had been there with one of my friend,it was a beautiful day.from ram jhula ,we get into a boat and take a ride across,then we explore the nearby place,there are lot of shops and ashrams then we head to laxman jhoola on foot,actually the region between the ram jhula and laxman jhula has lot to offer,while walking towards the laxman jhula,we noticed people bathing down in ganges,we go down towards the ganges,we also wanted to bath but we weren't having the clothes to change so we just splash lot of water over the face,the water was very cool, then we put the mat over the sand and start listening to the tibetan music that we had carried along over the earphone and within 15 mins ,we had gone to deep sleep,after around one hour we wake up and noticed some water droplets over us than it started drizzling,we head towards a tea shop and had tea with sandwich,it was really an awesome experience,we had to come back to delhi in the evening so we left the city but planning to visit once again this weekend.

title: Local attraction in rishikesh
review: Has great views of the ganges..lot of things to do around the laxman jhula..must visit if in rishikesh

title: nice but crowdy
review: Superb bridge but little bit crowdy. ...nice view of river from bridge and cross this to see ashram and temple. Saw monkey everywhere just afraid but no more dangerous

title: Decent place but not well maintained
review: Laxman Jhula is a scenic beauty surrounded by local market but it requires regular maintenance which was missing.

title: A nice place to walk in peace
review: This bridge is one of our favorites from our visit to Rishikesh as it is not crowded as other places. Loved the small shops and cafes on the Ganges across it. You feel at one with the spiritual vibrations of temple bells and the flowing holy river below.

title: Excellent
review: Liked the famous Ganga Aarti across it at Parmarth Niketan.

title: Great Bridge and Cafes
review: Has a nice strolls across this suspension bridge and loved the food at the restaurants and cafes here.

title: beautiful place
review: rishikesh is place incomplete if you do not visit lkshman jhula...it is one of the main attractions in rishikesh...nice scenic view if the hills with the ganga flowing below...the marketplace is quite nearby so you can enjoy shopping as well

title: Nice
review: Great View from the Jhoola. You can take few flour balls along with you for feeding fishes from the Jhoola

title: Popular tourist spot
review: Lakshman Jhula which is an iron suspension bridge over river Ganges to cross the river is a popular tourist spot in Rishikesh. As per Ramayana(famous Hindu mythological text), Lakshman crossed Ganges on jute ropes between the place where this bridge is built. The bridge vibrates while you cross it. One can get amazing view of Ganges from the jhula and click pictures of boats floating on it and feed fishes on the river. On the way to the jhula is the sacred Adi Badrinath temple which devotees throng in large numbers - people who cannot visit Badrinathji in the far away mountains - get darshan here.

title: fine entertainment
review: people and monkey watching, views of the Ganges and surrounding hills.

title: Evergreen Laxman Jhula
review: With all the crowd and challenges, we always found Laxman Jhula is the main point of attraction where the time can be very well spent. This is very good due its natural views...

title: Beautiful
review: Nice views of the Ganges, mountains and temples. Lots of mokeys, which are really funny. Sometimes trying to take stuff from people, so beware of them monkeys and dont carry food in transparent bags, otherwise you might have to fight for it, but not only on the bridge, but everywhere where they are present :)

title: total magic
review: this footbridge is a wonderful way to see the ganges river ..there are always surprises especially in the form of rhesus and macaque monkeys to keep you smiling .....the constant stream of motorbikes is annoying however so be vigilant......and many a photo  op is too be had .......

title: Stunning view of town, mountain and Ganges
review: Stunning view of town, mountain and Ganges. Do not come to Rishikesh without taking in this site! Enjoy the monkeys too, although they are smart creatures so keep your belongings secure.

title: Amazing View of Ganges from there
review: Many wonder, even some dont agree on Excellent Review. The Bridge itself is not so amazing when compared to lot of other mega constructions. But we have to see the time it was built and the efforts put by some excellent people at that time. Still we can wonder the construction. Next comes the view from the bridge. No word to explain Ganges beauty from the bridge. It takes a turn and reaches the bridge, beauty, beauty, beauty all together. If u are a nature lover you will loose yourself when seeing the beauty of mountains and ganges flowing below. When sun glitters on ganges it still makes another kind of beauty. Must Visit place.

title: To be in a crowded Heaven !
review: Laxman Jhula is synonymous with Rshikesh.It is the  most popular and oldest suspension bridge that connects the main Road to the main town on the other side of Ganges.The beauty and speciality of this bridge can be felt when we reach the middle part. From there if we look down ,the emerald green colored water of Ganga is fascinating and groups of fish coming to eat the food (muri muri /flour balls )dropped from above, give never ending entertainment ! And when you look up ,Himalayan foot hills beckon to visit char dham.......

title: Great scenery
review: Cold at night time/morning because of the wind from the Himalayas, but beautiful during the day, about 22oc approx in November. Cows and monkeys roam free. Don't carry bananas openly as monkeys will take them and quite possibly attack you.

title: A bridge of humanity
review: Lovèd it... Could spend all day watching people crossing the bridge... On bikes, scooters, foot, pushing vendor carts, children feeding fish, beggars, not to mention the dogs, monkeys and cows ....revisited each day... Also enjoyed the fact that still the Indian domestic Visitors outnumber the westerners! Went to Ayurvedic consultation and massage at Dr Kumars clinic between the two bridges... amazed as his advice was exactly like I was told n NZ)

title: good spot
review: this area has all the cafes, good place to chill.

title: Beautiful view
review: This is the first bridge we visited and it was really lovely - great view of the mountains and the ganges. Just be careful of the monkeys. They sometimes seem excited, just ignore and keep walking. Across the bridge are lovely cafes, shops and temples.

title: felt VIP @ 3 am
review: in the day time you need to walk a lot to visit this place. what a cool breeze; freezing temperature at 3 am, guess what no one was there. we took our car till the bridge . wonderful sound of flowing water

title: Decent views and good nearby restaraunts
review: 1. Good Ganga views

title: Better shops than Ram Jhula
review: The shopping scene near Laxman Jhula is better than that near Ram Jhula. Consequently, its more crowded and noisy. Take an auto right up to the jhula because its a really long and tiring walk down to it.

title: Timeless Bridge over a River Eternal
review: I have gone to Rishikesh 3 times and each time I have stood in the middle of Lakshman Jhula to admire the view of Ganges. The bridge is fabled to have been built by Lakshmana the devoted brother of Lord Rama. Keeping aside the religious background of the structure - one cannot refuse the spiritual pull of the place. Families stand on the bridge dropping wheat flour balls into the river for the fishes to feed. You can admire the valley of Rishikesh, the flow of river Ganges and the sandy banks.

title: very beautiful and peaceful!
review: Beautiful view!! shopping place too with lovely eating outlets/restaurants. i love going  to german bakery and having the coffee, cake and enjoying the view...

title: Historic and Religious Suspended Bridge
review: Nice historic Bridge that tell us of our rich Ramayana history of how lord laxman crossed the river.

title: Shopping and Souvenirs
review: Market stalls and gem shops.  Good for souvenirs.  Mostly fair prices, but some be careful not to buy sandalwood here, it is fragranced and not authentic.

title: Nice views of the Ganges
review: Laxman Jhula is a suspension bridge that has nice views of the Ganges. From time to time you can watch rafts sail by. People, bicycles, carts, motor cycles all cross by the bridge. It feels nice to come here in the morning.

title: Nothing great
review: Not trying to be bad, despite being an engineering masterpiece, this place is not really worth all the hype it got.

title: Excellent view of Ganga from the  laxman Jhula
review: You can get an Excellent view of Ganga from the  Laxman Jhula  on both sides . It is very old & historical . It is said that the erstwhile king build the Jhula in wood  across the river for the  people to  cross the river but after it broke the Jhula was made in Iron & Steel .

title: Best Bridge
review: It is a beautiful bridge over the ganges and the view is spectacular. Monkeys on the bridge are a little scary but they are very friendly and do not harm. Just very far from where we were staying. Should have stayed at a luxury hotel near laxman Jhula.

title: Nice view
review: Beside the crowd who could easily drive you crazy, you have a beautiful view and a lot of little shops for souvenirs near the bridge as well as some cafes.

title: Unique and historic
review: I visited this place after about 15 years and nothing much has changed. The bridge has historic significance and is a major tourist and religious site. You will find people, monkeys, cows, bikes etc everything going in all directions on the bridge

title: Excellent
review: it is made over river ganges to cross the river and is landmark of Rishikesh.It is laxmana crossed ganges on jute ropes between the place where bridge is built. The bridge was completed in 1929.

title: Classic Monument
review: Its a place you would definitely want to visit for its reputation and heritage value attached to it. Hotel where i stayed in was very near to Laxman Jhula and it only took 10 mins to walk to this place. When you are at the middle of the Jhula and look downwards at the River Ganga, the kind of feel you would get is phenomenal. Definitely a must visit for all Rishikesh goers!!!

title: Bad experience...
review: While walking across there were some foreign tourist who were looted of the mobile phone and wallet. The tourist had grabbed the culprit but the lost items were not on him. Not sure what he had done to the items. Tourists were calling for  help but no one was coming forth.  There were no police patrols around either. We left and don't know what happened in the end.

title: The best view is from the river ganga while ur rafting.
review: Nice view from the river. We could see everyone waving at us and we waved back.

title: If you are not a yoga fanatic - choose differently!
review: Rishikesh in general, and Laxman Jhula in particular are a place for yoga fanatics and very religious Hindus... Other than that there is really very little to do there. To my opinion as a very savvy traveler to India - It is HIGHLY over rated.

title: A nice place
review: For me this is the place where Ganges actually comes down from the mountain. I wake up exactly on the the banks of Ganges on Laxman Jhula and the fresh beeze that is constantly blowing above the river is something that makes this spot so special!

title: Nice view. Good for photos.
review: We stayed near Laxman Jhula bridge, few hundred meters from it and I have to say that we liked it. It is nice view from the bridge. The only thing which was frustrating is that they allow bikes to go over the bridge! At one point there is cow in front of you, monkey trying to steal food, bridge is crowded with people and than from front and behind you hear sound of bikes and horn. I would ban all the bikes there and let them use the main bridge which is few km away from Laxman Jhula bridge. And yeah... people who sell stuff are so annyoing next to the bridge, they "run" after tourists - they don't understand the word "not interested / no", but than again, hundred meters from it, everything is ok. :)

title: A Mixed Bag
review: I suppose the best thing about Laxman Jhula is its proximity to the countryside beyond.  It is well worth walking out of.  That's not being very kind, but it is a noisy hell of beeping jeeps, full of stoned Israelis and Indian tat shops where stoned Israelis buy Indian tat.  It does have some highlights though.  Pyramid Café is a haven of peace and good eating, far above the madding and maddening crowds.  The bridge is fun and bonkers.  There are many good eateries, but invariably full of stoned Israelis and the odd stoned German or Spaniard.  If getting stoned is NOT your scene - and it is no longer mine - then I recommend heading down to Ram Jhula instead, where there is a more "yogic" vibe

title: Crowded
review: Bridge is always crowded not easy to get pic even two wheel bikes are running in speed can hit u anytime.

title: Nice place
review: Must go but .....only once is sufficient. Nice architecture  and all ..........

title: A must visit in Rishikesh
review: The bridge is a hanging bridge with great views of the ganges and temples across it. you see a lot of monkeys so keep your belongings close to you. We clicked a nice family picture on the bridge.

title: a treat to watch
review: This is one hanging bridge which you would love to travel on foot.The scenic view of the Ganges along with Himalayas is a treat to watch.Beware of the monkeys,they are really nasty and do not be confused with ramjhoola,another hanging bridge.

title: Morning walk
review: One need to get up early and go for a early morning walk over the Jhula, You enjoy heavy wind flow and can see the fish in the river. you find local boys selling atta (feed for fish) there.

title: On the banks of ganga
review: The banks of river ganga at Rishikesh are gorgeous. Give beautiful views of the templates sans the crowds. We reached there at sun set and caught some magnificent views of the setting sun saying good bye to the temple town.

title: Bikers on the bridge are a nuisance
review: I liked walking on it, A bit scary initially. The sound of Ganga flowing beneath is surreal.  Annoyingly, bikers from both directions were a disgusting nuisance. Don't know if it is meant for pedestrians only, but wish it were.

title: went Maayaa eco friendly store,bought nice handmade things,
review: little bit crowdy place,but very nice shop,pepole following back to basic things in routine life,many temples ,many healing school,

title: Bikers kill the vibe !!
review: The walk on the jhula would have been amazing if there were no bikers allowed to pass by.

title: exciting..!!!
review: one of its kind experience of a rope suspension bridge amidst sounds of temple bells.

title: Great Bridge
review: Nice to walk on it across the Ganges. Since we were staying at a  hotel very far away we drove to the bridge parking and walked across it to the lovely cafe's and shops.

title: Discover the spiritual connection
review: This is a place to sit relax and appreciate life. Soak in the purified atmosphere by daily Ganga aarti.

title: Standstill feeling even after our tour - Krishna Duvvuri
review: Lakshman Jhula is a bridge without any pillars and it was such a memory standstill even after our visit to this wonderful place.  Actually, we family on tour to Dehradun and since it was very near we have got great opportunity to see this place.  Me and my younger daughter walked all along the bridge and it was a great experience to hear the lovely noise of Ganges water below and the greenery all around surroundings of this beautiful place.  Must see and visit whenever anyone plan to visit Haridwar or Dehradun.  People must be prepared to walk a lot as there is no transportation for this bridge and the total length of the bridge about 2km long.  There are many more foreign tourists one can see at this place.  Do not miss this wonderful place in your basket of planned tours...Smiles! Krishna Duvvuri Abu Dhabi UAE

title: just a pathway connecting 2 sides of rishikesh
review: it was just a pathway where only pedestrians and 2 wheeler are allowed. There are no lights in the night hence it becomes really dark. You would never know what you stepped on.

title: Beat bridge visit ever
review: Great old moving bridge. Crossed over to visit temples and ashrams. Saw rafting rafts pass below the bridge

title: Lifetime Experience
review: It is an amazing experience to cross Laxman Jhula which has only support of cables. Wind is very strong when cross the Jhula. It is a tourist attraction at Rishikesh. We crossed Laxman Jhula twice just out of fun. Ganges running below Laxman Jhula. Cows, bikes, bicycles, tourists all are crossing Jhula to reach either side of the river is fun.

title: Temple Rishikesh
review: The chain of temples and river , bridge and the shops selling souvenir and special rings made of gem stones are the star attractions at Rishikesh. While one visits Haridwar , for the holy dip and prayers , Rishikesh is the place to visit the temples and worship . Nicely built temples with good ambience will provide good feelings. Recommended

title: Bhupendra Astrologer
review: If looking for a honest and trustworthy Astrologer look for Bhupendra. He is a great Vedic Astrologer and Reiki healer. He is not only a great astrologer but also an amazing friend.

title: very touristy place
review: Rishikesh is more famous for laxman jhula than Ram jhula but if you are looking for some peace  then avoid laxman jhula completely.  It has mainly Indian tourist with shops selling all kinds of stuff, loud songs blaring from them.

title: Monkeys!!!
review: Be carefull of this naughty animals :) beautiful view and walk over the Ganga..you can see and feed fishes..so nice! And beautiful sadus

title: Hanging Bridge
review: Its a hanging bridge connecting the temples with the main road. When you walk on this bridge, you could feel the swing since its suspended with iron cables. Need maintenance and 2 wheeler restriction.

title: Hanging Bridge
review: Its a pedestrian suspension bridge on the river Ganga which is 4 kms upstream of Rishikesh. It is named on Lakshman (Brother of lord Ram). Popular among tourists for shopping,activities like rafting. There are many shops selling interesting things on both side of the bridge. Multistory temple is on left bank at the end of this bridge.

title: Overcrowded
review: Walking along the bridge wasn't a particularly pleasant experience. It was too crowded during this time.

title: must visit ,really big,really interesting
review: the steel ropes suspension bridge on the mighty Ganges.really beautiful  ,must visit,its 450 eet long and approx 3 km from rishikesh town

title: Beautiful Hanging Bridge
review: Laxman Jhula is an attractive point of Rishikesh where almost every tourist wants to go. Situated at the entrance of The Himalayas, it is a hanging rope bridge over river Ganges. Sorrounded by high hill, it presents a rare panorama of hills, river and greenery. One crosses the bridge to go across the fast flowing river below and then the bridge swings, It is a place where a lover of nature would like to stay for hours. Laxman Jhula is around 3 km from the Bus stand/ railway station of Rishikesh and auto rickshaws are available on booking and sharing basis. One can also stop at Ram Jhula before Laxman Jhula . Ram Jhula is identical but new one. At Ram Jhula one can enjoy delicious dishes at famous Chotiwalas and can purchase books and cloths from Gita Press' Shop which is at Gita Bhawan on corssing the river Ganges. A Must see at Rishikesh!

title: ganga view
review: beautiful view of ganga from laxman jhula. really great technology used. govt must take care of cleanliness of laxman jhula. animals should not be allowed on laxman jhula.

title: excellent over view
review: the laxman jhulla is built above the ganges river, it starts from the tapovan area and crosses over to other side of the river where there are many ashrams, the name as said in history that god laxman used to stay here in tapovan, hence the name laxman jhulla, beware here you will get the guides for very low charges, but they are connected with shop owner selling their stones of different make and rudraks mala's, its not compulsory to buy  from them but if you have enough time in hand then its ok other wise you need to skip this totally..

title: beware of shops
review: laxman jhula is a gud place to visit but ornaments of stone are fake and costly so beware of the.but the restraunts are gud.and also beware the monkeys

title: Good Location with some good restaurants and Ganga View..
review: The Laxman Jhula area has beautiful view of Ganga River. The area is full of Hindu Temples. The area has some very good restaurants with river view. The area is clean compared to rest of the Rishikesh. The Laxman Jhula is full of tourists and speacially foreign tourists. The Jhula is actually a hanging bridge over the river Ganga. Jhula means Swing.

title: Good experience for kids and a good photographic location
review: It is an older and smaller version of its younger and latest sibling, Ram Jhula. It is called Jhula (=swing) as its gives swinging feeling while walking over it as it is a cable supported bridge. It was constructed during British times. As it is the older bridge therefore all major attractions, be it restaurants or temples, are located in its vicinity.  There are many monkeys so if you are afraid of this creature then be cautious. You can buy fish food to feed fishes of Ganga from the bridge. It would be a nice experience to cross below flowing Ganga over this bridge, specially for little children. This bridge may also be considered as a good photography spot.

title: Laxman jhula
review: Laxman jhula is about 30 kms away from Haridwar , you will have to go either by bus or by an auto to reach laxman jhula, it will cost somewhere around INR 50 , that's a very good place to be at just below the ganges goes thorough , once you go thorough the laxman jhula there are two temples which are really great, there you can enjoy boat ride which will cost INR 50/person

title: Still refreshing
review: The place still maintains the age old charm. An amble down the floating bridge is as magnificent as ever. The Ganges looks pure to the last drop.

title: Long and great
review: We clicked many snaps and was really great walking to it. it was windy and nice. U can c sand all around and broken stone. was litting sad on the loss that we had

title: Nice bridge for pedestrians
review: It is one of the most famous landmarks being the oldest bridge in Rishikesh. Only thing is it is now increasingly difficult to walk leisurely due to the heavy traffic and noise of 2-wheelers. it is time the authorities constructed one bridge exclusively for 2-wheelers and made this and the ram Jhula exclusively for pedestrians.

title: a lovely bridge
review: this bridge is the centre for visiting the temple and the Ganges. All the times people of all ages pass, also monkeys and cows are crossing..tourist spot for Indians who visit holy places and temples, there are plenty of photographers on the spot to take your picture with this bridge and temple.

title: peaceful
review: Place is good, fabulous view of ganga flowing down.people who are nervous should see front and walk over the bridge.

title: Beautiful view of the Ganges
review: After parking your vehicle or getting down from the auto/tuktuk, walk till you come to the big statue of Ram. From here, there are 2 ways to Laxman Jhula - one towards the right, one towards the left. The one on the left is much shorter but involves getting down steep stairs, the one on the right involves a gently sloping road, though the distance is more.

title: laxman jhula
review: its a good place if your own car please take it, as taxis are very difficult to get

title: A neglected legacy
review: Went after almost 20 yrs with a lot of sweet childhood memories but was disappointed with the traffic jams on the road ,dirty crowded lanes and polythene bags n fish food on the jhoola itself and the stench on the other side. We should be ashamed of our self this is how we keep our holy places and the civic authorities should pay attention

title: rope hanging bridge
review: this bridge which connects two banks is a must watch in rishikesh .. though a bit crowded, its famous thats why !!!

title: Amazing !!
review: An amazing experience ..

title: Bridge to Serenity
review: What a wonderful setting, a footbridge over the holy Ganga with views of ancient temples all around. The lack of motor transport brings to the visitor a slowed awareness of the time, giving a natural opportunity to imbibe the deep spiritual sense of this place. I return, and return, and will return again. Ann G.

title: nice
review: everything perfect, very peaceful, calm and my Guide made it entertainment, there is a bridge made by british was perfect and it is as was in their time

title: Cookies, popcorn, and a great view!
review: My three favorite things all in one place! You'll find the "fresh" baked cookies and popcorn on the other side of the cool bridge. Monkeys, cows, scooters, and tourists flood the bridge, but it was still very enjoyable to walk over and watch the rafts.

title: must see
review: such a fun place. lively. authentic indian experience with tourists from all over the country. the bridge may feel a bit wobbly to the more nervous person.

title: GREAT SWING
review: We were on ou way to Ghattu ghat & this was during the sawan mela, we were a group of 3 persons, all the way through the jhulla was fun as we did not put any effort to walk, we were pushed from the start to end of the jhulla in no time, in the middle though I was afraid with the sound of the jhulla swinging like a ship on the sea.

title: Amazing Suspension bridge
review: The amazing suspension bridge over river Ganges provide beautiful views of green mountains. I have been to Rishikesh many times and on my every visit it appeals a fresh window of scenic beauty. Having a holy dip in river Ganges is much better and spiritual than Haridwar. My most favorite destination in India and love to visit in every summer holidays.

title: more international flavor
review: more restaurants and international travelers than where I was staying in Rishikesh. I loved the fact that I could get an omelet there and their vegetarian food was very good.

title: Great feeling !!
review: As an Indian student we read about this Jhula when we were in school, hence it was extremely exciting to walk on it as a sixty year old person . Definitely worthwhile, with the magnificent Ganga below. The experience is marvellous. Just a few feet below, you can easily perform the Ganga snan { bath } without any problems.

title: traffic jam
review: You just miss out on admiring its beauty while trying to make your way through two-wheelers, monkeys, cattle and dogs.

title: one for the bucket list
review: a trip to Rishikesh would not be complete without a walk across Laxman Jhula. *****be careful of the motorcycles!****

title: Laxman jhula @ Rishikesh
review: You can feel a little swing at laxman jhula. There you can take the rafting package as well. Indian people usually through garbage at laxman jhula pls avoid polythene there and put your garbage in dustbin.

title: A Unique Bridge
review: Liked this jhula more because my grandfather had built it way back in 1939 (Find the name Jagdish Prasad, Asst. Engr. on the foundation stone). However, the jhula remains too crowded with tourists and locals. Most irritating are two wheelers plying on it.

title: too congested
review: the lakshman jhula is a suspended bridge connecting the eastern bank to the western bank of ganga at rishikesh.

title: A lot is required to be done
review: Heard a lot about this Cantilever bridge first made to cross Ganges, some time in 1929, as a Jeep Bridge. Now only for pedestrians. Very dirty approach, unclean surrounding, much to be required to be done by the corporation to keep its name which it deserves. Around two Km from Ram Jhula. Not worth visiting in its present condition.

title: Overcrowded hanging bridge
review: This is an overcrowded, much hyped hanging bridge. The access road to the Laxman Jhoola can be crowded sometimes, it took us 30 minutes from main road, as some fanatics had parked their vehicles on the both sides of the road. Don't drive upto there, park the vehicle at some distant parking and walk upto the bridge if you want to go there.

title: Not worth visiting
review: This bridge is a local attraction and has a beautiful view of the ganges. But it is extremely overcrowded. It is also used by two wheelers to cross the river and I am not sure if that is legal. But they are a complete menace. If you are not staying at a walking distance from this place, it is difficult to get autos and cabs to return to your hotel. The cops were not very helpful when asked for directions to the taxi stand. The market close by is also overcrowded, dirty and loud. Overall, manage your own travel in advance, do not stay back till late, and prepare yourself to face excessive crowd if you visit this place.

title: Enjoy the swings of the Jhula
review: I spent almost 1/2 hours at the mid of Jhula to enjoy the flowing of the holy river Ganga. I enjoyed the cool breezes and the surrounding mountains.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place to visit. You feel some vibration when you walk on jhula. Its give feel that you are on hanging bridge.

title: ultimate
review: i live in hotel madhusudan at ganga view room.hotel staff are very good and coprative.room are very clean and toilet also.

title: must visit
review: very nice experience, u will have apanoramic view of ganga river. although it remains crowded, but that does not matter

title: Good to see
review: Lakshman jhoola a must visit place..beware of monkeys and bikers. They are blocking the narrow lane of the jhoola.. However a good place to stand in late evening!

title: best place to relax
review: as rishikesh is full of ashrams and yuga centers, laxam jhula is a more guiet place that ram jhula and i really felt safe even late at night

title: This bridge, and the area around it, wonderful.
review: As a person who's been visiting Rishikesh since 2000, I can safely say that if you don't like the Laxman Jhula area, with it's many good restaurants, hotels, stores, temples, ashrams, yoga schools, and more, then India is not the place for you.

title: surrender to monkey any food in hand , and save from dashing against speeding two wheelers
review: it's monkey territory. simians  are the boss on the bridge and own any food stuff you might be carrying , so part with it willingly . Advisory:  do not keep anything of value in the same packet in which any food stuff is kept. you will lose both maybe in the river below. some people buy small packets of nuts thus diverting monkeys attention by parting with it. but you may have to buy many packets, so decide your strategy.  watch out for speeding two wheelers honking for way. time the rishikesh administration controlled the menace. oop's, forgot to write anything about the bridge. go have a look , integral to feeling rishikesh.

title: Wow, you should walk this
review: An excellent attraction of Rishikesh and a good example of Rope hung bridge. The walk from one end to another is crowded by locals, tourists, two wheelers and cows but sometimes monkeys do make you stop in your walk. The walk is full of air breeze and the foot falls make the bridge wobble. An amazing experience.

title: Jai Laxman Ji ki
review: The bridge is available only for pedestrians and bicycles. Beware of monkeys who like fruits that have been purchased Stealing! The view from the bridge into the depths and on the Ganges is wonderful. Now and then you can watch rafts. A great hobby more alien tourists obvious. The bells of the temple at the bridge provide a unique atmosphere.

title: Swinging bridge
review: Not joking but it does shakes & swings. Its a nice experience but i think bikes should not be allowed as it creates chaos for the people walking out there. authorities should try to think on some alternatives.

title: nice holy place
review: laxman jhula is a best attraction of rishikesh..not to miss..good construction of bridge...with a nice multistory temples around..you can find some good snack points there too..you cant do much there...have a good walk on laxman jhula bridge...look at the majestic river...roam in and around temples..spend some good spiritual time there.

title: Nothing very special, But if you in Rishikesh. Visit
review: The Laxman Jhula is a king of hanging bridge with cables. Its very narrow and crowded. Lots of people will be clicking pics walking around. Only thing which i liked was stand in middle of Bridge(Jhula) and look down into river. it will be shaking gently.

title: Crowded
review: Nothing special about the place, is crowded and a little risky as even two wheeler's are also permitted on the walkway

title: The beach type ghat below the Jhula was great.
review: The view as amazing and the area around was also good for window shopping(kids). It was a very good experience at beach type ghat below the Laxman Jhula and the kids really enjoyed playing sand games.

title: The Soul Song
review: Its a combination of carefreeness, spirituality and peace..the place is chilled out and the tourists make a mix of foreigners from all over..food is great for those who have a western taste

title: amazing place to be
review: This place shows a totally different side of Rishikesh. Its a heaven for foreigners and their shopping. So many colorful clothes and weird items to buy..the walk from laxman jhula to ram jhula from the other side of Ganges was worth it.

title: Overrated
review: Firstly there was no lakshman ji or his temple there. I found that it was only an overrated piece of antic.

title: Yoga class, markets, cafes, everything you need
review: Loved it, so many options, yoga classes, market stalls with jewellery, yoga pants, clothing, souvenirs, tibetan bowls, scarfs, cafes, book stores, palm reader, astrologers. A lovely walk full of colour and chaos and harmony!

title: Just a bridge, a swinging bridge...
review: It's just a bridge to cross the river. The only thing is that it's a hanging bridge which is suspending on the  river ganga by the support of ropes and cables. It's too crowded and busy.

title: Fun  to cross over !
review: Amazing atmosphere across the Lakshman jhula;  ghats, numerous  restaurants  and cafés,  tiny  shops selling curios & artefacts,  views  on both banks of the Ganges, New Age tourists, yogis and spiritual seekers.

title: Reminded me old days
review: I had visited Laxman Jhula with my parents as a kid. Came here this time after decades and it was very nostalgic. Feeding the fishes in Ganges, souvenir stores and interesting food as well.

title: Lax man Jula
review: It was a good experience. But cows, bike, motor cycle etc. constantly moving up and down so u cannot enjoy t experience

title: Amazing atmosphere
review: Lakshman jhula is a hanging bridge which is suspending on the river ganga by the support of ropes and cables, which is narrow and highly suspended . Watching river ganga from the bridge is very thrilling, as bridge swings a bit.Watch out for the monkeys trying to grab whatever stick out of your backpack

title: Mere mythical hype about a usual chain/rope bridge
review: The name conjures mystical visions--but this is a very ordinary chain/rope bridge across the river Ganges---the access from both sides being so clumsy, crowded, and dirty, and so thickly populated with petty shops, vendors, and so on.  Hygiene certainly takes a back-seat !

title: Touristic and full of life
review: Laxman Jhula have everything you need as a western traveller. There are enough restaurants, german bakerys, a post office too and plenty of shops.

title: Nice Fun Place
review: At the face of it it may seem to a be a junkie spot but then Laxman Jhula is a nice spiritual center, nice cafe, interesting bakeries and good tibetan shopping.

title: A happening place
review: Enjoyed walking around this place and appreciated the construction of the bridge too. The Ganga river is looks best from here in the evening after everything is lit up.

title: Watch the monkeys
review: The monkeys are food thieves!!  They even come into nearby restaurants and swipe your food  off your plate in the blink of an eye. You don't even see them coming--they are stealth!

title: Lovely heaven!!!!
review: Awesome spiritual place. So serene, clean and beautiful. Very soulful. Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula both are main spiritual attractions of Rishikesh, both are must see attractions and equally beautiful.

title: Monkey menace
review: This suspender bridge over the ganges offers excellent views of Rishikesh. The adjoining areas have some restaurants and shops. It is very crowded and you have to be very careful of your belongings as there are monkeys everywhere.

title: hundreds of pilgrims
review: The bridge is available only for pedestrians. Beware of monkeys .The view from the bridge into the depths and on the Ganges is wonderful.

title: Great for people watching!
review: Laxman Jhula is like a centrepoint for Rishikesh. It's nice to just stand on the bridge with the amazing views and watch all sorts of different characters pass you by. Rishikesh has a weird blend of tourists, hippies, holymen and just generally people who are slightly "different" then normal... A must see.

title: Great, Fun Hangout!
review: The many cafe, bakeries and souvenir shops here are just awesome!! We loved Israeli food at one of the cafe here.

title: more famous for nothing
review: see if you have to.

title: Marvellous
review: This is one of the engineering marvels of the World. The swinging bridge made more than hundred years ago, is still giving service to the pilgrims.

title: Scary for me
review: It is quite high up, and I'm terrified of bridges. Trying to navigate beside cows and motorcycles and monkeys shaking the wires makes it quite scary. Needed to be done:) Glad I saw it.

title: Nice experience..
review: It was a nice experience to watch the life in Rishikesh from Laxman Jhula.. It was raining lightly which made the scene more beautiful..

title: Scenic :)
review: Must visit... U will just love the view... Take a coin n wish n drop it in the water.... To add on... U will love d view...

title: Bridge without Pillers
review: It is approx 30 mins from Haridwar  and most famous place in Rishikesh. Public transport, shared auto are always available , you have to walk on foot approx 500 mitre to reach the Jhula.. View from jhula to the flowing water is awosome.

title: beauty of nature
review: a very very beautiful place to visit at Rishikesh. serene environment, excellent views of mountains around, exceptional beauty of river ganga, greenish but clear water, sheer excellence

title: Its a bridge and you walk over it
review: I don't really understand why this is such a big deal.  its a cute bridge and the views are nice but 5 minutes and you are done

title: nice place
review: i love this place.

title: Peaceful Oasis
review: So much more rewarding than Ram Jhula. Glad I went there first!!!!  The people were lovely and low key, and it had an international flair.  I'd go back in a heartbeat.

title: Bridge Over The River Ganges
review: Stunning views, riddled with monkeys so don't go with food in your hands!  Great restaurants & shops both sides.

title: Monkeys, fish, bikes, jhula.
review: There are wild monkeys on the bridge and they want food. Just don't made direct eye contact. There are children who sell pieces of dough to feed the fish below, it should cost no more than 5 rps, but they may try to scam. People use the bridge to get across the Ganga so beware of incoming bikes. The view of the himalayas, the ganga, villages, and the sun make everything very much worth going.

title: Well, it's a nice bridge
review: It's a very famous place in Rishikesh and it's surly nicer than Ram Jhula (it's bigger brother) but it is still just a bridge with monkeys and annoying motorcycles.

title: My first real footsteps in India
review: We were dropped off in the Laxhman Jhula area from the airport and immediately found ourselves bewitched by all that the senses were picking up, lots to do and see in this area, great food, book shops, interesting people and an unreal location with the massive bridge crossing the Ganga, no words can really describe, and the fact that according to the myths Rama and Laxhman came to this area to pray for penance after killing the demon-king Ravana...

title: Iron Bridge to Markets
review: Suspension Bridge sways with foot traffic, motorcycles and cows.  No cars allowed.  Shopping is plentiful, colorful, reasonable, and local.

title: wonderful views
review: I was there last year that being my 5th visit to India and Rishikesh  and always enjoy my early 4.30am  walks in semi darkness over the bridge on my way to early morning meditation. once the town begins to wake up the bridge becomes very bust indeed and the motorbikes are a potential hazard. still a great buzz with the monkeys getting in on the act after tit bits and any cameras or bags to snatch. views are amazing as is the whole of rishikesh.

title: Holy Town
review: I was there in the month of September this year which is the 3rd visit for me in India. Although it is hot during day time, I really enjoy spending my time doing some shopping for my yoga bags, mala beads and enjoying vegetarian food. Of course, there are a lot of private yoga classes whereby you name it and you will get it. It is really a yoga heaven place. I wish I can spend more time here for my next visit.

title: God's Gift
review: Since 100s of years people know Rishikesh for its divine experience . This place is very close to our heart as it reflects are culture .

title: Laxman Jhula
review: Fantastic. Laxman Jhula bridge must be experienced. This is a fantastic area and steeped n spiritual history too. There are lots of nice eating places where you can just drop n, take a chai and food and then continue your stroll. A Word of warning...... Try not to feed the numerous monkeys that hang out on the bridge as they get quite vicious.

title: amazing
review: its a very beautiful place, you can go by walk and visit the temples.....its a good place for meditataion, you can enjoy watching the rafting that people do on the river Ganga. the laxman jhula is constructed on the ganga river......there will be lot monkeys and be aware about the things that carry with you, please plastic bags. wonderful place to visit in rishikesh.

title: Its a bridge
review: What's to review...you cross it to get to the other side...it can be crowed with people, motorcycles, monkeys, and hawkers of goods.

title: swing on the river
review: the swinging on the river people walking and crossing the river, i did not like the 2 wheelers on the jhula crossing the river, they should have a separate bridge

title: Hanging Bridge
review: To be really truth ful lakshman jhula has really lost its charm comparing to the old days & maintenance & safety standards are also not upto the mark.

title: my favorite place on earth
review: staying on this side of the river is exactly where you want to be.  rent a bike and follow the river for even more beauty.

title: Beautiful bridge
review: Lakshman Jhula is a beatiful bridge spanning over the river ganges built in 1939 . It takes you to Ram Jhula , Swarga Ashram and lots of other beautiful temples with gardens . There is also a huge statue of Lord Vishnu and Hanuman on the bank of the river .

title: Overcrowded Jhula
review: This place is very crowded and the locals drive their motor cycles creating chaos and panic among tourists. The only thing is that you get a lovely view of the Ganges from the Jhula.

title: Crowded and lovely
review: It's a crowded briedge all the day, and the monkeys that can stole your food if you don't take care of it but that's what make this place fun and original.

title: Great Views of the Holy Ganga
review: You could get a great view of the Ganges, both sides of the bridge. For more better views, you may give it a try to one of the multistory temples, and have a breathtaking view from the top floors. Not to miss.

title: A must see place in Rishikesh
review: It's the main attraction around and always you can see lots of local people and travelers around and of course lots of monkeys on the bridge

title: incredibly inspiring and beautiful...
review: no trip to Rishikesh is complete without a visit to Laxman Jhula... it was breathtakingly inspiring as I looked up river to the himalayas as they begin in these foothills... just so beckoning.....

title: Must see
review: Have been visiting Rishikesh for last 10 years now. Laxman Jhula is a major attraction. Lot of traffic on the hanging bridge requires to be put to a stop as it is getting damaged. View from the Laxman Jhula is fantastic. Beware of the monkeys and never buy the 'atta-goli' or the flour-balls here.

title: the core of the town
review: Laxman Jhula is one of the places, together with Ram Jhula, to feel the real taste of Rishikesh, with an amazing sight of the Ganga river and the pulse of the indian people, together with cows, monkeys and moto riders...

title: Beautiful.
review: I heard monkeys swoop down and snatch sunnies right off your face. Luckily that did not happen. haha. I was here while on my way to the Beatles Ashram. You get a nice view of the Ganga river, mountains, people and there are even animals on the bridge.

title: The swaying bridge
review: Nothing great about it,but one visit is fine.Bridge was built in the 1930's and is hanging,with two wheellers plying on it.You will see quite a few monkeys on the bridge.

title: Himalaya Astrology Bhupendra Sharma - Reiki Healing
review: Very good Vedic Astrologer, just 10 m from Satcha Dam Ashram at Laxman Jhula In Rishikesh. Nice kind and professional astrologer who knows vedic Astrology very well( Said from one who Studies vedic Astrology as Well) So if You Are In Rishikesh, my recommendations

title: worth a visit
review: Natural beauty and flowing Ganges.It is exciting to go in the middle of the jhula to feel the breeze.

title: A Good Walk
review: Just like Ram Jhula bridge, worth to walk and observe the people coming and going, the view from the river and see the temples and shops on the other bank of the river,

title: Good historical place
review: There are some so-called temples at corner of Laxman Jhula. Instead of temples these are shopping complexes with idols of God placed in the shops only to collect donations. Avoid going to these places. Instead enjoy the view of Laxman Jhula

title: Holy Bridge for crossing Ganga River
review: LIke Ram Jhula this is also holy bridge to cross Ganga river by pedestrians.

title: Must Visit
review: Hanging bridge over Ganga without any pillers in between. You get a filling of swing while on walking.

title: Shaking laxman jula
review: We were in rishikesh on 18 th June 2013,when whole of our tv channels were focussing the flooded shiva ,near laxman jula.Even on that day so many people were riding motorcycles on that bridge,which made us so scary!,,,

title: nice swinging bridge
review: i first visited this place in 1996!! after that I have been quite frequent. I especially love crossing the bridge on foot so that I can feel the sway. also the ganga provides a great pastime!!

title: Must-see bridge
review: it is long bridge over Ganga with monkeys on handrails and a lot of people who cross both sides. Very nice view to Ganga and bis fishes in it ) Good hotels on riversides.

title: Day trip- Delhi to Lakshman Jhula
review: Lakshman Jhula is a suspension bridge built over river Ganges. It is an interesting walk as you share the space with pedestrians, two-wheelers, cows, dogs and monkeys!! From the car park to the jhula it is a good walk that passes through small shops with artefacts and curios.

title: a bridge on the river ganges
review: LJ was very close to our cottage and it connected us to the shops. Interesting walk for human,cows, bikes and monkeys. It is the only way to be connected to the otherside of the ganges. Safe to walk and it is  hotspot for the cameramen.

title: Too crowded
review: It is once time visit place especially if you have kids with you. The kids will either enjoy the shaky bridge or may get scared. We were 3 families and total of 5 kids. 2 kids got scared as the bridge shook and they started crying so we returned half way.

title: Blessed place
review: Travelled in Feb 2012. This place is truly beautiful and peaceful.  You need to be careful when walking across the bridge as people also ride motor bikes on it  and there are monkeys also sitting on the bridge.

title: Experience India on small room
review: To cross this suspension bridge is always an experience. Not only pedestrians use it but also cows, monkeys and motorbikes so most of the time it is very overcrowded.

title: Poor Management
review: Well what can you say. All the charm is short lived when you have a mad rush of people, cattle, Scooters trying to cross from both directions on a narrow bridge. You hardly get to feel the resonance of Ganga and the serenity of the far surroundings that you expect all way along to your visit to this place

title: It is exciting to go in the middle of the jhula to feel the breeze.
review: Natural beauty and flowing Ganges.It is exciting to go in the middle of the jhula to feel the breeze.

title: walking bridge
review: great experience to cross the laxman jula and both the side there is very good market available and there is 12 manjil / 13 manjil temple nearby to be visited.

title: Astrologer/Reiki/Palmreading
review: Hi! If you are seeking Astrology, Palmreading, Reiki-healing/training, I recommend one in Laxman Jula, very close to Satcha Dam ashram, to the right when you go down the hill from Laxman square. It is a big sign saying Reiki. I went there first for Reiki training and I met a man that was very calm and had a very nice energy. "Bhupendra". It was very nice to learn Reiki with him. I also did vedic astrology and palmreading and it is the best reading I ever got. Very positive and even the "less positive" was turned into positive. I could feel he was very much in tune with me as he did the reading.

title: Standing the test of time
review: Great view of the river. Was supposed to be only for pedestrians, but you find 2 wheelers, pushcarts, cows, dogs and monkeys as well. And it is still intact! The bouncy feeling stays with you even after you get off the bridge.

title: Awesome place
review: I've been here 3 times, and I am still happy to there again. First and latest time had some cold timing, raining and windy, but at the day time nice sun.

title: AWESOME TOWN
review: We found our best shopping and more unique items in Laxman Jhula. We loved the bridge, the sites, hiking up the temple, many Nepal and Tibetan items. Very unique and fun. Spent several hours in one store discovering all kinds of unique and fun 'doo-dads". Teens LOVED the water and sand and rocks on this side of Ganga and we thoroughly enjoyed Little Budda and other German Bakery (whoa..homemade white bread in India?!??!!) treats!!

title: Cute town, awesome healthy food.
review: This is a nice place to visit if you are in the area. There are plenty of bakeries and vegetarian restaurants where you can have a nice, bast meal for an affordable price.

title: Not nice.
review: I did not like it cause it swung too much and it was overcrowded. It also had a lot of monkeys on board.

title: laxman jhula
review: it constructed in 1930.it connect the two side of river.nice view of river and rishikesh.most of the temple u can see from at center of the bridge nice view.

title: Smaller than Ram Jhula
review: I'd never even heard about the Ram Jhula, but it was bigger and had a better view than Laxman Jhula. The location of Laxman Jhula and the walk from the Laxman Jhula to the Ram Jhula is a nice one though!

title: Awesome experience.
review: Walking over the Laxman jhoola is awesome and interesting. It becomes more interesting if u get photographs by the professional photographer. A number of photographers u may find there, who can give you photos within few minutes.

title: Excellent if you choose the right time to visit
review: Firstly visited in the evening of 28 March 2013. Place was too crowded at that time. Please note that Public Car Parking is available not far away from the Jhula. The two-wheeler traffic on Jhoola spoilt the enjoyment of the Jhula in the evening.

title: Very attractive and interesting
review: This is the place, Rishikesh is famous for. Laxman Jhoola is one of the most interesting and attractive place in Rishikesh. Must go once.

title: Amazing experience at Lakshman Jhula
review: It was cool breezy morning when we took a round trip on lakshman jhula. It was a divine  experience. I will recommend travelers to take a early morning walk on lakshman jhula to experience the divinity of the location.

title: Ram and Laxman Jhula
review: Please visit both the jhulas. Ram jhula was clean and big and was better than Laxman Jhula. Laxman jhula was congested but should be visited once.

title: Photography = Monkeys + Tourists + view
review: This is my favourite bridge as Monkeys make the best of the available space and provide ample photo opportunities.

title: Sit beside the Ganges....
review: The bridges in Ram and Laxman Jhula are a wonderful to view the Ganges.   Laxman Jhula is getting very congested with the building of new guest houses in a area that lacks the infrastructure to support the in flux of visitors.   It is becoming more difficult to find that little, quant India guest house experience, but not impossible.   Several good places to eat in this area, can walk to easily to the beachside and there is a guant, good Indian Cooking class in the area, next to Ramada's Cafe which itself is a delightful place to visit.

title: wow
review: up where the Ganges start, mountains all around and your walk over a suspension bridge that has been there for 100's of years

title: Linear Laxmanjhula...
review: Coming back from Neelkanth Mahadev temple in our rented cab when we reached rishikesh the first attraction we experienced was laxmanjhula..Its a suspension bridge over ganga that connects both side of ganga at rishikesh and which can be crossed by foot or by motorcycle..Now we all know that it always feels nice to cross a river by boat or through any bridge...so standing on the middle of a bridge over ganga and watching the ganga descending from the mountains produces a mind-boggling feeling..Also you can see people doing rafting in ganga below which ends there at that point..some speedboats are also available for public ride from a small ghat somewhere down at the riverside..some multistoryed  temples including laxman temple, market for shopping, restaurants situated on both side of the bridge makes this place a real crowdy one which ultimately effects the bridge..The bridge is a very narrow (almost linear) one used not by people only but cows, motorcycles too..in addition to that monkeys are present to add to the hullaballo...As this bridge remains crowded all time you have to act in haste in order to take pics though some people ignore that resulting in more discomfort for others...Still you must visit Laxmanjhula as because it has religious history & that cant be ignored though the problems (already mentioned) can be…

title: Over the Ganga river
review: Laman Jhula is bridge cross the Ganga River. When you see  the Ganga river in the twilight on Laxman Jhula is so beautiful

title: great engineering
review: connects city of rishikesh with the , across the river , holier side of rishikesh ... the connecting lifeline . Hanging bridge , that is what it is across the ganga and the view of the river is awe inpiring

title: NICE PLACE!
review: I've been here 3 times, and I am still happy to there again. First and latest time had some cold timing, raining and windy, but at the day time nice sun (February). In late March it was horribly hot, and impossible to do anything at the day time, except taking cold showers and staying under fan.

title: Beautiful views over the Ganga
review: I had to cross the Laxman Jhula to get to Camp Wildex (on the "holier" side of Rishikesh). It is definitely a feat of engineering. The bridge itself is a beautifully-constructed metal suspension bridge, stretching over the River Ganges. The views from the bridge, however, are nothing short of breathtaking.

title: Scenic Beauty from Lakshman Jhula
review: Rishikesh, we visited on Feb 15th and stayed in Parmarth Niketan Ashram. You will get share rickshaws from the railway station to Lakshman Jhula ( Rs.10-15). View of Ganga is awesome and you can enjoy it from the Jhula. Daily trips are there to Neelkant Temple, which is around 25 kms from Lakshman Jula ( Rs.100 Per Head).

title: the most beautiful area in the area of RISHIKESH
review: No matter what you are , a writer, a  mediator , a seeker , a passerby , a tourist the areas around the LAXMAN JHULA has something for everyone. Just sit down by any of the small cafe's and restaurants lover looking the Ganges and see a transformation in you. The place could do with a litlle bit of cleaning up .

title: Not to be missed
review: It was crowded as I had found it to be many tears back.

title: Beware the Monkeys
review: If you want to get from one side of Rishikesh to the other, you're gonna need to use Lakshman Jhula. Just be careful that you don't take any open food across the bridge. The monkeys are MEAN. A great spot for pictures and viewing the scenery. The nearby area is extremely touristy, but enjoyable.

title: A crowded hanging bridge by day and a beauty at night over the Gabga
review: To cross the Jhoola in the day time is quite a circus, people who are busy posing for a picture with the Jhoola by photographers are totally unconcerned to the people wanting to cross the bridge. And it’s not all; there are prying eyes of mean monkeys watching everyone and waiting to snatch your belongings. But have patience, you will cross the bridge at the end with a experience to remember.. haha, but at night it is a sight to look at the Jhoola over the Ganga.... it is quite a sight.

title: Beware of the Monkeys
review: The roadside delicacies is a must try, bewrae of feeding the monkeys. Visit the Prachin mandir and the Rudraksh tree Darshan
