title: I love diversity...
review: And this is guaranteed in Laxman Jhula. The Ganges River shows all its beauty descending from the Hymalain mountains. It behaves like a real GOD. Laxman Jhula is full of temples, ashrams, pilgrims. It is a sacred land. The bridge crossing the river is shared by lots and lots of people, monkeys, cows, motocycles, bikes. And the Indian people love to take pictures over the bridge. It is amazing to rent a taxi and visit the temples spread all over the mountains. And a good guide can take you to sacred caves. And don't miss a rafting experience. Jump out the rafting boat and allow the tide to take you along the river. Wear your life jacket and enjoy!  Eat a "paneer dosa" with or without spice. You will never forget this little piece of the world.

title: Wow I loved everywhere in Rishikesh
review: Crossing the bridge gives an amazing view of the Ganga and its white sand beach (who would have thought), the bridge has a flow of its own and great folks to be met and enjoyed.

title: Good Attaraction
review: Its a good attraction near the 13 manzil temple but a bit crowded. Bikes are allowed on the brige and they are a big risk as lots of people are walking on the bridge at a time

title: Touristy kitsch but beautiful
review: A great place to pick up Tibetan goods, such as extremely cheap shawls, prayer flags etc.  Crossing the Jhula and dodging the cheeky macaques is also a lot of fun.

title: must visit destination at rishikesh
review: the trip to rishikesh is incomplete without a visit to laxman jhula

title: You cant ingonre the bridge, a must visit anyways
review: Ram Jhula and Lakshman Jhula are the 2 bridges one has to use while crossing the river Ganges. Lakshman Jhula is oldest and grandest of the two. It is a crowded bridge during the day because the locals use it. Also there are a lot of monkeys here. Some are the naughty ones, so beware of your belongings and do not carry anything in open which might be tempting for them.

title: Jhula disappointing
review: One would like to be there  for the spiritual value. Otherwise, it does not give you any feeling than a regular road. Tourists should not be allowed to ride motorbikes there. However, the reason for allowing motorbikes  is that the villagers have access to the other side only thru the Jhula. May be a system of issuing passes to them would solve the problem.

title: Spiritual and calm amidst the chaos
review: An interesting suspension bridge making for a fascinating experience as it seems that representations from the whole world are somehow with you.  I got a feeling as if I was on Noah’s ark.  Starting from people from all strata of society, your walking partners could be monkeys, cows, horses, dogs, birds, crows etc.  Would definitely recommend it - the feeling that you get when you are on this bridge is quite nice and despite the hustle and bustle you do feel the spirituality of the region.

title: Flexible bridge in Rishikesh
review: Rishikesh has many attractions but most famous may be Laxman Jhula. Jhula means flexible. This bridge is flexible bridge over Ganga river. Taxi drops you approx 1 km away from jhula. Taximan will tell you that there is government shop where you can purchase precious stones, Rudrakshas etc. at cheap rates. Beware ! You can walk down and get glimpses of Ganga river. There are different shops around for shopping experience. On this side, statue of Laxman (Lord ram's younger brother) can be seen.

title: Just lots of shops selling usual rubbish
review: Nothing special quite nice area on the river but filthy dirty of course.  Loads of shops selling usual stuff - nothing different or nice about it apart from the river

title: see the faces of rishikesh
review: cross this bridge and you will run accross a colorful lot of human characters . You can truly enjoy the face of this city and the sights from this bridge. try it .

title: Crowded with constant 2-wheeler traffic
review: you need to fight the crowd, 2 wheelers as well as cows to walk on the bridge and see the view from the bridge. It is more beautiful to see the bridge from the outside than being on it.

title: cute place nice food
review: Its a small busy place with people from all over the world in all forms and sizes. I enjoyed looking at people a lot. Its a destination for specific tourists, but even when your not into yoga and meditation, its fun to hang around here and do some arts and crafts shopping.

title: Nice view
review: Nice view of the river and the ghats, but the bikes and cycles passing on the small bridge don't let you stand and enjoy the view.

title: And the name is Lakshman Jhula (down with American spelling)
review: I have been there a few times and love it ... the people are wonderfully friendly and helpful, despite the throngs of Tourists who arrive periodically ... the indian pilgrims are neverending, and yes, the bridge does get crowded, but it is India, enjoy it.  What's the hurry?  To get to the other side?  :-)

title: Crowded
review: Crowded and dirty. The whole market area around this bridge left me wondering what spirituality is all about. Be careful where you step!!!

title: nice for a visit or just lay back
review: Laxman Jhula is a bit croudy but a nice place to enjoy a good breakfast or meal in the different restaurants. We just took some place and read a book or enjoy the view on the river or look at all the people passing by. Nice walk between the bridge from laxman Jhula to ram Jhula

title: nice place
review: nice place to visit and see the ghats little traffic like cycle and stuff, there are affordable shops if you want you can buy it from them

title: ancient idea executed in steel
review: idyllic viewing it from the Ganga, good for a walk but a bit overcrowded and sometimes the locals in two wheelers could be a bother

title: Its nice
review: Its nice..a lot of restaurants are also there.. Food tastes especially good in rishikesh !

title: What is the big deal, it is just a suspension bridge
review: Breaking News !!! Laxman Jhula is a suspension bridge !!! Though built for pedestrians it accommodates motor bikes, cycles and even cows. At the end of the day it is as good a suspension bridge as any in the world. Whats the fuss about ??

title: Engineering wonder
review: Its a bridge which is shaking. This used to create fantasy for me since childhood. It is worth to visit this bridge. It is connecting two parts of the city but you cannot go by vehicle (Car) via this bridge. If you wish to go other side of this bridge you have to travel 28 Kms in hilly and forest area almost 45 min travel to reach other end via car.

title: A congested bridge !!
review: Famous because of Hindu worshipers. An excellent work done by the civil engineers of that era. Quite congested all time from April to June. I wouldn't recommend to visit thid between April & June.

title: Great
review: There were monkeys snatching some articles. Just beware... :)

title: dissapointing
review: jhula is very poorly maintained by the goverment

title: Very Indian experience
review: Beware of monkeys, they could be a nuisance!! Its rewarding to walk on this age old suspension bridge and watch the time less flow of holy Ganges. Holy Ganges is equivalent to a deity for Hindus. I have been there many a times, there are number of shops, you can buy souvenirs at reasonable price.

title: hotel sk Regency Rishikesh
review: i tell u,i like the rishikesh is a very good stasion for holiday for two night,we enjoy rafting and laxman jhula and ram jhula,pooja all so , and hotel staff,food,location,over all is ok, rishikesh is very famus for trekking,rafting ,camping, adventure us , river is all so there,hills is all so very think is in rishikesh.you can come with famiy,friend,company tour

title: Beautiful, noisy and fullnof culture
review: Shops and people everywhere. A great place to spend the day. You'll find a taxi booth on one side of the bridge. A few temples around, and a lot of stores/shops. Many great cafes. Monkeys everywhere, which is really funny. Be careful on the bridge, as it gets crowded with cows, monkeys, motorbikes, trolleys and people. Full of life and culture.

title: great shopping
review: I wish I had more time to peruse the shops.  Lots to see and very pretty along the Ganges.

title: the best
review: its my favourite place in rishikesh, less crowded than ram jhula, full of nice hotels and awesome cafes, and not to mention shops where you get hippie clothes!

title: Great location to hang out and watch other backpackers
review: Nice place at the river side. You can buy a lot of stuff without shopowners getting aggressive in selling you it. Especially a good place to watch other backpackers and drink good coffee.

title: Must visit
review: The place has an awesome feel...must visit the German Bakery overlooking the ganges!

title: The classic view of Rishikesh
review: Well, what can you say? This is the classic tourist attraction and view of the area. Locals and tourists flock from near and afar to walk the bridge and have their photo taken on the bridge...

title: Overcrowded disorganised mess
review: Even though this place is supposed to be a must on a visit to Rishikesh, i would advice you to try the Ram Jhula instead. The access to this place is poor, all sorts of vehicles and animals are vying for a place on the narrow bridge that is the 'Jhula'. Nothing spiritual about this place. Avoid Avoiud Avoid.

title: Sacred Place
review: Nice shopping stalls on affordable prices. People are nice out there Helpful and you can see a lot of tourist coming from abroad. Nice play to peek into. Aspen Camps rishikesh also took us through the Laxman Jhula which was surprisingly good for the people who have not seen it before

title: Evergreen attraction!
review: I have been visiting Laxman Jhula every time we visit Rishikesh and this time also we made it a point to see the place. It seems that the shops and markets around the place keep on increasing with time and we saw several new places. The bridge itself is nice as ever and it feels great to stand in the center and feel the nice breeze of the Ganga anytime. The slightly difficult part was to negotiate the scooters/motorcycles and the crowd which kept milling around us.

title: great shopping and people watching
review: You can experience all of India in one place. The shopping is fantastic as well. You see everything in Laxman Jhula, from  the snake charmer, cows ands dogs,sadhus, the Ganga, pilgrims, colourful saris to everything that saturates your senses.

title: Fascinating corner of India
review: The bridge itself is fascinating: a suspension bridge traversed by a chaotic mix of village women in colorful saris, holy men, obnoxious honking teens on motor scooters and aggressive monkeys.  In other words, an authentic slice of India!  Check out the action from the balcony of the German Bakery.

title: Area is safe and beautiful
review: The lax man Khios area has plenty of vege restaurants and coffee houses.plus,excellent yoga and ashrams.money changes are there as well,and plenty

title: Rishikesh: Is this heaven, may be it is....
review: What a lovely day it was. Specially the time we spent in Rishikesh near the Laxman Jhula.

title: A lovely leisurely wander
review: During our short time in Rishikesh, we wandered over this bridge and it's surrounding areas a good few times. I would say it's quite relaxing and leisurely, but only once you get over the constant crowds and beeping of motorbikes and all the people staring at you.

title: Great town for Food and Shops
review: Some great restaurants and plenty of shops.  Great photo's ops on the bridge.

title: Must Visit
review: A lovely vibrant little area with cafes, restaurants and shops. Good food, cheap hotels and a bit of spirituality if inclined all found within walking distance.

title: Must visit in Rishikesh
review: Beautiful View of the Ganges !!!! It is one of the most well known places in Rishikesh. Infact It's a symbol that depicts rishikesh. It's an old narrow bridge overlooking the mountains surrounding the flowing Ganges. Watch out for monkeys though who come straight for any eatables that you are holding. It is better to just give it to them, and they are happy and leave you alone.

title: Just a normal foot and two-wheeler bridge
review: Honestly, I didn't find anything extraordinary in this bridge (nor in its counterpart over at Ram Jhoola). It is bustling with a myriad varied activities on both sides, and there are temples and small shops close to this bridge that one might be interested in.

title: Interesting bridge with bustling neighbourhood
review: Its an interesting experience to be on a bridge thts abou t no more than 5 feet wide but has a few hundred people and a few bikes on it. The view is nice but more interesting I found the area near i on both sides bustling with activity, street side food, restaurants of different types etc. Its almost on every one's visit list and recommend all to walk around this area and enjoy the activity.

title: Shopping, walking, caffés
review: Nice area to just hang around - see all the small shops, have a cake at the german bakery above the bridge, watch other people...

title: Bridge over Ganges to other bank
review: Huge bridge, all manner of people and vehicles travel over it. Dramatic place to take pics from.

title: Lovely steel bridge
review: We really enjoyed walking through the jula. We are disappointed that numerous scooters and motorcycles have made this their highway. They have not patience and demand right of way. This needs to stop. Noticed a mother and child walking across the jula and scooters demanding they move. There was no place to move as it was very busy

title: Crowded!
review: The great part about Lakshman Jula is its history.  The worst part is that they allow motor cycles to use the Lakshman Jula to cross to the other side!  I thought it was a pre-posterous idea, especially since it is such an important tourist attraction.  I was petrified to even walk on the Jula since there were times when two motorcycles were running abreast and there was one coming on the opposite side!  It is the usual case of "sab chaltha hain"

title: Nice bridge. Loud, chaotic neighborhood.
review: The Laxman Jhula Bridge is a foot bridge, usually really crowded with a crazy mix of tourists, pilgrims, a few locals, obnoxious motor scooters and profiteering monkeys. (do not cross the bridge with food, the monkeys WILL come for you! Be careful about glasses too, I heard.) If you're in town it's worth checking out, but don't come to Rishikesh just for this.

title: Yogi Backpacker's Paradise
review: This is a great little town full of shops catering to the hippie/backpacker/bargain hunter.  The shops have great deals on authentic Indian, Tibetan and Nepalese crafts, statues and clothing.  You can also get real mountain gear here -- good backpacks, sleeping bags, hammocks.

title: Fantastic views
review: The Ganges and the Himalayas foothills adorn the temples, ashrams, budget hotels, cafés, restaurants and shops, all can be seen from this beautiful pedestrian suspension bridge. Watch out for the fast motorcycles that are not supposed to be there.

title: Vacation time
review: Loved the bridge and the walk down to bridge via small alleyways surrounded with small shops. It was heavily windy at the bridge but a beautiful experience to walk across the mighty river Ganges! Full of people, walking, singing, dancing. It has the potential to develop as a beautiful hamlet like that of European county side fares, if the authorities and shopkeepers can invest a bit in cleanliness and order.

title: Must Visit
review: Super view of mountains and ganga river .. love the german bakery here. sunset time is the best to have tea or coffee here. very peaceful place.

title: Well maintained, joining two ends
review: The Jhula joins two ends of the city, it looks very beautiful in the evening with all the lights lit up.

title: Walking & Gawking
review: Look around and if you are careful/persistent you might get a good deal.traffic and honking horns are an irritant but can be ignored.do look out for hidden ashrams/temples.

title: Nice town for Panchakarma
review: I stayed in Tapovan, within walking distance to Laxman Jhula, for panchakarma at Maharishi Ayurveda. I enjoyed the ease of walking. Took a while to get used to the street etiquette. If you walk on the left side, let the cows do whatever they want, and have ear plugs for all the honking, the walks are enjoyable.

title: Fantastic views
review: The gangs and the Himalayas foothills adorn the temples,ashram,budget hotels,cafes,restaurant shops all can be seen from this beautiful pedestrian ..

title: Unforgettable
review: This is like a very important vein in Rishikesh, a place where not only people, scooters, cows cross the bridge but also a place where the monkeys take place to watch the passing traffic. Never boring.

title: Awesome experience
review: Enjoyed lovely people and movements of Jhula

review: Loved the bridge and the walk down to bridge via small alleyways surrounded with small shops. It was heavily windy at the bridge but a beautiful experience to walk across the mighty river Ganges! Full of people, walking, singing, dancing. It has the potential to develop as a beautiful hamlet like that of European county side fares, if the authorities and shopkeepers can invest a bit in cleanliness and order.

title: Nice town for Panchakarma
review: I stayed in Tapovan, within walking distance to Laxman Jhula, for panchakarma at Maharishi Ayurveda. I enjoyed the ease of walking. Took a while to get used to the street etiquette. If you walk on the left side, let the cows do whatever they want, and have ear plugs for all the honking, the walks are enjoyable.

review: The gangs and the Himalayas foothills adorn the temples,ashram,budget hotels,cafes,restaurant shops all can be seen from this beautiful pedestrian ..
